loans.name: Oyminos

texts.ru: Ойминос замужняя женщина в возрасте 41 года. Она вместе с мужем активно занимается растениеводством. Сын тоже помогает в деятельности родителей. Их семья занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культурой более 8 лет. Они в основном выращивают пшеницу, бахчевую культуру и овощи. В данный момент на их земле посеяна пшеница и арбуз. Чтобы к лету получить хороший и качественный урожай, необходимо их обработать минеральными удобрениями. В связи с этим Ойминос просит кредит для купли минеральных удобрений и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Oyminos is a 41-year old married woman. She and her husband are active in growing farm produce. Their son also helps out in the business. Their family has been in agriculture for over eight years. They mainly grow wheat, melons, watermelons, and vegetables. At present they have wheat and watermelon sown on their land. In order to have a plentiful and high-quality harvest by the summer, they need to use mineral fertilizers. This is why Oyminos is applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. She is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for growing wheat and watermelons.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 56 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Epefania is taking out a housing loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Epefania has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Epefania can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. Conchita is married, and has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of firewood to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Bordaje

texts.en:
Bordaje is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing and cosmetics business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell  for her buy and sell ready to wear clothing and cosmetics business.

Bordaje has been in this business for 22 years. Bordaje earns additional income from raising pigs.

Bordaje has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44-years-old and married with one child who is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lydia has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Felomena

texts.en:
Felomena is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felomena is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Felomena's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regaining what she lost. Felomena is taking out a PHP 8,500 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Felomena has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jake

texts.en: Edilberto is a married man who sells grocery goods in his village to make a living, with the help of his wife. The income from this business helps him provide his family with a better living. Edilberto also sells some grocery goods in the market. He says, he is satisfied with his business’s income since he has many loyal customers who visit his place to make purchases. He is asking for a loan in order to buy more grocery goods to sell. In the future, he wants to improve his business to reach his dream of improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria, 48 years of age, is married to a welder and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store for almost seven years and earns a net income of PHP 250 a day. Her net proceeds are usually spent on her family's daily expenses. Due to the lack of capital to run her retail store, she would like to request a loan amount of PHP 35,000 to purchase beverages, chips, noodles, eggs, candies, breads, shampoo, rice grains, soy sauce, canned goods, vinegar, fish sauce, and sugar to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, chips, noodles, eggs, candies, breads, shampoo, rice grains, soy sauce, canned goods, vinegar, fish sauce, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Susan is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina had been in her buy and sell business for many years. With her generated income, she was able to sustain their living and has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for the business. She is now engaged in her retailing business selling grocery goods in their village and she earns better income from this. To increase sales, Monina took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods for additional inventory capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en: Shamigul was born in 1963. She is married and has 1 child. Shamigul’s husband is a driver. They live together in the south Tajikistan in a rural area. She has been busy growing watermelons, tomatoes and cucumber for many years. She has great experience. She works hard from the early morning hours on her land; she is happy with her job. Shamigul must sow new seeds but she has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for them. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 47 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Cynthia has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eden works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Eden is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a farmer who lives in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya with her spouse and 3 children, all of whom are of school-going age.  She has been practicing farming for the past 6 years with her primary source of income being milk, eggs and a variety of crops.  She also has a retail business.  In farming, she loves milking the most, but her major challenge is looking after sick animals.

Dinah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are quick in processing loans for its clients.  During the training, she learned about co-guarantee mechanisms.  She says that through this loan, she will build a zero grazing unit which will enable her cattle to produce more milk.  This will be a source of income and better diet for her family.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah is a 25-year-old female living in Masindi, Uganda. She has a beauty salon that sells cosmetics on a highway. Hadijah started the business so as to earn a living. She wishes to build a house for her family, but she is challenged with inadequate capital. Hadijah is a hard working woman who needs a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Munkh-Ochir

texts.en: Munkh-Ochir is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the eastern-most town of Mongolia. He has been working as a welder at a private firm since 2012. His wife renders taxi services to locals. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants will be released into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Zoriada

texts.en: Zoriada has been helping her husband harvest and sell farm-raised fish to make a living. With her generated income, she was able to sustain their living and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying additional fingerlings to raise. Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase additional fingerlings to raise. She always supports her husband in making their business a success in order ensure a better income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fingerlings to raise

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en: Zebiniso is caring mother of 4 children. She is married. Zebibiso is 27 years old. She began her animal husbandry business 7 years ago. She feeds cows. She buys cows, feeding them for some months and selling them in a local market. Little by little she develops her business. She is the main breadwinner of the family. Her husband has no job. He is going to go to Russia to find a job. Zebiniso hopes that her husband will find any job in Russia and her living conditions will be better. Now, they do not have money to buy an air ticket. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy an air ticket for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her husband

loans.name: Elineta

texts.en:
Elineta is 48 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Elineta has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Elineta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and works hard to earn for her future.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Edna has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Edna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en: Rusudan is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives in Ambrolauri district with her husband, 9-year-old daughter and mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow potatoes and tomatoes. Rusudan is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. Rusudan decided to open a food market and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 GEL. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family, as Rusudan will be involved in her own business and will have a stable income. Rusudan awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market

loans.name: Gabriela De La Paz

texts.es:
El primer rayo de luz matinal abre las puertas de la pequeña farmacia de Gabriela.  Es una señora carismática, motivadora y responsable. Tiene 32 años de edad, es una mujer soltera, originaria de la ciudad de León. Por más de tres años ha mantenido el negocio de los productos farmacéuticos, el cual inició con capital propio. Ella ha proporcionado una buena atención a su clientela para que estos le sean siempre fieles.
Gabriela solicita el crédito para hacer crecer su negocio, es decir, aumentar el número de los productos; comprar desde pastillas, tales como dorival, tabcin y dolofin, hasta medicamentos para la tos, el malestar estomacal, entre otros. Ella pone su confianza en el préstamo, ya que una de sus objetivos es ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos a los consumidores, lo cual generé un alto crecimiento en la producción. Su plan futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
The first ray of morning sun opens the windows of Gabriela's small pharmacy. She is a charismatic, motivating and responsible woman. She is 32 years old and is a single woman, a native of the city of León. For more than three years, she has been running her pharmaceutical products business, which she started with her own capital. She has been very attentive to her customers so that they will always be loyal to her.

Gabriela is requesting the loan in order to help her business grow- that is to say, to increase the number of products; and to purchase pills, such as Dorival, Tabcin and Dolofin, and cough and upset-stomach medications, among others. She is putting her trust in the loan, since one of her goals is to offer a wider variety of products to the consumers, which will generate higher production growth. Her future plan is to improve the condition of her home in order to offer better service.

loans.use: to purchase pills, such as Dorival, Tabcin and Dolofin, and cough and upset-stomach medicines, among others.

loans.name: Kiedoiningnin Group

texts.fr:
Mme EBOU est responsable du groupe KIEDOININGNIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 29ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. Personne ne  va  à l’école. Elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme est gérante d’un kiosque depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les caves en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter 10caisses de boissons, 10tables et 20chaises pour son kiosque.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un terrain (parcelle).
texts.en:
Ebou is the representative of the KIEDOININGNIN group.  She is married and the mother of five children.  Her oldest child is 29 years old and her youngest is 17.  None of her children go to school.  Ebou also has one other dependent.

Ebou has been managing a small bar for the past ten years.  She buys her supplies from wine cellars in the city.  She wants to buy ten crates of drinks, ten tables and 20 chairs for her bar.  She plans to reinvest her profits into her business.  Her goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of drinks, ten tables and 20 chairs for her bar.

loans.name: Mougnoussin Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MOUGNOUSSIN ont en moyenne  45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies SANTORO II l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et produits divers. Les femmes du groupe MOUGNOUSSIN sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire. SOMIE  femme  debout au milieu  sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 500 Kg de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The MOUGNOUSSIN group consists of women who, on average, are 45 years old with four children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in SANTORO II, one of the neighborhoods of the city of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through family ties and are involved in buying and selling grains and other various products.  This is their first solidarity loan.  Somie, the featured borrower, plans to use her loan to buy 500 kilos of millet.  In the photo, she is standing in the back row, in the middle of the group.  She buys her merchandise locally as well as in surrounding villages.  She sells to both men and women who pay her in cash and also often on credit.

Somie is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 19,000 CFA francs which will be used to cover health related expenses, to buy food and pay school tuition fees.  She will reinvest the rest of the money into her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire. KOROTIMI 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 jouets d’enfant, 10 chemises, 15 paires de chaussure en plastique, 30 jupes et 2 cartons d’eau de javel. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 27 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The TIESSIRI group consists of women who, on average, are 35 years old with three children each. They all live in extended traditional families in YANGASSOU/SEGOU (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through family ties and are involved in buying and selling condiments, grains and other various goods. This is their sixth solidarity loan and all their previous loans have been duly repaid. 

Korotimi, second from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 30 children's toys, 10 shirts, 15 pairs of plastic shoes, 30 skirts and two boxes of bleach.  She buys her goods in San and sells to both men and women who pay her in cash and also often on credit.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 27,000 CFA francs which will be used to cover health related expenses, to buy clothes and pay school tuition fees. She will reinvest the rest of the money into her business.

loans.use: to buy some children's toys, shirts, plastic shoes, skirts and two boxes of bleach.

loans.name: Wend La Tenda Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLARISSE est responsable du groupe WEND LA TENDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme prépare et vend la bière de mil et aussi du bois depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages.
Elle veut s’acheter 10sacs de mil germés et 01 camion de bois.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un terrain (parcelle).
texts.en:
Clarisse is the representative of the WEND LA TENDA group.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 7 years old and her youngest is 4.  One of her children goes to school.  She also supports two additional persons.

For the past three years, Clarisse has been preparing and selling millet beer and wood.  She buys her goods in surrounding villages.  She wants to buy ten bags of millet sprouts and one truckload of wood.

She plans to use her profits to reinvest in her business.  Her goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of millet sprouts and one truckload of wood.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

He is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for his food vending business.

Eduardo has been in this business for nine years. He earns more income from raising livestock.

He successfully paid back his previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build his business.

Eduardo has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams of building and expanding his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his food production business

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is a jolly farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya with his wife and two children, both of school going age. He has been farming for the past eight years with his primary income source being milk, crops, offering transportation services and a retail business. He enjoys farming because the income he gets in return is very good, but his biggest challenge is low prices on farm products and bad weather in some seasons.

Davis chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they deal with small scale farmers by giving them agricultural solutions. During the training he learnt how this loan can help him in developing and improving their living standards. With this loan there will be increased milk production for consumption and for sale and also it will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Kristina Airene

texts.en:
Ma. Kristina Airene is 27 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ma. Kristina Airene has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Ma. Kristina Airene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a forty-five year old widow. She is single and charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children, all of whom attend school. She started farming six years ago with the aim of earning a living and sustaining her family after the death of her husband. She hopes to educate her children but is challenged by seasonal changes and poor roads that make her service delivery difficult. Grace needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Johanna  Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  4 años de edad, actualmente está en su séptimo mes de embarazo. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Johanna es una mujer que le gusta generara sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudara a su familia a salir adelante, ella desde hace 5 años  empezó a vender  ropa, después con la ayuda de los créditos también empezó a vender cosméticos que es lo que vende actualmente y que le deja muy buenos ingresos para el bien de su familia, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual sale a vender de forma ambulante repuestos y accesorios de teléfonos, ella realiza sus ventas puerta a puerta aunque actualmente con su estado mas vende en su casa. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cosméticos y accesorios de teléfonos. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Ella sueña con tener a su bebé y darles lo mejor a su hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank "Sol Naciente" meets in the San Pedro neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited all year long by many national and foreign tourists.  It is also one of the most important port cities of the Americas on the Pacific Coast.

This is where Johanna, 29, lives.  She is married and has a four-year-old son, and currently seven months pregnant.  Her husband is a merchant.

Johanna is a woman who likes to earn her own income and help the family get ahead.  Five years ago she started selling clothing and with the help of a loan began selling cosmetics, which she does now.  It is a way of earning a good income for the family and she also gives part of the loan to her husband so he can work as a street peddlar selling telephone parts and accessories.  She sells goods door to door but in her current state sells more from home.

This loan is to buy clothing, cosmetics and telephone accessories.  She has been a member of the communal bank for five loan cycles and she likes using the loans to finance her business.  Her dream is to have her baby and giver her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Nancy Marinela

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 28 años de edad, está divorciada  y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años que estudian en escuela.
Doña Nancy para salir adelante  sin depender de nadie se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha sus ratos libres y fines de semana que no trabaja, ya que ella también trabaja en un almacén de ropa de niños por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, razón por lo cual ella aprovecha para vender solo cuando no está trabajando, además ya tiene muy buena clientela que le pide mercadería. Lleva 5  años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual está sacando adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños que es lo que más vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank "Sol Naciente" meets in the San Pedro neighborhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited all year long by many national and foreign tourists. It is also one of the most important port cities of the Americas on the Pacific Coast.

This is where Nancy, 28, lives.  She is divorced and has two children, ages seven and four who attend school.  So as not to depend on anyone, Nancy sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis.  She uses her free time and weekends to do this since she also works at a children's clothing shop and earns a monthly salary.  So she only sells her goods when she is not working.  She has a very good customer base that requests merchandise and she has been in this business for five years, providing for her children.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts and children's clothing, which are the items that sell the most.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes how helpful the loans are.  Her dream is to give the best she can to her little ones.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is a 65-year-old married woman from a small village in the Lanchkhuti district. Tamar lives with her husband and daughter. The family has a small plot of land where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts seasonally. Tamar and her husband decided to build a greenhouse and grow vegetables. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2000 to build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, Tamar will grow vegetables and will sell the harvested vegetables at a good price. Tamar thinks that the business will be profitable and she is very motivated to work hard and ensure a good harvest. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es: Martha de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus padres y sus dos hijos, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha, 34, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her parents and her two children.  She is well known in the area where she lives because of her humbleness and dedication to work.  She has never waivered in the face of adversity and has always overcome difficulty.  Through effort and hard work she runs a store where she sells essential items such as basic grains, milk, eggs, rice and others.  She is very dedicated to her work and helpful when selling, so customers seek her out because they prefer to buy her products.

Due to an increase in demand she needs to stock more inventory and does not have the capital to do so.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, instant product, sweets, beverages, etc.  She prays the loan will be approved so she will not have to worry about maintaining the household.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant products, sweets, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Daniel Diego

texts.es:
Diego tiene 21 años, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos. El y su familia, viven en casa de su mama. Diego se dedica a  conducir un bicitaxi, desde hace 3 años, al inicio se lo daban a trabajar pero con el tiempo lo compro porque dice que se dio cuenta que es buen negocio,  si es que lo sabes trabajar. 
Ya adquirio unos permisos y después compro el remolque, ahora esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar la otra motocicleta. El quiere comprar la motocicleta y dársela a alguien a  trabajar lo que lo ayudará a tener mas ingresos. Diego se dedica a trasportar a la gente de su vivienda a su trabajo o a donde ellos quieran, dice que su vehículo es un tanto ecológico y con costo accesible. Su reto es adquirir mas unidades he ir creciendo como flotilla.
texts.en:
Diego, 21, is married and has two children.  He and his family live with his mother, and he has been in business for three years driving a bicitaxi.  He used to borrow one for work but over time was able to buy his own after realizing how good a business it was.  So this is his line of work.

He obtained the permits and bought a sidecar.  The loan he is requesting now is to buy another motorcycle.  He wants to buy one and rent it out to earn more income.  Diego transports people from their home to the workplace or wherever they want.  He says his vehicle is eco-friendly and low-cost.  His goal is to buy more vehicles and expand his fleet.

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado bovino, adicional a eso también se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, Blanca esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganado, vitamina y concentrado y así seguir con la crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Blanca, 57, has been raising cattle for several years.  She also grows and sells corn and beans to provide for her family.  She lives in her own home with her husband and children.  Blanca is requesting a loan to buy more cattle, vitamins and animal feed so she can continue her line of work which is her only source of income.  This is to give her family a more stable economy.

loans.use: To buy more cattle, vitamins and animal feed.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA ont en moyenne  41 ans, 3enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DAELLAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des légumes.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire. AWA  2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ; compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de tomate, 30Kg d’oignon, 25Kg de Sel, 10 paquets de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djantoyerela group are on average aged 41 years and have three children. They all live in extended traditional families in Daellan/Segou (in the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
These women met through family ties and work in the commerce of condiments and vegetables. They have repaid all their previous loans and this is the fourth solidarity loan for the women of the Djantoyerela group. Awa, who is the second standing from left to right in the photo; plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes, 30kg of onions, 25kg of salt, and 10 packets of Maggi cubes. She buys her stock locally and in the surrounding villages. She sells her merchandise to a mixed clientele for cash and often for credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 11 000FCFA which she will use to pay for healthcare, food, clothing and school fees and she will re-invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Wassomagni Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe WASSOMAGNI ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales, des produits cosmétiques et des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe WASSOMAGNI sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire. AWA 2ème femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30Kg de riz, 10Kg de fonio, 15Kg de haricot, 15Kg de mil, 5Kg d’oignon, 20Litres d’huile et 5 paquets de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes(plats alimentaires), à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Wassomagni Group average 35 years of age and 4 children. They all live in extended traditional families in Yangasso / Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through bonds of kinship.

They buy and sell condiments, cereals, cosmetics, and various products. After having repaid their previous loans without problems, they are seeking their sixth solidarity loan (group loan).

Awa, the second woman from the left in the sitting row in the photograph, intends to use her loan to buy 30 kg of rice, 10 kg of fonio (a kind of millet), 15 kg of bean, 15 kg of millet, 5 kg of onion, 20 liters of cooking oil, and 5 packs of Maggi bouillon cubes. 

She gets her supplies locally, and sells the dish she prepares, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both women and men. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, bean, millet, onions, cooking oil, and bouillon cubes

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont en moyenne  45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DAELLAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15Kg de piment, 25Kg d’oignon, 20Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognogotala group are on average 45 years old with three children and all live in extended traditional families in Daellan/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali)
These women came to know each other through family ties and work in the commerce of condiments. Having repaid their previous loans, this is the fourth solidarity loan for the women of the Kotognogotala group. Bintou, who is the first person standing up from the left towards the right in the photo; plans to use her loan to buy 15kg of chili, 25 kg of onions, 20 litres of oil. She buys her stock at San. She sells her merchandise to a mixed clientele of men and women for cash and often for credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 11 000 FCFA, which she will use for healthcare, food and clothing expenses and school fees. She will re-invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Book Xaalat Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BOOK XALAAT  est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 6 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois que le  besoin se présente.   Elles pratiquent diverses activités. La présente Fatou, celle qui a levé la main sur la photo évolue dans la commercialisation des friperies. Elle a une expérience de plus de 2 ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels.  Elle sollicite ce montant  pour acheter et vendre des friperies. A l’avenir elle souhaite d’autres financement pour fructifier son commerce et satisfaire ses clients. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Book Xalaat Group is made up of six women. They all live in the same neighborhood, and get together each time the need arises. The run various businesses.

Fatou, the woman raising her hand in the photograph, sells secondhand clothing. She has more than two years of experience in this field, and starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes it at 6 p.m.

Except for her personal needs, she doesn't have specific expenses to cover. She's seeking this loan to buy secondhand clothing.

In the future, she wishes to obtain additional funding to grow her business and satisfy her customers. Thusly, she will be able to increase her income and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to resell at the market

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe NIETA ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DAELLAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des  condiments et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire. KADIA 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10Kg de riz, 5Kg de haricot, 5Kg d’oignon, 5 Litres d’huile, et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et à SAN.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in Nieta Group average 40 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Daellan / Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell condiments and cereals. After having repaid their previous loans without problems, they are now seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Kadia, the woman standing on the left in the photograph, intends to use her loan to buy 10 kg of rice, 5 kg of bean, 5 kg of onion, 5 liters of cooking oil, and one pack of Maggi bouillon cubes.

She gets her supplies locally and in San. She sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both women and men. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 9'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, bean, onions, cooking oil, and bouillon cubes

loans.name: Baye Niasse Group

texts.fr: BAYE NIASSE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 6 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le  même quartier et qui font pratiquement le même métier de commerce et se réunissent à chaque fois de nécessité. Madame Houley est leur présidente, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle a une expérience de 20 ans et demande ce montant pour  acheter et vendre des légumes, thè et sucre. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 59 ans, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. Houleye voudrait à l’avenir renforcer son activité et augmenter ses revenus et cela grâce aux crédits de l’institution. Elle pense aussi épargner de l’argent.
texts.en:
Baye Niasse Group is made up of six women who all live in the same neighborhood. They get together each time the need arises. They run very similar retail businesses.

Mrs. Houley, the woman raising her hand in the photograph, is the group's president. She has 20 years of experience. She's seeking this loan to buy and sell vegetables, tea, and sugar.

She's 59 years old, married, and the mother of a family. She helps her husband cover the daily expenses of the family. She starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes it at 6 p.m.

In the future, she would like to strengthen her business and increase her income, thanks to the loans from the MFI. She also intends to put money away.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tea, and sugar

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro de 47 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica compra y venta de cerdos, en sus casa de habitación y por encargo. El dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de  cerdos en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Pedro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro, 47, is married and has one young son.  He lives in Sauce, in the north of the region.  He is a responsible, hard-working man with high hopes for a better life.  He wasn't able to finish school, sadly, because his family didn't have the resources for him to continue.  He's had to work instead from very early in order to support himself and his family.  
Thanks to hard work and a drive to get ahead, Pedro has built a business buying and selling pigs, some of which he raises himself and others that he buys and resells.  He works at the business eight hours a day, every day.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for the supplies he needs to carry on the business.  The investment will, he says, lead to a larger income in the not very distant future.  Pedro is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and the opportunities their loans provide to people in poor countries like Nicaragua.  The loans allow people like him to build better lives.

loans.use: to support his animals sales business.

loans.name: Juan Victorino

texts.es: Juan de 49 años de edad vive en casa de un tio con sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y  fríjol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Juan solicita un crédito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Juan, 49, and his two children live with an uncle.  He has grown maize and beans for many years and his experience has taught him a thing or two about farming.  He sells his crop in local grain markets and uses the earnings to cover the family's expenses.  Juan is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs for his next crop.  He needs fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies to prepare the land--the land pictured in Juan's photo--for planting.  The investment will improve his chances for a good harvest and, in turn, a better family income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Deisi Charito

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Diesi, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  7 y 3  años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Deisi es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo ganar algo por su cuenta y con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido con ciertos gastos que generan la educación y crianza de sus hijos, ella en sociedad con unan amiga tienen un local en Manta en el cual venden productos naturales, ellas trabajan por turnos ella en la mañana y su socia en la tarde así ella puede pasar más tiempo con sus hijos y ayudarle a su hijo con las tareas de la escuela  ya que para ella su familia es lo más importante.
Este crédito es para compra productos naturales. Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y los créditos. Ella sueña tener un local propio ya que arriendan y esto se le lleva buena parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Sol Naciente community bank meets twice a month in the San Pedro neighborhood of Manta, a city on Ecuador's Pacific coast.  The city is an important port and a popular tourist destination for both nationals and foreigners who come here to make the most of its beautiful beaches.  
Sra. Diesi, 43, lives here with her husband and two children, 7- and 3-years old, respectively.  Her husband is a teacher and her oldest child is now in school.
Doña Deisi is a very determined woman who wants to work and build a business so that she can help her husband with the family's expenses and the raising and education of their children.  She and a friend have a shop in Manta where they sell natural products.  The two women take turns, she working the business every morning and her friend, every afternoon.  Doña Deisi says that her family is the most important thing for her and the arrangement with her friend allows her to spend more time with her children and help her son with his school work.  
Doña Deisi will use this loan to stock her natural products business.  She joined the community bank two years ago and likes the help and access to borrowing it provides.  For the future, she would like to buy a shop--the one she has now is rented--so that she can save what she pays in rent.

loans.use: to stock her natural products business.

loans.name: Lorenza De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lorenza de 52 años de edad vive con sus cuatro hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Lorenza es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en: Lorenza, 52, and her four children live in a house that she owns.  She owns a business, making and selling tortillas, that she operates in a space in her house.  She has operated the business for many years and says that it is successful because she delivers a good product and has a smile on her face for one and all.  She's a whiz in the kitchen, too, and serves up her tortillas in record time.  Lorenza has faith in hard work and says that the most important battles in life are the ones we fight every day to reach our goals.  She is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan because she is committed to the battle.  She will use the funds she borrows to buy bulk supplies of maize so that she can carry on her business.  She says the investment will help to secure her family's economic future.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of maize for food sales business.

loans.name: Kelvin Francisco

texts.es: Kelvin de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, kelvin esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Kelvin, 30, and his family live in a house that he owns.  He has an auto repair and painting business that he has operated from a space in his house for 10 years.  His income from the business covers his family's expenses.  Kelvin is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--paint, varnish, sealer, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will help him earn the income he needs to provide his family with an ever-better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Gilma Guadalupe

texts.es: Gilma de 34 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Gilma vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual vende de forma mabulante por los mercados y colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, peñas, etc. por mayor ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Gilma is 34 years old and is a very hard-working person, who devotes herself fully to her business, with the sole aim of succeeding, so that she can give her family a better life. Gilma lives with her husband and her four children in her own home. She has had a mobile business selling fruit and vegetables in markets and communities close to where she lives for many years. Her husband helps her with the business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale papayas, bananas, pineapples and other fruit and vegetables, as this will enable her to sell more, which is her priority, since this is the way she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale papayas, bananas, pineapples and other fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Leny works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as soft drinks, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Leny has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soft drinks, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is thirty-six-year old male living in Masindi, Uganda. He has a bar and lodge business in Bweyale town. The general public are his major clients. 

Robert's dream is to have a permanent home in Bweyale despite the challenges of competition. Robert is a hard-working man and is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 63 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Carmelita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 61 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Amparo has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns other income from buying and selling fish.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Efleda

texts.en:
Efleda is 47 years old and widowed with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Efleda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a resident of Kitale in North Rift, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and three children. He enjoys farming and has been doing it for six years. His primary income source is milk, crops, transportation services and a retail business. He enjoys milking and feeding his cows, while his biggest challenges are disease, low prices on farm produce and drought.

Hillary chose Juhudi Kilimo because, with the loan, he can acquire a dairy cow. Because of this loan, he will be able to provide a better education for his children by sending them to better schools.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Honorine Tifu

texts.en:
Honorine is married and a mother of two. They live in a two-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate capital to carry out her business, the death of her parents, who were very supportive, and inadequate finance to educate her children and provide them with basic necessities.

With this new loan, she will expand her call box business by buying airtime cards for resale, purchase more items like bread, sweet drinks, sweets and biscuits for her store and also buy and rear livestock such as fowl, pigs and goats. She holds a positive view of this businesses succeeding because she has been doing it for a while and has experience. Her business is situated at a strategic point where demand is high, and she has regular customers. She will make sure she provides for their needs and at a lower price. Also the droppings from her livestock will serve as fertilizer for her farm.

With the profit from this loan, she will expand her business, provide basic necessities to her children with the little support she has from her husband, educate her children and buy a plot of land. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy general store items and livestock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old, married, and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been pig fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dudi

texts.en:
Dudi runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Dudi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Dudi is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Dudi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Yayat

texts.en:
Yayat runs a small stall that sells snacks and  mobile phone airtime credits. Yayat lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Yayat is married and lives with six people in the family house.

Yayat began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar was born in 1986. She is divorced and has a son who is five years old. She is the sole support of her son, as her former husband doesn’t help her. 

Nilufar works hard to earn a living. She began her own business selling clothes three years ago. She sells her goods in a local market. She has regular customers. Every month Nilufar goes to the central market to buy new goods. 

She wants to repair her house, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of $2,500 to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Hebun

texts.en:
Hebun owns a small bangle shop in Parandih village of Deoghar district in Jharkhand, India. Parandih village is inhabited by a minority community and has around 100 houses with five to six people in each. This village has no electricity or sanitation. The only source of water is the hand pumps, which are not proper for drinking.

Hebun lives in a large joint family along with her son and three daughters. She has made a conscious effort to give education to her girls, who are studying at a nearby school. Her husband is a mason and also works in a brick manufacturing company. Her son works in a bangle factory.
 
Hebun has a heart problem and visits the hospital every month. Her husband started this small shop six months ago for his wife so they could afford her medical expenses. She sells cosmetic products at the shop along with traditional bangles that are in good demand during the Indian wedding season.
 
Hebun is a strong woman who wants to be self-sufficient despite her sickness. She sells in the shop as well as in the local market twice a week and also in the nearby villages.

She earns around Rs. 150 to 200 per day and their family income is not sufficient to provide a good livelihood. As the village is accessible by road, she has a good market for the coming wedding season of April through June. Thus she wants to borrow funds of Rs. 8,000 to buy more bangles in bulk and expand her business to provide for the girls' education and her healthcare.

loans.use: to buy bangles and cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8  hijos, 7 mayores de edad y la menor de 12 años que estudia en colegio, 4 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Sonia con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos los mismos que le permiten ayudarle  a su marido a afrontar los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja con la ayuda de una de sus hijas que es la que mas sale a vender mientras ella vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de algún producto o prenda, ya son 4 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo que lo utiliza para los estudios de su hija. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio y aprovecha las ofertas. Sus sueños es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the Sol Naciente credit group meet in the San Pedro neighbourhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, popular with both national and foreign tourists throughout the year, and for being one of the biggest ports in the country and America, located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean. 

Señora Sonia lives here. She is 53 years old and is married, with eight children. Seven of these are grown-ups, ,and the youngest is 12 years old and studies at school. Four of them still live at home. Her husband is a mechanic.

In order to make her own income so that she can help her husband to pay the household expenses, Sonia works selling different kinds of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works with the help of one of her daughters, who is the one who mainly goes out to sell products while she sells from home, where her customers visit when they need a product or an item of clothing. She has had this business for four years, which allows her to earn something which she puts towards her daughter's studies.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, perfume, jewellery, cosmetics, creams, and other items she sells. She has been a member of the credit group from the very beginning, and she likes it because the loans allow her to stock her business and make the most of offers. Her dream is for her daughter to become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, jewellery, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and a mother of seven children. They live in a five-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate capital to successfully carry out her business activity, the death of her mother, sister, brother and father, who were very supportive of her family, inadequate finance to educate her children and provide them with other basic necessities, and sickness in her family.

She has taken and successfully repaid her loans seven times and says with this new loan requested, she will engage in agriculture. She will buy farm seedlings like yams, maize, and beans, pay for her farmland clearing, buy fertilizer for the farm and pay for weeding. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time. She plans to buy improved seedlings and has good farm land, which will lead to great yields. She plans to put in her best effort into the farm work. With this farming activity, the community will have a supply of improved farm output at cheaper prices and at regular intervals.

With the profit from this loan, she will expand her business, provide basic necessities to her children with the little support she has from her husband, educate her children and buy a plot. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for labour and the transportation of the crops.

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es: Santos de 42 años de edad  se dedica al cultivo de maíz. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para él es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Santos is 42 years old and makes a living growing corn. This is how he makes a living and provides for his family. He grows corn every year, and this is the only way he know how to make a living. He is a very hard-working, honest and responsible man. He always relies on his family, as it is his only source of inspiration and he wants to improve their living conditions. He has made the decision to approach this institution to request a loan, since the sowing season is almost upon him, and he wants to be prepared by having the first agricultural inputs he needs, such as compost, pesticides, seeds, etc. which is why he is requesting this loan. He hopes to see favourable results as he has no other source of income. He is placing his trust in God that he will achieve an abundant harvest which will allow him to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 54 years old and has three children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. Josefina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Josefina is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Oky

texts.en:
Oky runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Oky lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Oky is married and lives with six people in the family house.

Oky began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Bambang

texts.en:
Bambang runs a small stall that sells food, mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Bambang lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Bambang is married and lives with two people in the family house.

Bambang began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin runs a small stall that sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Madelin lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Madelin is single and lives with five people in the family house.

Madelin began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is twenty-seven years old and has two children who are in school.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rosalina is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her rice retailing.

With your help, Rosalina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Galima

texts.en:
Galima is an entrepreneurial woman who lives with her family of 12 in Bagmari village of Deoghar, Jharkhand. Her husband is a contract worker who earns around Rs 6,000 to 7,000 per month. They have a son and two daughters who are studying at a nearby school.
 
Being an enterprising woman, she decided to set up a grocery store at her home in the village to improve the family income, as it was difficult to feed such a large family and to provide education for her children too. With the shop at house being in the center of the village, now she earns on an average Rs. 150 per day, which has made their life a little easier. However, her struggle to provide a good living is yet far from over, as another grocery shop beside the road is giving her tough competition.

Undeterred, she wants to diversify her business by providing more alternatives to her customers and improving the service along with her husband. She wants to borrow Rs. 5,000 to buy rice, wheat, oil, etc. in bulk. She hopes to save enough to send her children to a better school.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat, and oil in bulk for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, anti-plague chemicals, weed-killer, manure and more.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es taxista. 
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta hace dos años emprendió en su casa un negocio, vende ropa de todo tipo, moños y lasos en diversos modelos que su hermana fabrica, ella también una o dos veces por semana sale a entregar mercadería a varios clientes, deja a crédito y cobra en quincena y fin de mes ya que así sus clientes tienen más facilidad para pagar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y moños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecida. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
