The San Pedro barrio of Manta city, known for its beaches that are popular all year round with both domestic and international tourists, also has one of the largest ports in the country and in Latin America. Sitting on the edge of the Pacific Ocean, here in Manta the "Sol Naciente" loan group meets every fortnight.

And it is here that 29-year-old María lives. She is married and has two children - aged eight and five years old - who are studying at school. María's husband is a taxi driver.

With the intention of earning a little money on her own, two years ago María started her own business in her home - she sells all types of clothes, hair bands and other items that her sister makes. Once or twice a week María also heads out to deliver merchandise to various customers. María sells on credit and collects payments every fortnight. This makes payments easier for customers.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothes and hair bands. María has been with the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because she started the business with one of the loans and so is very grateful. María's dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and hair bands.

loans.name: Ivo

texts.en:
He is married and a father of five children.  They all live in a three-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  He has faced so many challenges in life among which are: the death of both parents, his child dropped out of school because of a lack of finances to cater for his children’s education expenses, inadequate capital to successfully carryout his business, and the ill health of his wife due to a snake bite.

He has taken and successfully repaid his three loans and says with this new loan requested he will add the profit from the previous loans and buy a secondhand car, pay for renovations, and also buy new tyres.  He has a positive view of this business succeeding because the area where he wants the car to work in is suffering from inadequate car transporters, and he will be driving the car himself and as such will know how to maintain the car and avoid accidents. With this transportation business, his community will be transported to and from work, he will transport children to and from school, transport farmers to the farm and their output to their house, and also transport his community members in cases of emergency.

With the profit from this loan, he will educate his children without stress, provide their basic necessities, cater for his car maintenance, and also extend his house. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, convenient repayment intervals, and the members are educated on good business management before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase a public transportation car

loans.name: Wendy Abigail

texts.es: Wendy tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad. Wendy es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y luchadora quien se gana la vida trabajando en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Wendy desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, grava y pago de mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Wendy is 25 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and young six-year-old daughter. Wendy is hard-working, responsible and plucky. She earns a living working at a business near her town - this allows her to support her household. Wendy wants to build a bedroom in her home and so is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" to buy to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and gravel, and to pay labourers to build the room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and gravel, and to pay labourers to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Rocio Margarita

texts.es: Roció de 33  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Roció  posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. Roció es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Roció is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Roció has a shop where she sells staple goods such as bread, milk, eggs, tinned goods, bottled water, vegetables and other items. Roció is very responsible and friendly and so has many customers even though she does not have a great variety of products. Roció is applying for a loan in order to buy a greater quantity of products. Roció's wish is to stock up her business and earn higher profits. Roció is a very responsible mother and wants to offer her family the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, eggs, tinned food, bottled water, vegetables and other goods.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 49-year-old married woman blessed with 5 children. She and her spouse, who’s a retired officer, have been always conjoined morally and financially for the wellbeing of their beloved family, especially her children, for whom they strive to provide a good educational level. One of her children is integrated in a private university, while the other three had to be in an official school due to their hard and critical financial situation.

For 28 years, Hanan has owned a small house ware retail store. She also sells clothes and is a tailor, too, to diversify her business services. She is well known in her region and recommended by her customers. Hanan declares that the revenues are barely enough to cover all the expenses and the socioeconomic demands that develop, and with the lack of capital, she can’t effectively make a big progress towards a more promising career.

Through her persistence and determination, she aspires to turn up to Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to ask for a small loan in order to expand and pay for her child’s increasing university fees to make sure that he can get the best education for a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her child's increasing university educational tuition fees

loans.name: Arielka De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Sólo un año falta para que Arielka deje de recorrer los pasillos de la Universidad de la ciudad de León. Es una joven inteligente, disciplinada y emprendedora. Tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltera y es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus padres, quienes le han motivado a cumplir sus sueños desde que era pequeña. Su deseo es finalizar con éxito su carrera universitaria.
Arielka solicita el crédito para pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y lograr una de sus más grandes metas, la culminación de su carrera universitaria. Ella deposita su confianza en el préstamo, puesto que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para pagar los módulos de finalización de estudio. Ella anhela obtener su diploma. Su plan futuro es adquirir un empleo, en el que aspira poner en práctica los conocimientos obtenidos, de manera que logré un futuro prospero.
texts.en:
There is only one more year left for Arielka to stop walking the hallways at the University in the city of Leon. She is an intelligent, disciplined and enterprising young adult. She is 22 years old; single and originally from the city of Chinandega. She counts on her parents’ unconditional support; they have motivated her to go after her dreams since she was little. Her dream is to successfully complete her university degree.

Arielka is requesting a loan to pay for the requirements to complete her studies and achieve one of her greatest goals, the culmination of her university degree. She is putting her trust on the loan, since she doesn't count with the necessary economic resources to pay the requirements to complete her studies. She longs to obtain her diploma. Her plan for the future is to get a job where she hopes to put the knowledge she has gained to practice, so that she can achieve a prosperous future.

loans.use: to pay the requirements to complete her studies.

loans.name: Francisco Placido

texts.es: Don francisco de 56 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas solventa los gastos que se le presentan n su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres de sus ocho hijos, Don francisco está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco is 56 years old. He has been a farmer for 30 years and that has given him the ability and knowledge necessary to assist his crops. His main crops are beans and corn and he sells his crops to the basic grain agencies close to his home. He pays the household expenses with what he makes. He lives in his own home with his wife and 3 of his 8 children.

Francisco is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural inputs which will help with the planting of his crops like manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. He wants to improve his plot that is shown in the photo, to generate more profit and provide his family with what they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, pest controls. etc.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es: Edith es madre soltera de dos hijos, ella se levanta muy de mañana para dejarlos listo para que asistan a la escuela, trabaja como cajera en una tienda y busca la manera de crecer con su pequeño negocio de venta de perfumes que ha venido formando con sus ahorros. Solicita este crédito para invertir en productos de cosméticos variados para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la economía familiar.
texts.en: Edith is the single mother of two children. she gets up very early every day in order to get her children ready for school. She works as a cashier in a store and also looks for ways to make her small business of selling perfumes that she has started with her savings, grow. She is requesting a loan to invest in a variety of cosmetics to increase her income and improve the family's finances.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is 30 years old. She is married and has three children. Her children are non-adults. 

Manzura one year ago began her own business with animal husbandry. She bought a milk cow. She sells milk to local people. Also she feeds eight sheep. She little by little develops her business with animal husbandry. Manzura’s husband is a carpenter. They try to provide their children with comfortable living conditions. 

That’s why Manzura is going to repair her house, but her income is not enough for it. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc., for repairing house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc., for repairing her house

loans.name: Elena Alicia

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5  hijos mayores de edad, 3 de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica.
Doña Elena con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Manta, the “Sol Naciente” communal bank meets every fortnight. This city is known for it's beautiful beaches and visited a lot all year long by national and international tourists. It is also one of the mot important ports of the country and in the Americas, situated on the shores of the Pacific Ocean.

Elena lives here. She is 53 years old, married and has 5 children from this relationship. They are now all adults, 3 of them still live at home. Her husband works in a factory. Elena with the intention of making some money by herself and get ahead in her home sells clothing of all kinds. She sells from door-to-door and also sells from her house where her best clients come. She sells on credit to her clients and collects every fortnight. She has been doing this for 7 years.

Elena will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been a member of this group since it's inception and she likes it as it finances her business. Her dream is to continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Proserfina

texts.en:
Proserfina is 34 years old and has three children.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out.  Proserfina is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her general store. With your help, Proserfina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard operates three mobile money transfer shops in Kasama, Zambia. He received his first Kiva loan in December 2013 and utilized the funds to add to his working capital in order to serve additional customers.  Bernard speaks about how his business is providing an important service for his community to send money around the country without needing a bank account. 

For Bernard, however, his money transfer business has an even more compelling impact; it allows him to support the 13 orphaned nieces and nephews he has raised as his own since losing eight of his own siblings. Later this year, the youngest two will complete their university studies. Bernard says he wanted to raise the children "to be independent and educated," and has taken on the responsibility of raising the children as his life's central purpose. 

Bernard has requested a second loan from Kiva so that he can purchase a trading booth and open up his fourth mobile money transfer location. The loan will be used to pay for the booth and provide the starting capital his business needs to service customers sending and receiving money.  

Bernard expresses how he appreciates the Kiva lenders and their continued support of his small business.

loans.use: purchase a trading booth and open up his fourth mobile money transfer location

loans.name: Sapenzia

texts.en:
Sapenzia is a 66-year-old lady from Kakamega count, married to Andrew who is a civil servant; they have one child who is all grown up.

She sells second hand clothes, commonly known as mitumba, a business she has done for the last 36 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

She has now applied for KES 30,000 as her second loan with Visionfund Kenya, which she intends to use in expanding her business. The profits will be used to better her life and that of her family members and part of them will repay the loan.She has a dream of expanding to be a wholesaler in this sector.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alba Lysette

texts.es: Alba tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermano y sus dos hijos. Ella trabaja como empleada en un empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su familia. Alba desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo y compra de puertas y ventanas para lo cual comprará materiales como lámina galvanizada, madera, puertas y ventanas dado que se encuentran en mal estado.
texts.en: Alba is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her mother, brother and her two children. She works as an employee in a business located close to her residence and this is how she supports her family. Alba wants to improve the conditions of her house so she has requested a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the repair of her roof and buy doors and windows as well as materials such as galvanized laminate and wood as they are currently in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, doors and windows to repair the roof and improve security.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is forty two years old and married with three children, who are in school. Arlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Arlinda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Arlinda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Arlinda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Arlinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. 

With your help, Conchita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Evelyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is sixty one years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Teresita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Teresita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Teresita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with six children. They all live in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Peter has faced many challenges in life, including inadequate capital to successfully manage his poultry farm and garden, provide three square meals to his family each day, educate his children and pay his rent.

In the past, Peter has successfully repaid six loans. With this new loan, he will expand his poultry farm and garden by buying chicks, chick feed, medication, and seedlings for plants like tomatoes and other vegetables. He feels strongly that his business will succeed because he has been doing it for so long and has experience in the sector. He plans to buy good quality chicks and improved seedlings, and he has customers who will buy his product. In addition, the community will benefit from the chicks' droppings, which will serve as manure for their farms. Peter will also sell the chicks to them for consumption at moderate prices.

With the profit from this loan, Peter plans to educate his grandchildren, provide good medical conditions in case of sickness, cater for other family welfare, improve his family's living standards and expand his poultry farm and garden. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and because the members are educated on management and marketing techniques before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy one-day-old chickens, feed, medication, and farm inputs such as seedlings

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with three children, of which two go to school. She takes care of one additional family member, her mother. 

Edith has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for thirteen years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from renting rooms. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Germania Margarita

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Germania, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 7 años  que estudia en escuela, viven en la casa de su papá.
Doña Germania para salir adelante  con los gastos que genera la educación y gastos de su hijo se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, calzado, joyas de plata entre otras mercadería, ella sale casi todos los días ya sea a ofrecer su mercadería o a cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, lleva 3 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, calzado y joyas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
In the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Manta, the “Sol Naciente” communal bank meets every fortnight. This city is known for it's beautiful beaches and visited a lot all year long by national and international tourists. It is also one of the most important ports of the country and in the Americas, situated on the shores of the Pacific Ocean.

Germania lives here. She is 42 years old and the single mother of a 7 year old son who studies at school. They live in her father's house. Germania in order to get ahead and to pay the education and other expenses for her son sells clothing of all types, footwear and silver jewellery amongst other things. She goes out nearly every day to sell her products or to collect what she has left on credit every week. She has been doing this for 3 years and started with one of the loans granted to her communal bank.
Germania will use the loan to buy clothing, footwear and jewellery. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and is happy with the support the loan provide her to get ahead. Her dream is to provide her child with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear and jewellery.

loans.name: Jacquilou

texts.en:
Jacquilou works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Jacquilou will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Jacquilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 60 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gaudiosa's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Gaudiosa is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Gaudiosa has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is thirty one years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Josephine's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josephine has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Josephine has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Josephine is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dorienda

texts.en:
Dorienda is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dorienda is thirty four years old and has six children who are in school.

Dorienda's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. Dorienda is taking out a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Dorienda has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Dorienda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Liacel

texts.en:
Liacel is twenty years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Liacel's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Liacel has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Liacel is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Santos Odilia

texts.es:
Santos, es parte de una familia conformada por su esposo y su dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, como una manera de tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia hace dos años nace un negocio que consiste en la elaboración y venta de pupusas. Trabaja todos los días.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar gas propano, aceite, bebidas, quesillo, repollo, tomates, harinas, etc., con lo que satisfacera a sus clientes ya establecidos, dará mejor servicio, tendrá la materia prima justo a tiempo, espera mejorar su situación económica y familiar.
Su aspiración es fortalecer su negocio para mantenerse trabajando, cubrir las necesidades de su familia y forjar un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is part of a family that also includes her husband and her two children, ages 5 and 3. In order to have income for covering her family’s expenses, she started a business two years ago that involves making and selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas). Santos works every day.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy propane gas, oil, beverages, cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, flour, and other supplies so that she can satisfy her established customers and provide better service. By having these materials at the right time, she hopes to improve her family’s financial situation.

Santos aspires to strengthen her business by continuing to work. As a result, she will be able to provide for her family’s needs and build an inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, oil, beverages, cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, flour, and other supplies.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Conchita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is thirty-three years old and single with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Marlina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marlina is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil’s wife needs eye surgery immediately due to the fact that she has lost her vision completely.
 
Vasil who lives in the northern part of Albania, in the region of Lezha, is 56 and he practices agriculture/livestock for living. He has cows, chickens and pigs and he plants mostly wheat, corn and fodder in addition to some orchard fruits and grapevines in his yard. Additional family income comes from his wife's disability and their son's work in a prison nearby their village. Here it is what Vasil said during the interview: “Now that my wife has lost her vision, it has become very difficult on me because I’ve got to do all this work on my own, this is why I pray that lenders will understand our situation and help us financially."

Some of the fruit orchards that the villagers in the vicinity of Vasil’s village plant are cherries, figs, pears and pomegranate and the most preferred animals are cows and pigs.

loans.use: to take his wife for an immidiate eye surgery because she's lost her vision completely

loans.name: Sopiko

texts.en: Sopiko is a 24-year-old young woman from Tbilisi city. She lives with her little son and mother, who works at private company as an operator. Sopiko also works at private company and has a fixed salary. Sopiko has a great desire to make a better style of living for her son and somehow increase her monthly income so she planned to request a loan. Sopiko's request was approved in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the requested money, Sopiko will repair her home and after that rent it at a good price. As her house is located in a good place in the city, she will easily find a renter. This will give Sopiko a chance to earn more income and become financially independent. Because of  the Start Up program she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to repair her home and then rent it

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras se llama este grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, donde gracias al trabajo de todas, y a la unión que tienen ya están en su ciclo número 7. Ellas están poniendo su máximo esfuerzo por ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fermina, quien tiene una modesta despensa en su casa. Comenta que gracias a este negocio da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que no pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades. Con su negocio se ha hecho de muy buena clientela y hoy día ya es muy conocida en el barrio por sus buenos productos.
La Sra. Fermina solicita de este préstamo para la compra de verduras, frutas, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y demás productos lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Las Emprendedoras” (The Enterprising Ones) is the name of a group that was formed in the city of Luque. Thanks to the work of all of the members, the group has already reached their seventh loan cycle. They are putting forth their best effort so that they can help their loved ones.

One of the members is Sra. Fermina, who operates a modest food pantry out of her house. She says that thanks to her business, she is able to provide everything her family needs so that they don’t feel as if they are lacking. Through her business, Fermina has built up a very good clientele since she is well known in her neighborhood for offering good products.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, fruits, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, and other items. This will help to solidify her business plan and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is married and has three children. She decided to start a new business selling food items. Guldasta studied a course called “To Get Ahead,” with a women’s organization and learned enough business skills. Her husband will help with her business and she got a rental shop near her house. Guldasta will be a very successful businesswoman because she is hardworking and smart.

Guldasta is requesting a 2,000 USD loan to buy food items for her new business. She and her husband, Murod, have always wanted to provide their children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy food items for her new business

loans.name: María Asuncion

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4  hijos mayores de edad, una hija  aun viven en su casa. Su esposo taxista.
Doña María es  una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para tener sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella tiene a cargos el bar en un centro recreacional en la ciudad, lugar que es muy concurrido sobre todo los fines de semana, allí preparan todo tipo de bocaditos y comida a elección de sus clientes, con ella trabaja una de sus hijas a quien le paga por su labor, lleva más de seis años con este negocio y le va muy bien cada vez tiene más clientela.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Crédito Sol Naciente group meets every 15 days in the San Pedro neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited a lot during every season of the year.  The beaches are frequented by national tourists and tourists from abroad.  The city is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America.  It is located on the banks of the Pacific.

This is where María, age 54, lives.  She is married, and they have four grown children.  One daughter still lives at home with them.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  María is a woman who has always liked working in order to have her own income and for the good of her family.

She is in charge of a bar in a recreational center in the city.  The place is very busy, especially on the week-ends.  This is where she prepares all types of snacks and food for her customers to choose from.  One of her daughters works with her, and she pays her for her work.  She has been in this business for six years.  It is going very well for her, and she gets more and more customers.

She will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish, fruit, and other ingredients to make the food.

She has been in the communal bank since it began.  She likes it for the benefits she gets from the institution.  Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, fruit, and other ingredients to make the food.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She restarted her business in 2013. She is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Rebecca will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. Nemia had started her business in 2012.

Nemia is requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. Nemia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Sol Naciente.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, actualmente está en su cuarto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. El marido es guardia de seguridad. 
Doña Gladys con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella también utiliza parte de los créditos para poco a poco ir construyendo su casa, ella con este crédito espera construir unas paredes para hacer un cuarto para sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y materiales de construcción. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos de a poco construye su hogar. Sus sueños son tener su casa terminada,
texts.en:
The Sol Naciente credit group meets every two weeks in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This city is known for the beautiful beaches that are very popular with national tourists as well as foreigners during every season of the year.  Located on the shores of the Pacific, it is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and in the Americas.

Señora Gladys lives in this place.  She is 24 years old and lives in a common-law union.  From this relationship she has a three year old child, and she is currently in her fourth month of pregnancy with her second child.  Her partner is a security guard.

With the intention of earning something for herself, Doña Gladys works selling all types of clothing.  Her way of making sales is door-to-door.  She also uses part of her loans to go on building her house, little by little.  With this loan she hopes to build the walls to make a room for her children.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing and construction materials.  She has been in the Credit Group for four loan cycles and she likes it because bit by bit she is building her home.  Her dream is to have her house finished.

loans.use: to buy clothing and construction materials

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother with five children; all attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).

She has had a tailoring business for 10 years. She has applied for 1,700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy fabric and thread.  She works six days  every week and sells retail.

Her major business challenges include season changes and customers that default on their payments. She wishes to sell wholesale only and buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and but not running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en:
Sokol is a 46-year-old married father with a 6-year-old child. He works in construction and his specialty is paving tiles. Sokol’s wife works in an olive mill in the vicinity of their home. Sokol’s village is not far from the city of Korca, and is located in a rural area where the villagers keep cows and sheep. The village has lots of agricultural land and is ideal for planting because of its moisture and natural loam; this type of soil is called “torft.” Locals plant mostly beans, corn, and wheat. Traditional food is still prepared in a primitive way by putting the pie dish on top of the hot embers of a wood fire and covering it with a tight lid called a “sac” with hot embers outside to bake it.

Sokol is requesting a loan to buy a tool that he needs for cutting tiles. He will also use his loan to pay insurance for his wife, who is currently pregnant. Sokol is a long-time client of VisionFund Albania and is in good standing.

loans.use: to buy a tool to cut tiles and pay for insurance for his wife, who is currently pregnant

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has started to rebuild and requests a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

With your help Melicia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Melicia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Madinakhon

texts.en:
Madinakhon was born in 1985. She is not married and lives with her mother. Her father died some years ago. 

Madinakhon is a student at Khujand State University. She studies hard  in the Accountant and Audit department.  Madinakhon dreams of working after graduating from the university. 

She asks for a loan to pay tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Bibinor

texts.en: Bibinor was born in 1959. She is a careful mother of two children. Her children are 25 and 28 years old. Bibinor’s husband is an accountant. Bibinor sells rolls, hamburgers and coffee in a local market. She has regular customers. Businessmen who work in a local market buy her rolls and coffee. She has run this business more than nine years. Her skills and experience in this field allow her to develop business.  She is going to build a mini-café in a local market and thus make better business conditions. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, etc.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, bricks, etc,. to build mini-cafe

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business.

Marivic is requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Geline

texts.en:
Geline is 29 years old and is single with two children, one of whom is in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Geline has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and she plans to recover her general store.

Geline is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, Geline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 47 years old and married with four children; three attend school. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan November 8, 2013. Aida is taking out a bridge loan to restart her fire wood business.  She requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to restart  her fire wood business.

Aida is committed to rebuild and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fire wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for his construction work.

loans.name: Rukije

texts.en:
Rukije needs this loan to have eye surgery because lately she has completely lost the vision from one eye and soon the doctor said that will loose vision in the other eye. 

Rukije raises livestock but lately this has become almost impossible due to her bad vision. She told the interviewer: “I don’t see well to do my work, and I don’t like to stay home and do nothing either. I hope to get some financial help soon to go and get the operation done and get myself ready for work again. I very much want that.”

Rukije’s village is known as a large producer of cherries, plums, walnuts and grapes.

loans.use: to pay for surgery.

loans.name: Teresa Mercedes

texts.es:
La amabilidad con la que atiende Teresa en su pulpería, es la que hace que la clientela regrese por otra compra. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega, está casada y tiene un hijo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, ha logrado invertir el dinero que le ha enviado su madre, con el que hace dos años logró abrir la pulpería. Su esposo es taxista y juntos velan por el futuro de su hijo.
A través del financiamiento favorecido por MiCrédito-KIVA, Teresa lograra incrementar cada uno de los productos que ofrece en la pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Papel higiénico, Azúcar, Galletas, Refrescos entre otros. La vida está hecha de sueños, un ejemplo vivo es Teresa, quien espera tener su propia distribuidora, ser la comerciante más grande de la zona y lograr ser auto sostenible. Su actitud positiva la lleva por buen camino.
texts.en:
The friendliness with which Teresa takes care of her store is what makes her customers return for additional purchases.  She comes from the Chinandega region, is married, and has a child.  She is an enterprising woman; she has managed to invest the money her mother sent to her, opening her convenience store two years ago.  Her husband is a taxi driver, and together they watch out for the future of their child.

Through the favored loans from MiCrédito-Kiva, Teresa will manage to expand every one of the products that she offers in her store.  She is asking for this loan to buy toilet paper, sugar, cookies, and soda, among other items.  Her life is made up of dreams.  A living example is that Teresa, who hopes to have her own distribution network, could be the biggest merchant in the area and could be self-sustaining.  Her positive attitude is taking her down a good path.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, sugar, cookies, and soda, among other items.

loans.name: Haydie

texts.en:
Haydie is 63 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

Haydie has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alberta Barbarita

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Creciendo Juntas.
En este lugar vive la señora Barbarita, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 11 hijos, 10 mayores de edad y una de 13 años de edad la cual estudian en colegio, cuatro de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja de obrero. 
Doña Barbaritas es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudar a su marido a  sacar adelante a sus hijos y su familia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, cachitos y dulces, en su casa prepara estos deliciosos alimentos los mismos que vende en su casa y que también distribuye en ciertas tiendas de la localidad,  esto lo viene realizando desde hace mas de  20 años  y gracias a esta actividad logro junto a su marido darles lo necesario a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar harina, huevos, mantequilla, leche, etc. para elaborar sus productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
The Creciendo Juntas community bank meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round by domestic and international tourists and for being one of the most important ports in the country and the Americas, located on the edge of the Pacific.

Barbarita lives in this place.  She is 58 years old, married, and has 11 children, 10 of whom are adults, and one is 13 years old who attends high school.  Four of her children still live with her.  Her husband works as a laborer.  

Barbarita is a hardworking woman who has always liked to work.  Her efforts have helped her husband to move their children and family forward.  She works making and selling bread, filled rolls, and sweets.  She prepares her delicious foods at home and sells them from her home.  She also distributes them to some stores in her area.  She has been doing this work for more than 20 years and thanks to this work, she and her husband have been able to give their children what they need to become good people.

She is requesting this loan to purchase flour, eggs, butter, and milk to make her products.  She has been in the community bank since it started and she likes the help and benefits that she receives from the bank.  Her dream is that her daughter becomes a good professional.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, butter, and milk.

loans.name: Gerald Antonio

texts.es:
Una vez terminada su jornada de clases en la universidad, Gerald está listo para cambiar de lugar, dejar de ser el estudiante para ser el profesor en un colegio de Chinandega. Esa es la rutina diaria de Gerald, es originario de Chinandega y tiene 22 años. Es un joven con un futuro alentador, no conoce el ocio. Su motivación lo es su familia, principalmente su hermanita menor, puesto que está a cargo de su educación.  
Él solicita un financiamiento para lograr cancelar la colegiatura del año en curso, ya que en el colegio donde labora no obtiene el pago que merece por no tener un titulo. Su meta es poder culminar sus estudios de Administración de Empresas para obtener mejores propuestas de trabajo, de manera que logre mejorar su situación económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
When he is done with his university classes, Gerald is ready to change places and transition from becoming a student to a school teacher in Chinandega. This process makes up his daily routine. Gerald is 22 years old and originally from Chinandega. He is a young man with a promising future. Gerald does not know what it means to be idle. His motivation is his family, primarily his younger sister, since he is left in charge of providing for her education.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay his tuition for this year. The school where he currently works will not offer him a salary until he obtains a degree. His goal is to finish his studies in Business Administration so that he can get better job offers, which would allow him to improve his financial situation at home.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for this year.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 33-year-old man from Kakamega who is married to Mercelyne, a businesswoman in the same region. They have two children ages 2 months and 4 years. For the past two years, Patrick has sold animals such as cows, goats, and sheep, and he earns a monthly income 15,000 KES.

Patrick is requesting a 20,000 KES loan through VisionFund Kenya to buy more animals to sell and expand his business. He will use the profit from his loan to plough back into his business and repay his loan. Patrick’s dream is to give his family the best life ever.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is a 39-year-old man. He and his wife have been married for 14 years and they have two sons. Both children attend school.

Rovshan is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli and now lives in the Baki region with his family. 

Rovshan has made windows and doors from plastic for seven years. He learned this profession from his uncle. He needs 1,300 AZN for his family business to buy the necessary materials to make windows and doors. 

Rovshan is very thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their aid.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to make windows and doors.

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Ella  posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer  muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home alongside her husband, who works as a farmer. She has a sewing workshop in her home where she produces all types of garments. As of late, she has had many customers because she produces excellent work and sells her products at affordable prices. Maria is a very dedicated woman who is responsible and honest in her work.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and all other types of sewing supplies so that she can continue to satisfy the needs of her customers. As a result, she and her husband will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en:
Shovkat is a 54-year-old married woman with two children. Her daughter was married 2 years ago. Today, Shovkat lives with her husband, son and bride. She has a lovely grandchild. Her son is a taxi driver.  They live in Baki region and have been IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Agdam for over 21 years.

Shovkat has a small store to sell daily food products. She also makes and sells “qutab”, “pirojki”, and other national dishes.  Shovkat wants to support her business and has applied to Komak for 2,300 AZN to buy products to support the development of her business. 

She  thanks the Kiva organization for aid. In the future Shovkat wants to repair her store.

loans.use: to buy products to support the development of her business.

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en: Manushaqe is pictured in front of her poorly built house.   She requests a loan to do some minor repairs to this house.  She will use  the rest of the loan  to prepare her daughter to get married.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to her family home.

loans.name: Jahaira Jennifer

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Creciendo Juntas.
En este lugar vive la señora Jahaira, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 1 hijo de cinco meses  de edad, El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jahaira junto a su marido se dedican al comercio ellos tienen una tienda de víveres en un local que arriendan cerca de su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, este negocio lo comenzaron con el ´primer crédito que recibieron de la institución hace  3 años y poco a poco con los siguientes fueron mejorando aun mas su tienda la cual les permite salir adelante honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 3 años y le gusta porque así empezaron su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Creciendo Juntas [Growing Together] credit group meets every two weeks in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This city is known for beautiful beaches that are very popular with national tourists as well as foreigners during every season of the year.  Located on the shores of the Pacific, it is also known for being one of the most important ports in the country and in the Americas.

In this place lives Señora Jahaira. She is 22 years old and has a common-law union.  From her relationship she has a five-month-old child.  Her partner is a shopkeeper.

Together with her partner, Doña Jahaira works as a shopkeeper.  They have a grocery store near their home in a space that they rent.  There they sell every type of product, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruits.  They work every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8 p.m., and at times even later.  They began this business with the first loan that they received from this institution three years ago, and little by little with the following loans they improved it even more.  This allows them to get themselves ahead honorably.

Jahaira will use this loan to stock her store even more.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts, and other staples.  She has been in the Credit Group for three years and she likes it because it is how they began their business.  Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts, and other staples.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 44-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Mumtaz makes enough money to provide for her family. 

Mumtaz is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour in bulk from the market at lower rates. She will keep her store fully stocked and be able to consistently meet her increasing demand. Mumtaz wishes to utilize part of the revenue from her loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour in bulk

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Lusi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Lusi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. She is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Lusi began working with Ruma two months ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has ten years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. Shumaila is a mother of two children and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Shumaila wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

Shumaila is in her fifth loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a taxi driver. He is married with one child. Hamid’s family is listed as IDP, Internally Displaced Persons, from Agdam city and now live in the Baki region. 

Hamid wants to use his loan to change the wheels of his car. In the future, he wants to be able to afford a good education for his child. For his business, Hamid wants to change his car to increase his business.

loans.use: to purchase new wheels for his car.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Земля является основным источником бизнеса и основной кормилицей в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере Гулноры занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания. Более 5 лет Гулнора занимается земледелием. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Детям  несовершеннолетние и еще не имеют нормального источника дохода. Она является основным кормильцем в семье. Она выращивает пшеницу, арбуз, кукуруза и т.п. и с удовольствием работает на поле с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Она планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The soil is the main source of business and the main food provider in Tajikistan. Many people, Gulnora for example, practice crop farming and receive an income to live on. For more than five years, Gulnora has practiced crop farming. She is married and is raising four children. Her children are still very young and do not yet have a normal source of income. She is main provider in her family. She grows wheat, watermelons, corn, etc. and works in the fields from early morning to late at night with pleasure. She is planning to develop her business but she does not have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной жительница горного района Хуросон, где основной деятельностью является животноводство. Она 54-летняя вдова, имеет троих взрослых дочерей. Старшей ее дочери 21 год, она находится на заработках в России. Средней дочере 19 лет и она работает в школе. Младшей дочери 16 лет и она помогает матери в деятельности. Гулсуной вот уже 7 лет как занимается выращиванием мелкорогатого и крупнорогатого скота. Она и ее дочь выгуливают скот на местном пастбище. Сейчас в их дворе осталось считанное количество скотов. Гулсуной просит кредит для купли нескольких голов телят и козлят для увеличения их поголовья. Она действительно нуждается в данном кредите.
texts.en: Gulsunoy is a resident of the mountainous Khuroson District, where the main industry is livestock breeding. Gulsunoy is a 54-year-old widow. She has three grown-up daughters. Her eldest daughter is 21 years old and works abroad in Russia. Her middle daughter is 19 years old and works in a school. Her youngest daughter is 16 years old and she helps her mother with her business. For 7 years already, Gulsunoy has been raising goats, sheep and cattle. She and her daughter walk the cattle in the local pasture. Now a good number of cattle remain in their yard. Gulsunoy is requesting a loan to buy several calves and baby goats to increase the size of her herd. She truly needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy calves and baby goats to develop her livestock breeding business.

loans.name: Adriana Teodalinda

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Creciendo Juntas.
En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 7 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es pescador. 
Doña Adriana con la intención de ganar algo se dedica a la venta de ropa interior ya sea de damas, caballeros y niños, lo que más vende es para damas y en entrada a clases para niños, temporada que está por venir y para lo cual necesita del crédito ya que es cuando más vende y necesita estar bien surtida de mercadería,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior de toda clase. Lleva tres años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Crédito Creciendo Juntas meets fortnightly in the San Pedro district in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited throughout the year by both local and foreign tourists. Situated on the Pacific coast, it is one of the most important ports of America.

Adriana, who is 36, lives here. She is married and has 4 children aged 16, 14, 12 and 7. The three older children study at secondary school and the youngest is at primary school. Her husband is a fisherman. Adriana sells women's, men's and children's underwear to make a living. Women's lingerie is what sells the most, and also when children's school classes start. This time is approaching, which is why she wants a loan as it is when she sells most of her goods, and she needs to be well-stocked. She sells door-to-door and also from her own home, where her most well-known customers go. She has been doing this job for 5 years, which helps her husband cover the household costs and pay for their children to go to school.

She will use the loan to buy all sorts of underwear. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years, and she likes it because she can finance her business through its loans. Her dream is to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 44-year-old man from Kakamega, married to Selpher, who is a domestic farmer in the same county. They have four children, aged seven, six, two and 15 years old.

Silas operates a retail shop, a business he has done for the last ten years, earning an income of KES 30,000 per month. He is taking his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, to use in uplifting the status of his shop by purchasing goods in bulk, like sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil, and sweets. 

The profits thereafter will be used to pay school fees for his children, to save, and to repay his loan. His dream is to open a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks in bulk, of sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil, and sweets.

loans.name: Raquel Lorena

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Creciendo Juntas.
En este lugar vive la señora Raquel, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos 19, 14 y 12 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es maestro constructor.
A Doña Raquel siempre le ha gustado ganar sus propios ingresos los cuales le han servido para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a su familia, ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un negocio de preparación y venta de bocaditos en su casa, allí también venden aguas, colas, jugos y varias bebidas mas, trabajan todos los días más que todo en horas de la tarde que es cuando abren el negocio ya que en la mañana siempre están preparando lo que tienen para vender en las tardes, ellas llevan más de 8 años con este negocio el cual les ayuda a ganar algo por su cuenta en beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos además de colas, aguas entre otras cosas que venden. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In San Pedro neighborhood, city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular in all seasons, visited by local and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America, located in the Pacific shores, the 'Creciendo Juntas' or 'Growing Together' community group gathers every 15 days.
33-year-old Rachel lives here. She lives with her husband in common-law and their three children ages 19, 14 and 12 who attend grade school and college. Her husband is a master builder.
Raquel has always liked to earn her own income that she uses to help her husband to raise her family. In partnership with her mother, they own a business making and selling snacks from home. They also sell juice, colas, sodas and other soft drinks. They work every day, mostly in the afternoon, which is when they are open for business, so they use their mornings to make and prepare what they will be selling that very day. They've had this business for more than 8 years which helps them earn some money to help support their family.
This loan will be used to buy supplies for food preparation and to purchase colas, sodas and other items for resale. She's been a member of this group since the beginning and she likes it because these loans are of great help. Her dream is to one day own a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies for make food and buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором 22 года. Она живет в районе Вахш вместе с мужем, маленькими детьми, свекровью и двумя братьями мужа. Дилором вместе мужем и свекровью занимаются растениеводством. Они в основном сеют зерновые и бахчевые культуры. Дилором этой деятельностью занимаются на протяжении 5 лет, с тех пор как она вошла в их дом как невестка. Она хорошо освоила технику выращивания культур. Сейчас ее семья готовится к весеннему посеву. Им необходимо закупить семена арбуза и пшеницы, а также минеральные удобрения. Для реализации этой цели Дилором просит кредит. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Dilorom is 22 years old. She lives in the Vakhsh District with her husband, her young children, her mother-in-law and her husband's two brothers. Dilorom, her husband and her mother-in-law practice crop farming. They mainly sow grains and melons. Dilorom has been doing this business for five years since she came into the family's home as a daughter-in-law. She has completely mastered the agricultural techniques. Now her family is preparing for the spring sowing season. They must buy watermelon and wheat seeds as well as mineral fertilizers. To achieve this goal, Dilorom is requesting a loan. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy wheat and watermelon seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Mansour Thieudeme Group

texts.fr: SOPE SERIGNE MANSOUR THIEUDEME est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 6 personnes et qui habitent dans le même quartier. Elles font pratiquement la meme activité et leur présidente s’appelle Aida, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est agée de 40ans et évolue dans la commercialisation du riz qu’elle vend en détail dans les quartiers et les marchés. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 19h. Aida a comme charge particulière les besoins de sa famille gérée par son mari. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son fond de commerce et satisfaire ses clients. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10ans et souhaite  à l’avenir avoir une deuxième  cantine au marché pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Sope Serigne Mansour Thieudeme is a group  supporting female entrepreneurs. It is composed of six people living in the same neighborhood. They all work basically in the same line of business. Their leader is called Aida. She is married and has children. Aida is 40 years old and retails rice in various residential neighborhoods and at markets. She starts her work day at 8 AM and ends at 8 PM. She helps her husband support the household. She is seeking this loan to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand. She has more than 10 years of experience in this area and, in the future, she would like to have a second sales point at the marketplace in order to increase her revenues and improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Ibodatkhon

texts.ru: Ибодатхон жительница района Рудаки, занимающаяся швейным делом. Она замужем, имеет детей. Недавно ей исполнилось 44 года. Последние 8 лет своей жизни она усердно занимается шитьем. Ибодатхон в этом деле помогает ее дочь. Они берут заказ на пошив женских платьев национального покроя. Услуги швеи всегда в спросе в их районе, так как женщины и девушки предпочитают шить себе платья на свой размер и вкус. Машинка Ибодатхон очень устарела и она хотела бы в связи с этим купить новую, чтобы расширить деятельность. Для этой цели она берет кредит в размере 800 долларов США. Она действительно нуждается в данном кредите, который ей нужен для развития своего швейного дела.
texts.en: Ibodatkhon is a resident of the Rudaki District and a seamstress. She is married and has children. Not too long ago, she turned 44 years old. For the last 8 years of her life, she has been diligently running her sewing business. Ibodatkhon's daughter helps her with this business. They take orders for sewing ethnic Tajik-style women's dresses. Seamstress services are always in demand in their district as women and girls prefer to have dresses made for themselves to their own size and taste. Ibodatkhon's sewing machine has become very outdated and, in connection with this, she would like to buy a new one to expand her business. For this goal, she is taking out a loan in the amount of 800 USD. She truly needs this loan to develop her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: San Alejo Trabajando  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la Ciudadela  San Alejo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo De Crédito San Alejo Trabajando. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellos decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios y su  calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Casilda, tiene 33 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 14, 10  y 8  años, el mayor  estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido trabaja en una gasolinera.
