Doña Casilda para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y los que generan los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a preparar alimentos, ella tiene una cevichería en un local que arrienda por el sector del mercado, donde asisten muchas personas por lo cual su clientela está asegurada, en ese lugar recién lleva 4 meses ya que antes vendía en una carreta, pero por la necesidad de dar un mejor servicio decidió arrendar este local en el cual le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar sillas, mesas y platos que aún le falta para mejorar su negocio y con esto dar un mejor servicio. Este es su primer ciclo y espera al igual que el grupo seguir adelante con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank San Alejo Trabajando meet every two weeks in the neighborhood of San Alejo in the city of Portoviejo.  The members work in different areas, including general commerce and providing services, among others.  They decided to form this group to improve their businesses and their quality of life.

One of the members of the group is Casilda.  She is 33 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and has three children who are 14, 10, and 8 years old.  The oldest is in high school and the others are in primary school.  Her husband works as a gas station attendant.  In order to earn money herself and help her husband with the household and school expenses, Casilda works preparing food.  She has a ceviche restaurant in a location that she rents near the market.  Many people go there, so she has a set customer base.  She has been in this location for four months, and previously she sold from a cart, but she decided to rent a location to provide better service.  It is going very well.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seats, tables, and plates, since she is lacking items to improve her business and provide better service.  This is her first loan cycle and she hopes that she and the group can continue forward with the loans.  Her goal is to own her business space.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, and plates.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años esta casado y tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya no viven con él,  porque ya formaron su propio hogar. El señor José vive solamente con su esposa quien  se dedica a los oficios del hogar . 

El señor José es sastre y tiene su propia satreria en la cual hace pantalones camisas y faldas, este trabajo lo aprendió desde muy pequeño por medio de una organización que le enseño a hacer trabajo de sastreria y gracias a eso tiene hoy una fuente de trabajo de la cual le dio a sus hijos la educación que necesitaban,  el trabaja todo el día en lo que es la sastreria, para él no hay horario siempre desea cumplir con sus trabajo lo mas pronto posible.


Con el préstamo que esta solicitando comprar todo los materiales que necesita para la fabricación de ropa como hilos, aguja y tela y de igual manera desea ampliar el lugar donde fabrica la ropa y con los ingresos que su negocio va generado  podra pagar su crédito puntualmente y le dará un poco mas de sustento a su familia.


EL sueño de José es tener un negocio mas grande y  que la fabricación de ropa sea mayor,  para que en la vejes él y su esposa puedan estar tranquilos y sobretodo desea que sus hijos aprendan el trabajo que él realiza; porque para él la mejor herencia que les puede dar a sus hijos es la educación y el trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, married, and has two children who no longer live with him since they already have homes of their own. The only one living with him is his wife, who takes care of the household duties.

Sr. José is a tailor and has his own workshop where he produces trousers, shirts, and skirts. He learned this line of work at a very young age from an organization that offers tailoring classes. Thanks to this training, he now has a source of income that allowed him to provide for his children’s education. José works every day as a tailor. He doesn’t have a set schedule, but he always tries to complete his work as soon as possible.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy all the necessary materials for making clothes such as thread, needles, and fabric. In addition, he wants to expand the workspace where he produces clothing. The profits that are generated from his business will be used to repay the loan on time and allow him to have a little more set aside for his family’s needs.


José dreams of having a larger business where he can produce more clothes. He and his wife would like to have a peaceful retirement, but most of all, he would like to see his children learn the same trade because the best inheritance that he can leave them is an education and a source of work.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and fabric.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and from Kakamega county. She is a widow raising four children, ages 4, 17, 18 and 19. 

Nancy has operated a hardware business for the last four years, earning an average income of 35,000 KES per month. She is taking her second loan with VisionFund Kenya to buy goods like nails, spare parts and rubber for motorcycles. The profits will be used to repay the loan and for savings.

Her dream is to prosper and give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy items such as nails, spare parts and rubber for motorcycles to sell in her hardware business.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират доброжелательная трудолюбивая сельская женщина района Хуросон. Ей всего 30 лет, а мужу 40 лет. У них единственная дочь, которой недавно исполнилось три годика. Вместе с ними также живут родители мужа. Махфират у них научилась выращивать скот. Уже 6 лет как она самостоятельно занимается этой деятельностью. Сейчас в ее скотном дворе имеется всего одна корова с теленком. Махфират хочет увеличить поголовье скота, так как уже весна и везде растет свежая трава - корм для скотов. Махфират просит кредит, чтобы приобрести пару голов коров и телят. Ей этот кредит важен для увеличения бюджета семьи.
texts.en: Makhfirat is a friendly, hard-working woman from the rural Khuroson district. She is 30 years old and her husband is 40. They have one daughter who is three years old. Her husband's parents also live with them and they taught Makhfirat how to raise cattle, which she has been doing on her own for six years. She currently has one cow and calf in her barn. She would like to have more livestock since it is spring and fresh grass is growing everywhere that can be used as food for the cattle. Makhfirat has asked for a loan to purchase a pair of cows and calves. The loan is important for her to increase her family's budget.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Ramón Lizardo

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Creciendo Juntas.
En este lugar vive don Ramón, tiene 64 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos, pero uno de ellos falleció y los otros ya son mayores de edad, con ellos viven tres nietos de 16, 14  y 10 años que son de su hija que falleció y que están a su cargo, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
El señor Ramón es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir, el antes trabajaba en una fabrica como obrero pero por su edad ya no pudo seguir trabajando, es así con lo poco que tenia y con la ayuda de los créditos adecuo una pequeña bodega en su casa en la cual vende agua en bidones, también entrega a domicilio en una carreta que él tiene, de esta forma el logra ganar el pan diario para él y su familia. Ya lleva tres años con esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidón. Lleva tres años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos él comenzó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In San Pedro neighborhood, city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular in all seasons, visited by local and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America, located in the Pacific shores, the 'Creciendo Juntas' or 'Growing Together' community group gathers every 15 days.
64-year-old Ramon lives here. He's married and had 6 children with his wife, but one of them passed away. All other children are of age. They have custody of three of their grandchildren, ages 16, 14  y 10, from their daughter who passed. The older children go to high school and the youngest is still in grade school. His wife is a home maker. 
Ramon is a hard worker and does everything he can to provide for his family. He used to be a factory worker, but due to his age, he was unable to continue working there. So, with the little money he had and with the help of these loans, he has been able to open a small shop out of his home, selling gallon-water bottles. He also makes deliveries using a small cart her owns, so he can make some extra money every day to support his family. He's been working on this activity for the last 3 years.
He will use this loan to purchase more gallon-water bottles for resale. He's been a member of this community group of three years because he likes to use these loans to grow his business. His dream to be able to get ahead and continue working.

loans.use: to purchase gallon-water bottles for resale

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a 53-year-old widow who lives in the town of Kakamega, She supports seven people, and has worked hard at running a retail shop for the last 18 years. She makes an average income of KES. 30,000 per month and is requesting her second loan, for KES. 30,000, from Vision Fund Kenya to buy goods in bulk, including tea leaves, salt, sugar tissue paper, and cooking oil, to sell to her customers. She will use the profits from this loan to make payments and set aside savings. Her dream is to prosper and open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy goods in bulk, including tea leaves, salt, sugar, tissue paper and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Along with her husband, Rabia, a 26-year-old vigorous lady, has been running her business stitching clothes for many years. They stitch clothes for the people of their community and use the income to support their entire family. 

In order to meet the daily demands of their customers, Rabia has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in various colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons. These purchases will allow them to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier income.  With a good credit history, this will be Rabia's fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in various colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is married with four children who all attend school. She owns a retail shop and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 70,0000 UGX to buy sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil to sell in her shop. She works in her shop seven days a week.  

Her major business challenges are people who steal and default on their payments in her store.  She dreams of owning a fully-stocked retail shop and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil to sell in her shop

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Эту продавщицу с города Куляб зовут Нигинамо. Она трудолюбивая и сильная женщина. У Нигинамо пятеро детей, из которых 4 девочки и 1 мальчик. Кроме 4-летнего сына и годовалой дочери, все дети ходят в школу. Муж Нигинамо работает в гидроэлектростанции. Сама Нигинамо работает продавщицей на центральном рынке. Она в течение 6 лет торгует фруктами и овощами. В деятельности ей иногда помогают ее старшие дочери. Сейчас у Нигинамо почти закончились запасы товара. Она просит кредит, чтобы привести партию свежих сезонных фруктов и овощей для увеличения товарооборота. Этот кредит ей важен для продолжения торговой деятельности.
texts.en: Niginamo is a strong, hardworking saleswoman from Kulyab. She has five children: four girls and one boy. All of the children are in school except for her four-year-old daughter and one-year-old son. Her husband works at a hydroelectric power station and she sells fruits and vegetables at the central market. She has sold her produce here for six years and her oldest daughters sometimes help her. Niginamo has sold nearly all of her produce and has requested a loan to buy more fresh fruits and vegetables to increase her inventory. This loan is important for her to be able to continue selling produce at the market.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables and boost sales

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Rima lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Rima is single and living with six people in the family home. 

Rima began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida  is a single mother of two children, all of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister). She has a business of selling green bananas and fresh vegetables and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and baskets of cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and onions. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and start growing vegetables. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of maize.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Dede lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Dede is single and lives with five people in the family house.

Dede began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom was born in 1972. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Dilorom is a successful business woman. She has had her own business more than two years. She sells nuts in a local market. Dilorom is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history. She is a kind and responsible woman. Dilorom is going to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy nuts. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy nuts for increasing working capital

loans.name: Faizal

texts.en:
Faizal runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Faizal lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Faizal is single and lives with three people in the family house.

Faizal began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Lela lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Lela is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Lela began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, age 46, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 33-year-old poultry farmer in Tudor, Mombasa. She is a married woman with no children and her spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last four years and has done well.

This marks her first time borrowing from Visionfund to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase feed for her broilers and the anticipated profit to open up a second business. She hopes to be a successful business lady in future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her broilers

loans.name: Bibihafiza

texts.ru: Бибихафиза мама двоих сыновей. Им 28 и 26 лет. Они, как и их отец работает на ферме. Бибихафиза с мужем и детьми на протяжении многих лет живут в одном из маленьких и дружелюбных районов Республики Таджикистан на районе Хуросон. Бибихафиза поддерживает мужа и сыновей во всем. Она следит на порядком дома и поддерживает уют в доме. Параллельно Бибихафиза на скотном дворе держит скотов. Они обеспечивают молоком и мясом. Сейчас Бибихафиза решила увеличить поголовья скота и получить кредита. Она намерена потратить кредит для купли скотин. Бибихафиза самостоятельно не может совершить покупку и по этой причине обратилась за поддержкой.
texts.en: Bibihafiza is a mother to two sons. They are 28 and 26 years old. They, like their father, work on the farm. For many years, Bibihafiza, her husband and her sons have lived in one of the smallest and most welcoming districts of the Republic of Tajikistan - the Khuroson District. Bibihafiza supports her husband and sons in everything. She looks after the order of the house and ensures the coziness of the home. Simultaneously, Bibihafiza houses cattle in her barnyard. They provide milk and meat. Now Bibihafiza has decided to increase the size of her herd and take out a loan. She is determined to spend the loan on buying cattle. Bibihafiza is unable to make the purchase on her own which is why she requested financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Francisco está formado por  17 integrantes, está en  el 2 ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela.
Ella se dedica a la venta de queso, leche y huevo, que hace desde su casa y también de manera ambulante, y comenta que aunque su trabajo es muy humilde, con esto da a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder comprar leche y queso para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, de seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The group named “San Francisco” consists of 17 members and is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another move forward. They are participating in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Sra. Graciela. She sells cheese, milk, and eggs from her home and also as a street merchant. Graciela says that her work is very humbling, but it allows her to provide everything her family needs so that they are not deprived. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk and cheese that she can sell. This will allow her to continue working in the same manner as always.

Graciela is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can continue working and striving.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Lisnawati

texts.en:
Lisnawati runs a small stall which sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Lisnawati lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Lisnawati is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Lisnawati began working with Ruma two months ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Dedi

texts.en:
Dedi runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Dedi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Dedi is married and lives with six people in the family house.

Dedi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Merly Jaqueline

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Creciendo Juntas.
En este lugar vive la señora Merly, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 19, 17 y 13 años, la menor estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Merly es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan de almidón, dulces de muchos sabores y colores, cocadas y varios dulces artesanales, ella prepara sus dulces en su casa y una vez hechos los entrega a comerciantes que los llevan a otras ciudades a vender, estos dulces que tienen mucha salida ya que son típicos de esta zona,  esta actividad la viene desempeñando desde hace mas de 10 años y esto lo aprendió de sus padres que se dedicaban a esta actividad y que hoy le permite ganarse los suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar víveres necesarios para elaborar sus dulces. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
In San Pedro neighborhood, city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular in all seasons, visited by local and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America, located in the Pacific shores, the 'Creciendo Juntas' or 'Growing Together' community group gathers every 15 days.
36-year-old Merly lives here. She lives with her husband in common-law and has three children ages 19, 17 and 13. The youngest daughter goes to school and still lives with her. Her husband is a sales person.
Merly is a great wife and she loves working, and she has been able to help her husband support her family thanks to her efforts at home. 
She makes and sells bread, candy in many flavors and colors, coconut sweets and various handmade sweets. She prepares them at home and then delivers them to several retailers who take them to other cities to sell. These sweets are very popular, as they are typical of this area.
She's been working on this activity for over 10 years and she learned the trade from her parents who also worked in this field that today, lets her earn enough to support her family. 
This loan will be used to purchase food needed to prepare these sweets. She's been involved with this community group since the beginning. Her dream is to see her daughter become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make sweets

loans.name: Selvi

texts.en:
Selvi runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Selvi lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Selvi is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Selvi began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Rosariah

texts.en:
Rosariah is a 30-year-old electrician in Barsheba, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three whose husband provides for additional income. Rosariah has been in this business for the last 10 years now.

This marks her third time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase more electrical spare parts for TVs, radios, DVD machines, and mobile telephones. The anticipated profits will be used to service her loan and expand her business. Rosariah hopes to grow her business and have more electrical shops in the future.

loans.use: to purchase electrical spare parts for televisions, radios, DVD machines, and mobile telephones.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-three-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa Kenya. She is a married mother of four and her husband provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last ten years and doing great.

This marks her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase stocks of sugar, milk, cooking fat, and washing detergents. The anticipated profit will be used to repay her loan and open a new business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar,milk,cooking fat and washing detergents

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru:
Зулайхо жительница города Куляб. Она обладает ремеслом шитья курпа и курпача (стеганых ватных одеял), которые до сих пор используются в быту у таджиков. Зулайхо научилась этому делу еще в юности у своей матери, но самостоятельно начала эту деятельность 10 лет назад.
Зулайхо разведена и живет в родном городе Куляб вместе с сыном, дочерью и невесткой. Ее сын работает на стройке, а дочь учится в медицинском колледже. Зулайхо берет много заказов и ей в работе помогают дочь и невестка. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести новую швейную машинку и ткани для шитья. В будущем она планирует расширить деятельность, а в данный момент она нуждается в поддержке для достижения цели.
texts.en:
Zulaykho is a resident of the Kulob District. She a master of the trade of sewing kurpas and kurpachas (traditional comforters) which are used to this day in the everyday lives of Tajiks. Zulaykho learned this trade in childhood from her mother, but she independently began this business 10 years ago.

Zulaykho is divorced and lives her hometown of Kulob with her son, daughter and daughter-in-law. Her son works on a construction site and her daughter attends medical college. Zulaykho takes many orders and her daughter and daughter-in-law help her with her business. Now she has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics for sewing. In the future, she plans to expand her business, but currently she relies on your support to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris appreciates the support of the previous loan which helped her to grow her business well. Here again, she comes to you with a loan that she is requesting, in the amount of KES 20,000. She wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. 

Peris decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre joven, enérgico y pujante de 26 años de edad, nacido en el seno de una humilde familia campesina, en la que aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo; gracias a ello, hoy en día posee sus propios cultivos de mora, cebolla, cilantro y otros productos, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del municipio, así genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (riegos, abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), con los que podrá fortalecer sus cultivos y así sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva que le permita aumentar los ingresos a la hora de vender los productos.
Juan sueña con tener una gran parcela, con cultivos de diversos productos que le garanticen una estabilidad económica para disfrutar con su esposa de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a young, energetic, and vigorous 26-year-old man. He was born into a humble farming family where he learned to perform all kinds of field work. Thanks to this, today he has his own crops of blackberry, onion, cilantro, and other products, which are harvested and then sold in the town market. This way he is able to generate sufficient means to cover his family expenses.

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of bulk farming supplies (irrigation, compost, pesticides, fertilizers) to strengthen his crops and get a much more productive harvest so he can increase revenue when selling his products. 

Juan dreams of having a large plot with various crops to guarantee economic stability so that he and his wife can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk farming supplies (irrigation, compost, pesticides, fertilizers)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver take-out meals.

loans.name: Mayramby

texts.ru: Майрамби добросовестная женщина. Ей 53 года. Она замужем и имеет одного совершеннолетнего сына. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 20 лет назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей женской одежды и обуви. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У нее тонкий вкус и она умеет выбирать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательной и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони  для покупки одежды и обуви для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mayramby is a sincere woman. She is 53 years old, married and has one adult son. In order to provide her family with all of the necessities, she started her own business 20 years ago buying and selling women's clothes and shoes. Her efficiency helps her to be successful in business. She sells her merchandise at the local market and has a large circle of customers. She has good taste and is able to pick out merchandise which is in high demand. Despite all of her merits, the strong competition of the business world forces her to be conscientious and get new merchandise every season. She needs to buy merchandise for the new season, but she does not have enough funds to do so. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to buy clothes and shoes for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a 50-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in a functional state. For this reason, Zarina has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR, for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service to his passengers. Zarina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some tools for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Idiboy

texts.ru:
Идибой жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 46 лет. Он вдовец имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Идибой живёт со своей семьёй в городе. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. 

Жена Идибоя недавно умерла и домашними делами, воспитанием детей, теперь Идибой  занимается сам. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Идибой занимается своим делом. Он ремонтирует автомашины. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Сейчас Идибой хочет приобрести запчасти для ремонта автомашин, чтобы расширить ассортимент предоставляемых услуг по ремонту машин. Тем самым он хочет получать больше дохода от своей работы. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку авто запчастей. Идибой очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Idiboy is a cheerful and hardworking 46-year-old man. He is a widower and has three children. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support. Idiboy lives with his family in a city. He does not have a higher education, as he did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in his family.

Idiboy's wife died not too long ago and Idiboy now has to do all the household chores and raise his children by himself. In order to have an income to live on, Idiboy has his own business. He repairs cars. He receives a good income from this business. Now Idiboy wants to buy spare parts to repair cars with in order to expand her offered range of car repair services. In doing so, he wants to receive more earnings from his work. This is why is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy spare car parts. IIdiboy really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Les Jeunes Femmes And Ligueye Group

texts.fr: Les jeunes femmes and ligueye est composé de 9personnes qui vivent dans  le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois de  besoin. Elles ont comme activités la commercialisation de tissus, restauration, vente de jus etc……… Elles ont comme présidente Madame Bamby qui est une femme très brave, âgée de 43ans elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont le plus grand a 16ans et le plus petit 7ans. On la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Son activité principale est la commercialisation des tissus et elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des tissus et les revendre au marché. Elle a une expérience de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 18h avec une pause entre 13h et 16h. A part ces besoins personnels, Bamby n’a pas de charges particulières.  A l’avenir elle souhaite avec l’aide de l’institution développer son commerce et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Les Jeunes Femmes And Ligueye Group is made up of nine women who live in the same district and who meet together whenever necessary. They have small businesses such as the marketing of fabrics, catering, juice sales, etc. Their president, Bamby, is a very brave woman. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her oldest is 16 years old and her youngest is seven years old.

Bamby is shown in the photo with her hand raised. Her main business is the marketing of fabrics, and she is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics that she will resell at the market. She has five years of experience in this business. Bamby starts her work day at 10 am to finish at 6 pm, with a break between 1 and 4 pm. Aside from her daily necessities, Bamby has no special expenses. In the future, and with the help of the institution, Bamby wants to develop her commerce and increase her revenues so that she can start setting money aside for savings.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for resale to her clientele.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia operates a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Anastasia is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to boost her business by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Andrés Felipe

texts.es:
Andrés es un joven emprendedor, dinámico y activo de 18 años de edad, dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo calzado por encargo, la actividad la realiza desde hace un año y aprendió de manera empírica, con el ideal de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar que conformó con su compañera sentimental.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (tenis, zapatos, sandalias), esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los gustos diversos, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de los ingresos.
Andrés manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un almacén de calzado, con buen surtido para garantizar un mayor nivel de rentabilidad y poder disfrutar con su esposa de mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Andrés is a young entrepreneur. He is dynamic and active at 18 years old. He works as an independent salesman. He sells shoes, an activity he has done for a year and he learned in an organic way. His goal is to be able to earn enough money to support his household costs and his wife. 
He is asking for a loan that will be used to purchase wholesale merchandise like tennis, shoes and sandals. This will allow him to have a greater variety available to his customers and to be able to satisfy their diverse tastes. This will help him to increase his earnings. 
Andrés says that his biggest dream is to have his own shoe store, well stocked and profitable and to be able to enjoy a better quality of life and well-being with his wife.

loans.use: purchase wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Taufik runs a small stall in which he sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Taufik lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Taufik is single and lives with 5 people in the family house.

Taufik began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill-payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials, like iron corrugated sheets, for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es soltera pero tiene 1 hijo. Ella vive con sus padres en El Alto en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares. La vivienda cuenta con agua, luz y alcantarillado. Mercedes trabaja como profesora de computación, pero ese oficio no le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades asi que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de chicharrón de pollo en el negocio de su tía. Mercedes necesita credito para pagar un curso de actualización que le permita tener un item en el colegio donde trabaja (en Bolivia el item permite al empleado ser trabajador de planta, es decir, que ya no trabaja a contrato, sino que entra en la planilla de la empresa o institución)Mercedes estará muy agradecida si le brindan apoyo, a pesar de tener dos trabajos no puede pagar el curso con su dinero.
texts.en: Mercedes is single but has one child. She lives with her parents in El Alto, in an adobe house that belongs to her family. Her home has water, lights, and heating. Mercedes works as a computer studies teacher, but this job isn't enough to cover the costs of basic necessities, and so, on the weekends she also sells chicken chicharrón at her Aunt's store. Mercedes needs a loan to pay for a refresher course that will allow her to complete one of the requirements at the secondary school where she teaches (in Bolivia these requirements allow an employee to work freelance without needing to be on the employer's wage sheet). Mercedes will be very grateful for the help that she will be shown because despite having two jobs, she still cannot afford to pay for this course.

loans.use: Pay for a refresher course that will allow her to complete one part of her requirements at a secondary school where she teaches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, nails, and cement.

loans.name: Book Khol Ross Bethio Group

texts.fr: BOOK KHOL ROSSE BETHIO est un ensemble de personnes qui se sont réunies pour prendre leur destin en main. Il est composé de 9 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes et vivent dans le même quartier, elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. La Présidente s’appelle Fatou  et c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Agée de 26 ans c’est une jeune femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires comme le savon, sucre et a une expérience de plus de 4ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h prendre la pause à 13h pour y revenir à 15h et rentrer à 20h. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières  à part ses besoins personnels. Elle voudrait grâce aux crédits de l’institution ouvrir d’autres points de vente et renforcer ses produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
The Book Khol Ross Bethio Group is an ensemble of people who have gathered to take their destiny in hand. It is composed of nine women who live in the same district and who meet whenever necessary. The president of the group is named Fatou and she is shown with her hand raised in the photo. Fatou is 26 years old, and is a young married woman and mother.

She has a small business selling dry goods, such as soap and sugar, and benefits from more than four years of experience in this business. She starts her day at 9 am and finishes at 8 pm, with a break from 1 to 3 pm. Aside from her daily necessities, she has no special expenses. With the help of loans through the institution, Fatou would like to open additional points of sale, and increase her supply of dry goods.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods for resale.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 46-year-old man from Shieywe, in Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married and blessed with two children, who are 2 and 4 years old.

Reuben sells plastics, a business he has been in for the last 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more used plastics to resell. He will plow the anticipated income back into the business.

He has a dream of developing his business so as to better support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase more used plastics

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is 47 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Desideria works very hard to provide for them.

Desideria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell such as canned goods, rice, detergent soap, shampoo, hair conditioner, sugar, etc.

Desideria has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, detergent soap, shampoo, hair conditioner, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Desideria would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell such as canned goods, rice, detergent soap, shampoo, hair conditioner, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sope Saliou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Sope Saliou  se compose de 6 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes et qui habitent dans le même quartier et organisent des réunions semestrielles. Elles évoluent dans la commercialisation des céréales. La présidente Khady  est une femme mariée et mère de famille qui seconde son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter de produits alimentaires tels que le riz, le maïs, le mil. Khady commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 19h. Ayant une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité, elle voudrait diversifier ses produits et satisfaire ses clients afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Ainsi avec l’aide de l’institution elle va épargner de l’argent et avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
The Sope Saliou Group consists of six women who live in the same district and who organize biannual meetings. They operate in grain marketing. The president of the group is named Khady. She is a married woman and mother who assists her husband in managing their daily expenses.

She will use this loan to purchase grains such as rice, maize, and millet. Khady starts her day at 8 am to finish at 7 pm. Having an experience of over five years in this business, Khady would like to diversify her products to satisfy her clientele, with the goals of increasing her revenues and improving the living conditions of her family. In this way, and with help from the institution, she will be able to save money and become financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase grains such as rice, maize, and millet for resale

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Pacita works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Pacita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Hadija has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. Hadija dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, Hadija wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Moustapha Sy Group

texts.fr: Sope Serigne Moustapha Sy  est un groupement composé de 6 personnes qui habitent dans le même village et qui font des tontines ensembles. Madame Aïda est leur présidente, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo.  Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des légumes dans les marchés. Elle est agée de 41, mariée et mère de famille. Elle demande ce crédit pour acheter et vendre des légumes comme les aubergines, les choux, carottes etc.….  Elle aide son  mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a plus de 7ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle est persuadée que ce crédit va lui permettre de  diversifier ses produits et satisfaire ses clients, et en plus elle pourra épargner de l’argent à coté en augmentant ses revenus.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Moustapha Sy Group is composed of six women who live in the same village and who have an informal credit association. The president of the group is named Aïda and she is shown with her hand raised in the photo. Aïda is 41 years old, and is a married woman and mother. She has a business selling vegetables in the markets, and benefits from more than seven years of experience in this business.

Aïda starts her day at 8 am and finishes at 7 pm. She has requested this loan to purchase and resell vegetables such as eggplant, cabbage, carrots, etc. She helps her husband with the management of daily family expenses and with the tuition of their children. Aïda is convinced that with the help of loans through the institution, she will be able to diversify her products to satisfy her clientele, and in addition she will be able to save money while increasing her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, cabbage, carrots, etc., for resale at the market.

loans.name: Yorley Viviana

texts.es:
Buenas tardes les presento a la señorita Yorley Viviana tiene 21 años de edad, tiene una hija de tres años la cual responde en todos los conceptos por ella. Trabaja como Auxiliar administrativa desde hace 2 años, vive con la hija y los padres, en los ratos libres le gusta leer y lo que más la destaca a ella es el esfuerzo y empeño que ha puesto por salir adelante, la honestidad y entusiasmo por estudiar y poder tener un mejor empleo  y así mismo mejorar la calidad de vida.
Estudia en Campo Alto y está en 3 semestre de administración de empresas,  es una persona responsable y organizada con los deberes, aspira seguir la carrera como profesional y tener un mejor futuro siendo una excelente empresaria.
Necesita el subsidio de kiva ya que no cuenta con el presupuesto económico suficiente y quiere sacar la carrera adelante.
texts.en:
Good afternoon, we would like to introduce Yorley Viviana, who is 21 years old. She has a 3-year-old daughter, whom she supports in all ways. She has worked as an administrative assistant for two years. She lives with her daughter and her parents. In her free time, she likes to read. What is most noteworthy about Yorley is the effort and dedication she has put forth to get ahead, her honesty, and her enthusiasm for studying in order to get a better job and improve her quality of life. 

She is studying at Campo Alto, and she is in her third semester of Business Administration. She is a responsible person who is well-organized in her work. She plans to complete her degree as a professional and have a better future as an excellent businesswoman. 

She needs the loan from Kiva since she does not have a sufficient budget, and she wants to continue with her degree program.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of classes.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne  45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DAELLAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20Kgs de piment, 25Kgs d’oignon, 20Litres d’huile, et 10 paquets de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et à SAN.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 21 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma Group have an average age of 45 years and an average of four children. They are all living in traditional extended families in Daellan/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and have businesses  buying and selling "condiments" (vegetable-based sauces), and various other products. Having successfully repaid their prior loans, the women of the Sabougnouma Group are on their fourth group loan.

Bintou is shown in the photo seated on the far left. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 lbs of chilies, 25 lbs of onions, 20 liters of oil and ten packets of Maggi (bouillon) cubes. She purchases her supplies locally and in San. She sells her merchandise for cash and often on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. Bintou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 21,000 Francs CFA, which she will use to pay for health-related expenses and school fees, with the remainder to be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 lbs of chilies, 25 lbs of onions, 20 liters of oil and ten packets of Maggi (bouillon) cubes.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Salvadora, es madre de cinco hijos de 17, 15, 14, 12 y 6 años, cuatro están estudiando, junto a su madre aprendió a elaborar y comercializar piezas de loza, ya tiene quince años haciéndolo de manera independiente, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., ya posee clientes a los que les vende por mayor para la reventa de dichas piezas.
El financiamiento que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arcilla, nacazcol, leña y barro, al realizar dicha compra espera adquirir la materia prima a un precio más bajo y tener mayores ganancias, así cumplirá con la demanda de sus productos.
Su aspiración es crecer con su negocio para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos y cancelar las deudas.
texts.en:
Salvadora is the mother of five children, aged 17, 15, 14, 12 and 6, who are in school. Working alongside her mother, Salvadora learned to make and sell pottery items. She has been doing this work in an independent manner for 15 years now. Her schedule is 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has wholesale customers who buy her pieces to resell. 

She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying clay, earth, nacazcol [a black dye] and firewood. In making these purchases, she hopes to acquire her raw materials at a lower price and have greater earnings. In this way she will be able to fulfill the demand for her products. 

Her aspiration is to expand her business in order to improve her children's quality of life and pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy clay, dye and firewood.

loans.name: Amisa

texts.en:
Amisa has a business selling water. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of selling water wholesale in her village in the future. She also has a tailoring business to supplement her income.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase an overlock machine and threads for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine and threads

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 28 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Issa has been working hard to manage his produce shop, where he sells beans, maize flour and rice. 

To help expand his business, Issa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell. The loan will help Issa to generate greater profits, increase his stock and add more items to attract more customers. Issa hopes that in the future he will be able to own more rental houses. 

Issa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Issa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en: Yagub is 57 years old. He has been married for 33 years and has four children. Now he lives with his wife, little son and bride in Abseron region.  For 21 years already, they have been Internally Displated Persons (IDP) from Füzuli city. Yagub has been in the sheep-breeding business for many years. Today Yagub needs 1,550 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason, he has applied to Komak for a loan. He is planning to buy more lambs to increase his business. Yagub says he is thankful for the Kiva organization for the aid. In the future, he wants to help his son to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Haya Group

texts.en:
Rhodora is the featured borrower of Haya group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippine to come to Lebanon to work as housekeepers to support their beloved families.

Rhodora is the gentle lady holding a bag on the far left side of the picture. She is a 47-year-old married mother of two children devoted to support her family and children faithfully. She showed a good paying back history through her past three consecutive loan cycles, which she invested in rebuilding her house that was hit by the typhoon that hit her country recently. She’s aiming through this loan to dedicate her hard work to pay for her children's university education fees.

As for the other members, Mary Ann is the second lady from the left with a red top; Juanita is the second from the right with a black jacket, and Lezzel is the first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university education fees.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Philipo, who is in his mid 30s, is married. He has been running a business selling clothes on the streets for five years now.  He works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Philipo's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy clothes to meet his customers' demands.  He dreams of owning a big business.

Philipo will share this loan with his loan group "Mt Udzungwa" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухабату из района Хуросон 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Старшей дочери 29 лет, средней 14 лет. Младшему сыну 7 лет. Младшие дети ходят в школу,  и помогаю маме по работе. 8 лет назад Мухабат не работала и чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью начала работать дома. Она выращивала крупнорогатых скотов. Возле их дома есть пастбище для выгуливания скотин. Через некоторое время она устроилась работать в больницу медсестрой и по сей день работает в больнице. Ей нравиться ее работа но деятельность скотоводства Мухабат тоже не бросает. И решила количество скотин увеличить. Сейчас у нее имеется 4 голов скота и Мухабат надеется купить пару телят и увеличить поголовья. Но так как самостоятельно она не в состоянии совершить данную покупку Мухабат решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Muhabbat is 48 years old, married, and lives in the Khuroson district. She has three children: her oldest daughter is 29, the youngest is 14, and her son is 7. The younger children go to school and help their mother with work. Eight years ago, Muhabbat did not have a job but started working at home raising cattle to help her husband provide for the family. There is a pasture for the cattle to graze near their house. After a while she got a nursing job at the hospital and she still works there. She likes her job but she didn't stop raising cattle. She has even decided to buy more cattle. She has four head of cattle but hopes to buy a pair of calves. She decided to apply for a loan since she can't make the purchase herself.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Abudalah

texts.en:
Abudalah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Abudalah has been working hard to manage his retail shop, in which he sells essential commodities, such as sugar.

To help expand his business, Abudalah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items, such as sugar and salt, to sell. This loan will help Abudalah to generate greater profits and add more items that will increase his capital. Abudalah hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another car.

Abudalah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abudalah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items, such as sugar and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Mariam is requesting KES 40,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Adiah

texts.en:
Adiah is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is a widow and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Adiah has been working hard to manage her clothing boutique. 

To help expand her business, Adiah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of clothes for sale and will help Adiah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Adiah hopes that in the future, she will be able to become richer and educate her children in better schools. 

Adiah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Adiah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes for sale

loans.name: Sope Mansour Ndiaye Ii Group

texts.fr: SOPE MANSOUR NDIAYE II est un groupement qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent  toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois que le besoin se fait ressentir. Elles évoluent dans la commercialisation des tissus teints et de l’encens.  La présidente s’appelle DIAW, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, elle est âgée  de 32 ans. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des tissus destinés à la vente. Elle a comme charges particulières les besoins de sa famille et de ses sœurs. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 14h et a une expérience de 3ans dans son activité. A l’avenir elle souhaite grace aux crédits de l’institution devenir le fournisseur potentiel en produits pour femmes dans sa commune.
texts.en: SOPE MANSOUR NDIAYE II is a group composed of ten persons. They all live in the same district and meet whenever the need is felt. They work at selling dyed fabrics and incense. The president is named DIAW, the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is a married mother of a family and is 32 years old. She is requesting this amount of money to purchase some fabrics to resell. Her expenses in particular include the needs of her family and her sisters. Her day starts at 9 AM and finishes at 2 PM. She has three years of experience in this business. For the future, she would like to benefit from microfinance institution loans to become a potential supplier of products for women in her commune.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to resell

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito, ya que el coche en el que sale a vender sus productos se le ha dañado, pagará la reparación del coche y comprara harina de arroz, arroz, piñas, azúcar, leche, leña, canela, vasos y cucharas desechables, con lo que continuara vendiendo de manera ambulante y tendrá a su disposición la materia prima para la venta de atoles.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo inyectarle capital al negocio para que siguiera funcionando, tiene una mayor estabilidad económica, ha mejorado la alimentación y vestuario de su familia así como también su vivienda tiene una mejor infraestructura.
texts.en:
Sandra is applying for a new loan because the car she uses to sell her products is in need of repairs. She will use it to have her car fixed and to buy rice flour, rice, pineapples, sugar, milk, firewood, cinnamon and disposable cups and spoons, to continue selling her products as a street vendor and to have raw material available to the sale cornflower drinks. 
She used her last loan to inject some capital into her business to keep it operating. She now has a much better economic stability, she has improved her family's nutrition and clothing and her home has a much stronger infrastructure.

loans.use: to have her car fixed and to buy rice flour, rice, pineapples, sugar, milk, firewood, cinnamon and disposable cups and spoons

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.ru:
Рамзи жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 32 лет. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Рамзи живёт со своими родителями в городе. Он имеет высшее  образование. В свое время Рамзи с поддержкой своих родителей поступил в Государственный Университет, и получил высшее образование. Он пока  не женат, но собирается жениться после прохождения лечения.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Рамзи работает в Национальной библиотеке. Он там является старшим специалистом.  Также Рамзи подрабатывает тем, что переводит с иностранных языков книги и занимается научными работами.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Сейчас Рамзи хочет получить кредит на лечение своего организма. Ему необходимо купить дорогие лекарства, которые очень трудно найти. Но у него не хватает финансов для этого. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить медикаменты. Рамзи очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ramzi is a cheerful and hardworking 32-year-old man. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was an opportunity to receive financial assistance. Ramzi lives iwth his parents in a city. He has a higher education. Back in the day, Ramzi was able to enroll in the State University with his parent's support and received a university education. He is not yet married, but is planning to get married after the completion of his medical treatment.

In order to have earnings to live on, Ramzi works in the National Library. He is a senior specialist there. Ramzi also earns extra money by translating books from foreign languages and conducting scholarly research. He receives a good income from this business. Now Ramzi wants to receive a loan for the treatment of his body. He must buy this expensive medication, which is very difficult to find. However, he does not have enough money for this. This is why he is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy medication. Ramzi really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia was born in Machakos, a county in Kenya, and is part of a family of four. She is currently a student and an aspiring entrepreneur. She recently learned about the Fresh Life Franchise and thought it would be a good investment since a nearby market lacks enough sanitation facilities. 

Annastacia decided to join the movement so that she could raise extra income for her upkeep and chip in on her school fees. She hopes that her franchise will be successful and grow further to ease the sanitation burden at the market and create employment opportunities for the youth. She seeks a loan to help her finance the purchase of the two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.use: To purchase two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a youth brought up in Machakos, a county in Kenya, and moved to Nairobi, the capital, to look for a source of income. She is married and has one child. She also owns a hotel business and learned about the Fresh Life Franchise from her sister. 

Jennifer gained an interest in owning one of the franchises and plans to purchase two sanitation facilities and set them up at a busy market place. She will employ one person to run the franchise as she pursues her career in clinical medicine. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets. The income earned will be used to repay her loan and expand her franchise in order to create more employment opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, trabajaba en una panadería, se esmeró en aprender todo los procesos para elaborar el pan, desde hace cinco años lo hace por cuenta propia, su jornada es de cinco de la mañana a siete de la noche, Juan es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, todos dependen económicamente de él.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de harina, huevos, azúcar, levadura, canela, etc., son parte de los materiales  que necesita para aumentar la producción, atender a más clientes, mejorar las ventas y con ello también sus ganancias.
Su aspiración es continuar trabajando para tener los recursos económicos que le permitan construir su propia vivienda y seguir cumpliendo con los compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
John used to work at a bakery. He worked hard to learn all the processes to make bread, and five years ago, he decided to go on his own. He works long hours, from 5 to 7. John is married and lives with his wife and children, all financially dependent on him. 
He will use this loan to purchase of flour, eggs, sugar, yeast, cinnamon, etc., materials he needs to increase production, serve more customers, improve sales and thus also his profit. 
His aspiration is to continue working to have the financial resources that will enable him to build him own home and still meet his financial obligations.

loans.use: to purchase of flour, eggs, sugar, yeast, cinnamon, etc

loans.name: Nain Caleb

texts.es:
Nain, continuará cultivando maíz para seguir teniendo ingresos que utiliza para cubrir los gastos familiares, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, plaguicidas, pesticidas, herbicidas y semilla. También se mantiene trabajando en su taller de estructuras metálicas.
El efecto que tuvo al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio fue muy positivo, la cosecha fue abundante y de calidad, pues pudo satisfacer la necesidad de los insumos agrícolas que necesitaba en su momento, su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Nain wants to continue growing corn, that will help him to have an income that he will use to cover family expenses. He is requesting for a new loan to buy fertilizer, fungicides, pesticides, herbicides and seeds. It also works at his workshop making metal structures. 
The results he saw after using his previous loan in his business were very positive. His harvest was plentiful and of great quality. So, we he was able to meet his farming needs at the time, and he can now see that his family looks very healthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicides, pesticides, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Willian Alfredo

texts.es:
Willian, vive con su familia, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, en donde estuvo trabajando aprendió a elaborar diferentes tipos de arreglos florales, pero ya se ha independizado y cuenta con 15 años de experiencia. Es propietario de una tienda en la que ofrece diferentes accesorios para ocasiones especiales.
Con el préstamo comprara flores, alambre, espuma, cinta adhesiva, listones, tazas, piedras, dijes, broches entre otros, materiales para elaborar los productos que vende a sus clientes, espera obtener buenas ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su familia y cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es tener un local más grande para ofrecer a sus clientes los productos que ya conocen e incluir mercadería novedosa para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Willian lives with his family.  He does not have financial help from abroad.  Where he was working he learned to make different types of floral arrangements.  However, he has now become independent, and he has 15 years of experience.  He has a small store where he sells different accessories for special occasions.

He will use the loan to buy flowers, wire, foam, adhesive tape, ribbons, cups, stones, charms, pins, and other materials to make the products that he sells to his customers.  He hopes to get good earnings in order to cover the family expenses and repay the debt.

His dream is to have a larger place in order to offer his customers the products they already know about and to include new merchandise in order to get better income.

loans.use: to buy flowers, wire, foam, adhesive tape, ribbons, cups, stones, charms, pins, and other materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Peter has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different types of clothes for sale, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to add more clothes to increase his working capital. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more different types of clothes for sale

loans.name: Sope Seydi Diamyl 2 Group

texts.fr: SOPE SEYDI DIAMIL est un groupement de promotion féminin qui regroupe 10 personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier et qui font particulièrement les mêmes activités. Elles se réunissent à chaque fin de semaines pour prendre leur destin en main et développer leur localité. Elles ont comme présidente Madame Bineta qui a la levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la vente des friperies et a une expérience de plus de 3ans. Agée de 48 ans elle est marié et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 filles et 3 garçons. Elle démarre sa journée de 10 h  à 13h et de 16h à 20h avec une pause de 2h pour bien se reposer. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières et demande ce prêt pour acheter et vendre des friperies. A l’avenir elle voudrait avec l’aide de l’institution renforcer son commerce et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en: SOPE SEYDI DIAMIL is a [special] women's group composed of ten persons, who live in the same district and work in the same businesses. They meet each weekend to command their own destiny and develop their town. Their president is Ms. Bineta, whose hand is raised in the photo. She works in selling secondhand clothing and has over three years of experience. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children (3 girls and 3 boys). Her day goes from 10 AM to 1 PM, then 4 PM to 8 PM with a 2-hour break for a good rest. She has no particular expenses and is asking for this loan to buy and sell used clothing. For the future, she would like to bolster her business and satisfy her customers with the help of the microfinance institution.

loans.use: to buy and sell secondhand clothing in the market

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de café con pan dulce, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por que el producto es muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor  logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de café y pan dulces por mayor para seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 47, lives in a relative’s house with her children.  She sells coffee with sweet bread.  She does this in an itinerant manner at the different markets that are close to where she lives.  She has a lot of customers because the product is very marketable.  With what she gets from her sales, and with the help of her oldest son, they manage to pay for some of the household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy coffee and sweet bread wholesale in order to continue with her sales.  This is her only source of work.  This way she will be able to have a better quality of life together with her children.

loans.use: to buy coffee and sweet bread wholesale.

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es:
Julio, opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para que su negocio de transporte funcione de la mejor manera y tener a sus clientes satisfechos, comprara llantas y pagara el mantenimiento al sistema eléctrico de su vehículo.
El préstamo anterior lo utilizo para dar mantenimiento al vehículo, permitiéndole así realizar sus viajes con mucha seguridad, obtuvo ingresos que le han servido para cancelar sus deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
