Julio has decided to seek a new loan for his transportation business.  To keep his business running optimally and keep his clients satisfied, he will purchase tires and have maintenance performed on the electrical system of his vehicle.

He used his previous loan in order to perform maintenance on his vehicle.  This enabled him to do his work more safely.  He obtained enough income to pay off his debts and to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and pay for maintenance on the electrical system of his vehicle.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad, ve en los créditos una herramienta útil para que su negocio se mantenga funcionando, el crédito anterior le facilito la compra de los materiales que necesitaba para realizar su siembra, su cosecha fue abundante y continua mejorando su situación económica. 
El Sr.: Natividad se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla, pagar arrendamiento del terreno y mano de obra, para sembrar maíz y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Natividad sees loans as a useful tool for keeping his business working. His last loan helped him to buy the necessary materials for sowing. The harvest was plentiful and Natividad is continuing to improve his economic situation.

Natividad has decided to ask for a new loan that he will use to buy compost, fertilisers and seeds, and also pay for the land lease and labourers to sow corn and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilisers and seeds, and pay for his land lease and labour.

loans.name: Agustin Geremias

texts.es:
Agustín, está solicitando un nuevo crédito con el cual comprara cerdos, concentrado, abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y herbicidas, para incrementar el inventario de su negocio y tener todo listo para la siembra de maíz.
El capital anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, a tener un granos libres de plagas, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida, sus nuevas ganancias le permiten cumplir con los diferentes compromisos económicos que tiene.
texts.en:
Agustín is requesting a new loan to purchase pigs, concentrated feed, manure, fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides to increase the inventory of his business and have everything ready to plant corn.

His last loan helped him strengthen his business and have grains free of disease.  His family has a better way of life and his new earnings allow him to meet the different financial commitments he has.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, concentrated feed, manure, fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 47 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Рустам живёт со своей семьёй в городской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Рустам также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Рустам занимается своим делом. Он работает автослесарем и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. От данной работы, он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Рустаму. Сейчас Рустам хочет получить кредит для улучшения своего здоровья. Ему необходимо пройти курс лечения, принимая хорошие лекарства. Для этого Рустаму надо купить дорогостоящие медикаменты. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить медикаменты. Рустам очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rustam is a cheerful and hardworking 47-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support. Rustam lives with his family in an urban area. He does not have a higher education, as he did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in his family. Rustam's wife also does not have an education. She is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children.

In order to have an income to live on, Rustam has his own business. He works as an auto mechanic and has his own loyal customers. He receives a good income from this business. His wife also helps him. Now Rustam wants to receive a loan to improve his health. He must go through a course of treatment and take good medications. In order to do this, Rustam needs to buy expensive medications. This is why he is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy medications. Rustam really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy medication.

loans.name: Sope Mame Rawane Group

texts.fr: SOPE MAME RAWANE est un groupement de promotion féminin qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles se regroupent pour des tontines mensuelles. Elles évoluent dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires, comme le riz, le sucre, l’huile entre autres des aubergines, beignets et arachides etc…….. Leur présidente s’appelle AWA, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est âgée de 43ans, mariée et mère de famille (une fille et 2 garçons). Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires. Elle commence sa journée à 7h 30mn et se termine à 15h. Elle voudrait avoir ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter et vendre du riz, sucre, huile dans un marché de sa commune. AWA aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle souhaite augmenter son stock  pour satisfaire ses clients et épargner de l’argent afin de diversifier ses produits.
texts.en: SOPE MAME RAWANE  is a group promoting women. It is composed of ten persons, and they all live in the same district. They meet for the monthly tontines, and they work selling grocery items, such as rice, sugar, oil, eggplant, beignets, peanuts, etc…. Their president is AWA, whose hand is raised in the photo. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of a girl and two boys. She is active in selling grocery items. Her day starts at 7:30 AM and ends at 3 PM. She would like to have this loan to buy and sell rice, sugar, and oil at her commune's market. AWA helps out her husband in managing the day-to-day family expenses. She would like to increase her stock of products to satisfy her customers and to save some money, so as to diversify her products.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to resell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past six years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her child. Hellen hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale business. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Beugue Ligueye Group

texts.fr: BEUGUE LIGUEYE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 10 personnes et elles habitent dans le même quartier. Elles pratiquent les mêmes  activités. Elles se réunissent mensuellement et organisent des cotisations. Leur présidente s’appelle Aminata, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la vente des friperies et demande ce montant pour acheter et revendre des friperies. Elle est mariée et mère de famille, âgée de 33 ans Aminata a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a aucunes charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels car c’est son mari qui prend en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de leurs enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 16h. Grâce aux crédits de l’institution, elle souhaite à l’avenir augmenter son stock de marchandises et gagner une partie importante de la part du marché.
texts.en: BEUGUE LIGUEYE is a group of women composed of ten persons, all living in the same district. They have the same businesses, and they meet monthly and organize their payments. Their president is Aminata, who is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  She works selling secondhand clothing and is asking for these funds to buy and sell secondhand clothing. She is a married mother, 33 years old, and has over five years of experience in this business. She has no expenses in particular, aside from supporting herself, since her husband is the one covering the day-to-day family expenses. Aminata starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at 4 PM. Thanks to the loan from the microfinance institution, she would like to increase her stock of merchandise in the future and to win a significant part of the market.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to resell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 43 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has six children with five of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which sells various items. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more cement, nails, and hoes for sale, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to become a bigger supplier in the whole town. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock  more cement, nails, and hoes for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with two children and both of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market and from home and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to the university.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Los Solidarios Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karelin ella es soltera y tiene 31 años; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia vende a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia trabaja a pedido, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como perfumes para damas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de elaboración de panes, salón de belleza, negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

Los socios que salen a la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “LOS SOLIDARIOS” group.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

This member is named Karelin. She is single and 31 years old.  She works every day selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, etc. She sells to her friends and relatives and various other customers.  She also fulfills her customer's requests.  This work has gone well for her because it brings her both financial and personal rewards.  Her dream is to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy merchandise, such as perfume for women.

The other members of the group work in bakeries, beauty salons, in jewelry sales, grocery stores, and restaurants.

The members in the adjacent photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because they had to work.

This member is thankful to the people that are contributing to her dream via this process and she promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as perfumes for women.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Ana Francisca se sigue dedicando al negocio de consultorio dental,la socia tambien vende productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes,la socia yas tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cremas,lapiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Ana Francisca, continues to devote herself to her work in a dental office.  She also sells beauty products such as lipstick, creams and perfumes.  She has been conducting this business for many years, and it has gone very well.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell beauty products.

The member is seeking a loan to purchase creams, lipsticks and perfumes.  She is very happy with the loan and is committed to making the payments on schedule.

loans.use: purchase creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor, es una joven de 29 años de edad que junto a su esposo de 33 años  de edad, se apoyan mutuamente en los gastos de su familia, han procreado a dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, se dedica a atender una pupuseria como una manera de tener ingresos para cubrir parte de los gastos de su hogar, trabaja de lunes a sábado, le apoya en el negocio su mamá.
El financiamiento que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de gas propano, repollo, tomates, aderezos, chicharrón, quesillo, bebidas, etc., dicha compra le ayudara a incrementar el inventario, dar un mejor servicio, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias.
Su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando y tener mejores recursos económicos para dar un estilo de vida más confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is a 29 year old woman who lives with her 33 year old husband.  They support each other with the household expenses.  They have two children, ages five and seven.  She works in her business selling pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans), by which she is able to earn an income to cover part of their household expenses.  She works Monday through Saturday, and her mother helps her with the business.  

The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase propane, cabbage, tomatoes, salad dressing, pork rinds, cheese, drinks, etc.  This purchase will help her to increase her inventory, provide better service, increase her sales and increase her earnings.  Her goal is to continue working and have more financial resources in order to provide her family with a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: purchase propane, cabbage, tomatoes, salad dressing, pork rinds, cheese, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Dayan Raquel

texts.es:
Ella es Dayan Raquel es una mujer luchadora con ganas de salir adelante con muchos propósitos y metas para la vida.
En las mañanas es madre y ama de casa, en las tardes trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería hasta las 11:00 p.m y los sábados que es el día de descanso estudia administración en salud.
Se siente muy contenta y orgullosa porque mucha gente la juzgo cuando entro a estudiar, decían que criar un bebe de mes y medio, trabajar, ser esposa y estudiar todo a la vez no se podía, pero hoy en día tiene el orgullo de decir 	que el hogar va de maravilla, la hija tiene 9 meses, esta grande, en  el trabajo se siente contenta, y en el estudio va en segundo semestre y próximamente seré una técnica administrativa en salud y tendrá un empleo el cual le permita brindarle tiempo y una mejor calidad de vida a la familia.
Todo esto lo ha conseguido y lo va a conseguir gracias a campo alto y al subsidio que kiva le puede dar para una facilidad de pago y la ayuda que le brindan los buenos docentes que afortunadamente tiene. 
Da gracias a Dios, campo alto, kiva a los compañeros y a las personas que hasta el momento la han apoyado en las etapas difíciles en las que ha pasado para poder cumplir la meta.
texts.en:
Dayan Raquel is a determined woman and wants to move forward with her many intentions and goals in life. In the mornings she is a mother and housewife, and in the afternoons she works as a nursing assistant until 11pm. 

On Saturdays, which is Dayan's day off, she studies health administration. She feels very happy and proud because many people judged her when she started studying, saying that raising a 6-week old baby, working, being a wife and studying all at the same time could not be done. Now she can say that the house is wonderful, her daughter is now 9 months old and getting big. At work she feels happy, she is in her second semester of studying and she will soon will be an health administration specialist and have a job that will allow her to spend more time with her family and give them a better quality of life.

Dayan has managed all of this, and will continue to manage thanks to Campo Alto and the loan that Kiva can give her to help with payments, and the help from the great teachers she has been lucky enough to have. She gives thanks to God, Campo Alto, Kiva, her friends and the people who have supported her in the difficult stages she has been through in order to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay enrolment fees for a semester.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a community health worker and a mother of two. She was born and raised in Kakamega, a county in Kenya, and later moved to Nairobi and settled in the expansive Mukuru informal settlements. 

Noel owns a school in Mukuru settlements which is attended by children living in the area. The school however faces a challenge for it does not have sanitation facilities. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets for the school. The facilities will prove important for the pupils at the school and prevent outbreak of sanitation-related illnesses. Noel hopes that the facility will also increase the attendance of current students and also increase the number of new students.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Amit

texts.en:
Amit is 33 years old and lives with his wife and child. He also takes care of his parents. Previously, Amit worked for a bottling company. After the factory closed, he started planting rice. Rice cultivation is now the only source of income for him and his family. 

Without a permanent job, Amit had nowhere to go for a loan. Seva MFI has helped him to progress with small loans. He always repaid those loans on time.  

Amit wants now to expand his rice fields in order to earn more money for his family and his parents. For this he needs a loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase flour in bulk, cans, yeast, lard, etc.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en casa de un familiar, Desde hace 17 años  que se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Reina  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, y agujas, para poder atender un pedido grande de uniformes con el que cuenta y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Reina is 49 years old. She lives with her husband in a relative's house. Since the age of 17, she has worked as a tailor. In this time she has gained a lot of experience as well as regular clients. She is a very responsible person who works very carefully to give her best.

Reina is asking for a loan that she will invest in her business, buying larger quantities of raw materials such as fabrics, buttons, needle and threads.This will mean that she can fill bigger orders of uniforms that she relies on, and that she doesn't lose the opportunity to increase her earnings, in order to have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles and threads etc.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru:
Исматулло жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 44 лет. Он женат и имеет 2-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку для развития своего бизнеса.  Сам Исматулло живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не учился Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Исматулло также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Исматулло занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Исматулло подрабатывает строителем, собирает доски для продажи и занимается пчеловодством.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Исматулло в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Исматулло хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Исматулло очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ismatullo is a cheerful and hardworking 44-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He turned to Arvand when he realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support to develop his business. Ismatullo lives with his family in the countryside. He does not have a higher education, as he did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in his family. Ismatullo's wife also does not have an education. She is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children.

In order to have an income to live on, Ismatullo has his own business. He fattens up and sells cattle. Ismatullo also earns extra money as a builder, collecting lumber for sale and through beekeeping. He receives a good income from these businesses. His wife also helps Ismatullo with this business. She sells the milk which she gets from the cows. Now Ismatullo wants to increase the size of his herd to expand his business. This is why is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Ismatullo really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en:
Aloysious is 58 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala north region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past 10 years, Aloysious has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Aloysious has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different types of clothes for sale, and will help Aloysious to generate greater profits and take care of his medical bills. Aloysious hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another piece of land. 

Aloysious is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aloysious who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more different types of clothes for sale

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Doña pastora, es comerciante de cosméticos por catálogos y costurera, esta ultima labor la ha venido realizando hace muchos años, lo que le ayudo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, aunque cuando enviudo le fue muy difícil mantener a sus hijos sola, pero gracias a Dios pudo lograrlo, hoy solamente una está bajo su amparo, los demás ya son independientes. Esta humilde señora solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando cosméticos variados y telas, para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Pastora makes her living by sewing and by selling cosmetics through catalogs.  She has had the sewing business for many years, and this has helped her to provide a better life for her children.  When she became a widow, it was very difficult to raise her children on her own, but thanks to God she was able to do it.  At present only one child is still under her care; the rest are already independent.

This humble woman is seeking a loan to invest in her businesses.  She will use the loan in order to purchase cloth and various cosmetics. This will enable her to satisfy the demands of her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and various cosmetics.

loans.name: Alejandro Alfredo

texts.es: Alejandro de 33 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. Alejandra tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 33 years old and lives alone in his own home.  He works growing corn and beans, and has worked in agriculture for many years, which has given him a lot of experience that allows him to produce the best harvests.  He sells his harvests throughout the community.  He has many customers who choose him because of the quality, the fair prices and above all else, the good service.  

He is seeking a loan that will allow him to purchase seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  Alejandro has good payment references from his acquaintances, and he is very responsible.  He ensures that he will be able to pay back the loan in the allotted time, and he is also confident that he will be able to provide financial security to his household.

loans.use: purchase seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Fatima. She is married, and has two children aged ten and two years old. One is a school going child. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to be fostered. In 2007, Fatima established her rice, beans, gari, benin and couscous business. She began her business because she didn't attend school. She was only introduced to business by her parents.  When she matured, her father gave her an amount of money which she used to buy groundnuts to sell at home. She generated some profit and started to go to the market for a food item business. After she got married her husband added an amount of money to her capital to continue the same business. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,250,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatima requires a loan in order to buy bags of rice, gari, benin and beans. In the future, Fatima plans to develop their piece of land and provide quality education for their children. The loan will help to develop the business. Scarcity of goods and changes in prices are her major challenges.  She is accommodating and friendly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, gari, benin and beans.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca  is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling Cavendish bananas and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая  женщина в возрасте 39 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребёнка.  Вера живёт со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание Вера занимается своим маленьким делом, которое приносит ей доход. Она работает в местной школе, продаёт пирожки в столовой, которые сами печёт. 

Этим делом она занимается вот уже несколько лет. Все ученики очень любят пирожки её изготовления. Также Вера продаёт эти пирожки не только в школе, но и дома, изготавливает их на заказ. Муж Веры хочет поехать на заработки в Россию. Там у него имеются знакомые, которые обещают найти хорошую работу, чтобы он получал хорошую заработную плату. Но сейчас у них не имеется достаточная сумма для покупки билета и всех необходимых вещей для поездки. Поэтому Вера обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку билета своему мужу. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Vera is a cheerful and hardworking 39-year-old woman. She is married and has one child. Vera lives with her family in a small village. In order to earn a living, Vera has her own small business which provides her with an income. She works in a local school, selling pastries in the cafeteria which she bakes herself.

She has been running this business for several years already. All of the students really loves the pastries that she makes. Vera not only sells these pastries at the school, but also at home on a by-order basis. Vera's husband wants to work abroad in Russia. He has acquaintances there who promise to find him a good job so that he can receive a good salary. However, they currently do not have enough money to buy a plane ticket there and to buy all of the necessary things for the trip. This is why Vera requested a loan from Arvand to buy a ticket for her husband. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a ticket to Russia for her husband.

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia ella es soltera, tiene 34 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros, la socia trabaja a pedido a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias a lo empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable  y empeñosa, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de cerámica en frio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cremas para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de restaurant, negocio de taller de carpintería, imprenta, negocio de venta de pasteles.

En la foto grupal salen dos niños.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Sembrando" communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.  The member applying for this loan is Lidia.  She is 34 years old, single and has one son.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her cosmetics business, where she sells perfumes, colognes, and creams among other products.  She works via order for her customers, such as friends and family members, who request her products.  She has worked in this business for a long time, and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business everyday.  She is a responsible and earnest person.  She also works selling cold porcelain, which allows her to get her family ahead.  

The member requested a loan to purchase creams for her business.  The other members in the group run businesses such as grocery stores, restaurants, carpentry workshops, printing shops, and bakeries.  In the picture, there are two children.  The member is grateful for those who are a part of making this dream come true through this loan.  She is committed to adhering to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: purchase creams for her business.

loans.name: Salam S

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Salam. In 2011, Salam established his business, selling rice, sugar and vegetable oil. He began his business, he said, "to fight my way through to further my education." Located in the outskirts of the city, his business is open 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. His main customers are neighbors and passersby.

Salam has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan of SLL 4,500,000 in order to buy bags of rice, sugar and vegetable oil to sell to his customers.

Salam was able to save in his account part of the profit he made from the last loan that he was very proud of and he still plans to expand his business in the future. He hopes that this loan will help attract more customers again. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, sugar and vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Гулмира позитивная и трудолюбивая девушка в возрасте 20 лет. Она замужем но пока не имеет детей, так как она совсем недавно вышла замуж и является молодой невесткой. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Гулмира мечтала закончить университет, и иметь высшее образование, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Гулмиру выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой.  Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своё будущее всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Гулмира вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Она выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Гулмира получает хороший доход. Муж Гулмиры также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Гулмира с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Гулмира заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Gulmira is a cheerful and hardworking 20-year-old lady. She is married but does not have any children yet as she just got married not too long ago and is a young bride. She lives in a small country village. From childhood, Gulmira dreamed of graduating from university and having a higher education but circumstances happened such that she was unable to receive a higher education due to financial difficulties in her family. Right after she graduated from secondary school, Gulmira got married and became a homemaker. She and her husband try to do all that they can to provide their future children with all of the necessities.

In order to have a steady income to live on, Gulmira and her husband started their own business. They practice livestock breeding. Gulmira raises the cattle and then sells the meat and milk that she gets from them. She receives a good income from this business. Gulmira's husband also works in a local workshop and his job brings in additional income for the family. Their cumulative earnings are enough for an average standard of living. Now they do not have enough money to cover all of their current needs. Currently, Gulmira and her husband want to buy several more heads of cattle to fatten up. This is why she requested a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Gulmira thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Wikaash

texts.en:
Wikaash is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son. He comes from a farming family and has learned rice cultivation with his upbringing. 

Previously, he helped his parents on their fields. After Wikaash’s marriage, he independently started working with small loans from Stichting SEVA Microfinance Institute. He has fully repaid those loans. 

Wikaash plants hired plots and he wants to save for their own plots. To do this, he has expanded his rice areas this season. To cover the cost of this expansion, Wikaash needs a loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Saidu.  He is married, and has three children aged 12, 7, and 4 years; two are school-going children. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to be fostered.  

In 2005, Saidu established his business selling jeans, school bags, crepe, shirts, skirts, children's dresses, etc.  He began his business because he was introduced to farming; considering their financial status, his elder brother loaned him some amount of money to start business.          

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Saidu requires a loan in order to buy jeans, crepe, skirts, leotards, and shirts. 

In the future, Saidu plans to complete his building project, educate his children and rent a shop.  This loan will help to improve his business. Lack of a shop is his major challenge.  Saidu is a hardworking businessman.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, crepe, skirts, leotards, and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 21 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los precios accesibles, La clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas ropa por mayor, y poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así seguir ayudando a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: This client is 21 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has earned her living selling clothing for 2 years. She does her work in the various villages that are close to her home. She has many customers for her quality products and affordable prices. The client is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing wholesale to continue with her sales because it is her only source of work. She can continue to help her family with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Israel Humberto

texts.es:
Israel, tiene ya dos años dedicándose a administrar su granja de pollos de engorde, lo aprendió de un amigo, trabaja todos los días, Israel tiene 37 años de edad y su esposa 32 años de edad, son padres de dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad.
Solicita crédito para comprar pollos, concentrado y vitaminas, con lo que mejorara el cuido de los mismos, se le facilitara su comercialización, espera aumentar su cartera de clientes y que su rentabilidad sea más favorable para poder resarcir su deuda.
Anhela crecer son su negocio para que sus utilidades aumenten y ofrecer una mejor alimentación y vestuario  a su familia.
texts.en:
Israel already has two years of experience managing his chicken farm. He learned this work from a friend. He works each day. Israel is 37 years old and his wife is 32. They are parents of two children of 15 and 12 years.
He has applied for this loan to buy chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins which will improve his care of the chickens and facilitate their sale. He expects to increase his customer base and profitability which would be favorable for repaying his loan. He hopes to grow the business, increase profits, and offer better food and clothing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Las Marias De Quixaya Group

texts.en:
Eleven women live in the rural community of Quixaya community outside of the town of San Lucas Toliman on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. The women are neighbors as well as good friends. They decided to form a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Las Marias de Quixaya," which means “The Marias of Quixaya.” The ladies are looking forward to investing capital into their small businesses which include the sale of foods (fruit, cheese) as well as clothing and shoes. Other women raise chickens and livestock that they sell at nearby markets. And others have invested in convenience stores where they sell everyday items.

Cresencia is a 49-year-old member of the Trust Bank with seven children. She has a dynamic personality and is quite active in the group. Cresencia buys day-old chickens that she takes care of for 15 days and then sells. She also sells fully mature chickens to farms that are located around her community. Cresencia is requesting her very first loan which she will use to purchase a large number of chickens as well as chicken feed. Her goal is to increase her inventory to 600!

Cresencia was only able to complete kindergarten and is keenly aware of the importance of a good education. Three of her children are currently enrolled in school and she is quite pleased about this. Along with the ten other ladies in the Trust Bank, Cresencia reaps benefits from the monthly educational trainings given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. The women are eager to learn about business administration (money management, budgeting, customer service, sales), women’s and children’s health and hygiene, and self-esteem.

“We appreciate the support of KIVA investors for ourselves and our community,” states Cresencia. “It is a huge step for us to have access to a loan. We will work hard and provide benefits to our families.” 

Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase a large number of chickens.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria de 60 años de edad posee desde hace 15 años un puesto de venta de cereales, galletas y golosinas, ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastso que se el presentan en su hogar,  vive en casa propia con esposo, posee tres hijos que son independientes pero les ayudan económicamente, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener junto con su esposo una mejor vida.
texts.en: Maria, 60, has had a small stall for selling cereals, cookies, and baked goods for 15 years. It is based in the market that is close to her home. She has many customers who come to her for her good prices and her friendliness when making a sale. WIth her earnings, she manages to cover some of the household costs. She lives in her own home with her husband. She has three children who are independent but she helps them economically. Maria is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale and to continue with their sales because that is her only source of work. She wants to be able to have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, cookies, and baked goods wholesale.

loans.name: Gao Wouro Debel Group

texts.fr: GAO WOURO DEBEL est un groupement de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et fond parti d’un regroupement de femmes qui cotisent chaque 15 jour. Elles évoluent dans la même activité. Leur présidente s’appelle Dieynaba , c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Sa principale activité est la commercialisation des  ustensiles de cuisine dans le marché. Elle a une expérience de plus de 2 ans dans cette activité.  Elle sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter et vendre des ustensiles de cuisine. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 19h. Dieynaba n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels.  Elle souhaite renforcer ses marchandises et devenir le fournisseur potentiel dans la zone.
texts.en: GAO WOURO DEBEL is a group of women composed of ten persons who live in the same district and who belong to a group of women paying dues every two weeks. The women work in the same businesses. Their president is Dieynaba, the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is married and a mother. Her main work involves selling utensils at the market. She has over two years of experience in this business. She is requesting this loan to buy and sell kitchen utensils. Her day starts at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM. Dieynaba has no expenses in particular, aside from her personal needs. She would like to bolster her merchandise and become a potential supplier in her area.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils to resell

loans.name: Allen Musis

texts.en:
Allen Musis is 32 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Allen Musis  has been working hard to manage her brick factory where she sells bricks. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials that will be useful in making the bricks, and will help ALLEN MUSIS to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Allen Musis  hopes that in the future she will be able to set up more rental houses. 

Allen Musis  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials that will be useful in making  bricks

loans.name: Badiru

texts.en:
Badiru is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mayunge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Badiru has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods such as sugar. 

To help expand his business, Badiru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential inventory for the shop like sugar, milk and other items, and will help Badiru to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Badiru hopes that in the future he will be able to own the biggest retail shop around town. 

Badiru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Badiru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential inventory for the shop like sugar, milk etc. for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar  más mercadería por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client is 25 years old and sells all kinds of personal care products such as lotions, deodorant, creams, perfumes, and others. Her business is located in her home and her earnings from her sales are used to cover the costs of her home, alongside the help of her husband. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. The client wants to increase her business so she applied for a loan that allows her to buy more products at low prices so she can sell to her customers at affordable prices which can get her better profits. She wants to continue giving her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale personal care products

loans.name: Ndattou Group

texts.fr: NDATTOU est un groupement de femmes composé de 10 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois que de besoin. Elles veulent  prendre en main leur destin et développer leur localité. Elles ont comme présidente Madame Rouguiatou qui est une femme mariée et mère de famille, et elle a 58ans. Malgré son âge , elle est très active et a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité car elle gère un restaurant  et y vend le petit déjeuner, le déjeuner et le diner. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières car ceux sont ses grands enfants qui font la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h du soir. A l’avenir, elle souhaite renforcer son stock de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire ses clients et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en: NDATTOU is a group of women composed of ten persons, all living in the same district and having the same businesses. They gather monthly as needed. They want to command their own destiny and develop their town. Ms. Rouguiatou is their president, a married mother who is 58 years old. Despite her age, she is very active and has over ten years of experience in her business, since she manages a restaurant selling breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She has no expenses in particular because of her grandchildren, who manage the day-to-day family expenses. Ms. Rouguiatou starts her day at 9 AM and ends at 8 PM. For the future, she would like to bolster her stock of merchandise, so as to satisfy her customers further and to put some money aside.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her restaurant

loans.name: Sope Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr: Elles sont dix à s’être réunis en groupe de crédit : SOPE KHADIM RASSOUL. Elles logent le même village et font toute du commerce. Madame Alima est la présidente du groupe, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo et elle évolue dans la vente de denrées alimentaires. Elle gère une mini boutique ou elle vend de l’huile, du sucre, des bonbons et divers. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 19h. Elle appuie à la dépense quotidienne de la famille et a d’autres charges comme celles liées à l’exploitation. Elle en est à sa première expérience de crédit et cela lui permettra de diversifier ses produits, augmenter sa part du marché et de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en: The SOPE KHADIM RASSOUL loan group is composed of ten female members. They all live in the same village and are traders. Madame Alima is the President of the Group and is standing with her hand raised in the photo. She trades general foodstuffs and manages a small store where she sells oil, sugar, candy and various other products. She has more than 10 years of experience. She begins her day at 8am and finishes at 7pm. She contributes to the daily expenses of the family and has other expenses such as operational costs. This is Alima's first loan cycle and she will use the money to diversify her products, increase her market share and improve the food situation of her family.

loans.use: buy general foodstuffs to display and sell to customers

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 57 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

She has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Cristita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Diego René

texts.en:
Diego is a small entrepeneur client of Kubo Financiero.

Diego is 43 years old, is married, has three children and lives in a house with some relatives. He has a sewing workshop in his house where he receives the commodities from his clients who require his work and processes them into the final product ordered. He has been in this business for 15 years now.

He is asking for this loan to buy a multipin sewing machine that will help him to process bigger loads of work. Diego has achieved with the effort from his job providing a stable lifestyle for his family and he aspires to send his kids to college. His biggest goal is to continue improving his business and make it bigger.

loans.use: to buy a multipin sewing machine

loans.name: Brayan Danilo

texts.es:
El es el joven Brayan con múltiples sueños desde niño, como ser astronauta, policía e incluso veterinario, descubrió algo muy curioso en un área muy particular LA COCINA.
Fue una tarde de abril en la cual descubrió que la única forma de encontrar paz y una gran tranquilidad era entre cuatro paredes, entre hornos y sartenes.
Con el tiempo ese amor y esa tranquilidad que sentía al estar en una cocina fue creciendo, el no sabia en que momento y en que instante comenzó a trabajar en un restaurante, tal vez era simple casualidad del destino o tal vez el destino intervino en la vida. 
Lamentablemente en aquel restaurante había personas con un nivel gastronómico excelente y con una agilidad a la hora de preparar alimentos inigualables, y fue así que comenzó trabajando como mesero.

El quería aprender de cada persona algo y siempre intentaba dar lo mejor de el no le importaba que fueran cinco minutos al día, a pesar de las quemaduras por los hornos y por los sartenes, el dolor en los pies por estar todo el día parado, y el dolor de no estar con la familia en las fechas importantes no le importaba, por que nada igualaba la adrenalina que el sentía al ver el lugar de trabajo a reventar y saber que todo se debía ver perfecto ante los ojos de los clientes.

Un día no lo pensó dos veces y descubrió un lugar en donde le ofrecieron la posibilidad de aprender sobre el gran amor, Las artes culinarias, y así sin pensar en cuanto esfuerzo esto implicaría decidió estudiar, el decidió ser artista, el decidió entrar en campo alto para hacer y desempeñar el propio arte, el arte de cocinar, jugar e innovar día a día con los alimentos, tal vez el no sea millonario, tal vez el no fue una persona reconocida y tal vez nunca le llagaron a dar un aplauso por el arte, pero el se alegraba y amaba mas el arte cuando veía como las personas degustaban con gran aprecio de las preparaciones. 

El necesita del convenio con kiva ya que el mismo se paga los estudios, y el dinero no le alcanza lo suficiente, para cubrir los gastos del semestre y los gastos que el tiene el el hogar o que necesita a diario.
texts.en:
Young Brayan has had many dreams since he was a child, such as becoming an astronaut, a poilceman and even a vet, but he discovered something really curious in a special place: the kitchen.

It was one afternoon in April when he found a unique way to find peace and great tranquility between four walls, ovens and frying pans. Over time, this love and tranquility that he felt in the kitchen grew. He is not sure exactly when he began to work in a restaurant. Perhaps it was simple chance or maybe fate intervened in his life.

Unfortunately, in that restaurant there were people with an excellent knowledge of gastronomy who worked well preparing unrivalled food, so he began to work as a waiter. He wanted to learn something from everyone, even it was just for five minutes a day. He always tried to give of his best, in spite of the burns from the ovens and pans, the pain in his feet from standing all day and the pain of not being with his family at important times. Nothing mattered compared with the adrenaline that he felt in the workplace, knowing everything should be perfect in the eyes of the customers.

One day he didn't think twice and discovered a place where they offered him the possibility of
learning about his great love, the culinary arts. So, not thinking about how much effort it would mean, he decided to study, to become an artist, and go to CampoAlto to develop this art of cooking - playing and innovating daily with food. He probably would never be a millionaire, never be well-known and probably never gain applause for his art. However, he was pleased and loved his art best when people really appreciated his dishes.

He needs a Kiva loan to pay for his studies as he doesn't have enough money to cover the term's fees as well as his household and daily costs.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with three children and all of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. 

Halima works from the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of selling on a wholesale basis and also buying  a plot of land and building a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 37 years old and married, with seven children. With four children currently in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell, like cooking oil, diapers, bread, sugar, and coffee.

Imelda has been in this business for eight years and she sells a variety of items, such as cooking oil, diapers, bread, sugar, and coffee. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like cooking oil, diapers, bread, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Francisca is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Francisca has a general store business in the Philippines. Francisca requested a 12,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Francisca has been in this business for six years. Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en:
Joralyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Joralyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 26 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Merlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Grimilda Xiomara

texts.es:
Seis filas de pares de zapatos de caballeros, son puestos en exhibición sobre dos pequeños estantes que acobijan la tienda de Grimilda en Estelí. En el ala izquierda, son las mujeres quienes gozan de la variedad de camisas y calzado colorido que esta mujer comercializa.
Escondida detrás de una vitrina con ropa nueva y rodeada de cajas de todos los colores de zapatos, parece ser que esta madre soltera no soltará una sonrisa, sin embargo, sus 8 años como comerciante muestran sus grandes deseos de superación. Desafortunadamente Grimilda no pudo asistir a la universidad, caso que la motiva a seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Con el préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA, para poder brindarles a sus dos hijos la educación que ella no pudo tener. Ahora desea un nuevo financiamiento para hacer crecer el negocio mediante la compra de ropa de verano, chinelas, trajes de baño, zapatillas, camisas, entre otros productos, pues en esta temporada las ganancias incrementan gracias a la gran demanda. Entre sus metas principales está obtener su propia casa, ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Six rows of pairs of male shoes are put on display on two small shelves in Grimilda's store in Estelí. On the left side of the store, the section for women who enjoy the variety of colorful shirts and shoes that Grimilda sells. 
Hidden behind a glass case with new boxes surrounded by all of the colorful clothing and shoes, it seems that this single mother will not stop smiling. Her 8 years as a seller show her great desire to succeed.
Unfortunately, Grimilda could not attend college which was her motivation to continue to invest in her business. Her MiCredito and Kiva loan will provide her two children with the education she could not have. Now she wants another loan to grow her business buying summer clothing, slippers, swimwear, shoes, shirts, and other products as this season's earning increase due to high demand. Among her main goals are to have her own home, as she currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing, swimwear, sandals, and more.

loans.name: And Diappo Group

texts.fr: And Diappo est un groupe de crédit qui est composé de dix  membres qui évoluent dans le commerce. Elle est âgée de 56 ans et est l’ainé du groupe et fait office de présidente, elle s’appelle MAIRAME et  évolue dans la vente de riz qu'elle achète en gros dans les champs pour les revendre en détail sur le marché locale. Elle a une expérience de 8 ans.  Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Il faut dire que grâce au crédit, elle pourra se charger dorénavant de la scolarité des enfants puisse qu’elle pourra avoir un fond de commerce qui lui permettra de ne pas être en rupture et de générer régulièrement  un bénéfice. A l’avenir elle souhaite avoir une cantine au marché et devenir le fournisseur potentiel. Elle voudrait aussi épargner de l’argent pour  diversifier ses produits
texts.en:
And Diappo Group is made up of 10 members who are advancing in trade. [The featured borrower] is 56 years old, is the eldest in the group, and is acting as president. Her name is Maraime and she is advancing in the sale of rice, which she purchases wholesale in the fields in order to sell it at resale prices in the local market. She has eight years of experience.

Maraime begins her day at 8:00am and finishes it at 7:00pm. It should be said that, thanks to her loan, she will be to send her children to school from now on since she will have a business that will keep her from being unemployed and will yield a regular profit. In the future, Maraime hopes there will be a cafeteria at the market, where she can become the primary supplier. She would also like to save money in order to diversify her wares.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell at the market.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans, Koffi pour subvenir à ses besoins revend des poissons frits depuis 2008 à ses clients à domicile.Il est à son troisième crédit de prêt et cet argent l'aidera à s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Il espère devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard une famille.
texts.en: A young man of 27, Koffi has been selling fried fish door-to-door since 2008 to meet his needs. He is on his third loan cycle and this money will help him resupply in order to meet customer demand. Koffi hopes to become a wholesaler and, later, to start a family.

loans.use: to buy fried fish

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Liza has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Liza has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 37 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Myrna requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and has three children. Rosalie is married and has three children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional livestock, vaccines, and other supplies for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vaccines, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Rowena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 35 years old and married, with two children. 

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, and other groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nenita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Romelisa

texts.en:
Romelisa works hard to support her family. Romelisa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Romelisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Romelisa has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is 35 years old and has five children. Rubelyn is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Rubelyn is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rubelyn has been in pig-fattening for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her business, like flour, sugar, and margarine.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business, like flour, sugar, and margarine.

loans.name: Arlita

texts.en:
Arlita is 31 years old and has two children, both of whom attend school. She is married.

Arlita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Arlita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle. Arlita has been raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Little Seeds Preparatory (A) Group

texts.en:
“My happiness is immeasurable,” says Domneikim. She lives with her two boys. Her husband is working in the capital city of India, and he is working in private BPOs. The husband’s income is insufficient to support the family’s needs, and therefore Domneikim also sells liquid detergent dish wash. She is also engaged in generating income by giving spa treatments. She had her training before her marriage. 

Domneikim and her son are pictured with their hands raised. She is featured as the profile member for the group. The group comprises 15 women members, who are tirelessly making an effort to support their kids’ education. They called themselves "Little Seeds Preparatory (A) Group".

Domneikim sells liquid dish wash (manually prepared), and she is also engaged in spa treatments. She has been a very supportive mother and wife; she shows great interest in her kids’ education. Her dream is to educate her sons and make them intellectually sound and capable.

With the help of the Kiva education loan, she will pay for her son’s admission fees, textbooks and stationery, and other annual expenses for the year. She shares that educating her kids is her main focus, and that she will work very hard to repay the loan on time. 

The rest of the group members will also pay for their kids’ education expenses. They all are grateful to Kiva and say, “Thank you so much, Kiva.”

loans.use: to pay for the admission fees, textbooks and stationery, and other annual expenses for the year.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old, single, and has four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like snack foods, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and other groceries to sell.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water and vegetables.

Carmen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like snack foods, coffee, sugar, canned goods, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Adelia has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Adelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more raw materials for her weaving business, like abaca fiber.

Adelia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business, like abaca fiber.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth, who is single, has had an abaca weaving business in the Philippines for 10 years now. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, es casado, tiene tres hijos en edades de 21,13 y 3 años de edad, vive en casa propia, su negocio consiste en vender ropa para caballero, damas, niños y niñas, así como también brinda el servicio de taxi,  realiza estas actividades con ayuda de su esposa, tiene un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su negocio nace por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Utilizara el capital para comprar pantalones, faldas, blusas, vestidos, trajes para niños y niñas, ropa interior para ambos sexos, le dará la oportunidad de surtir de estilos, colores y tallas su inventario,  ofreciendo mejores opciones de compra para sus clientes.
Su visión es mantener funcionando su negocio para tener una rentabilidad que le servirá para cancelar la deuda adquirida, continuar pagando su casa y apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is married and has three children, ages 21, 13, and 3. He lives in his own home. His business consists of selling clothing for men, women, boys and girls. He also provides taxi services. He does these things with his wife's help. His work schedule is from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.

His business arose from the need to earn income to cover his family's expenses.

He will use the capital to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, dresses, boys' and girls' uniforms, and men's and women's undergarments. This will give him the opportunity to stock his inventory with different styles, colors, and sizes so that he can offer better options to his customers.

His goal is to keep his business profitable, which will allow him to cancel the debts that he has acquired, continue to pay for his house, and support his children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, dresses, boys' and girls' uniforms, and men's and women's undergarments.

loans.name: Warlyn

texts.en:
Warlyn, 33 years old and single, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the last 15 years she has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Warlyn has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, a 35-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a general store business in the Philippines for nine years. 

Emily has requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 59 years old and married with six children. 

Fe is in the agricultural business farming banana in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fe has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Herminia works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Herminia has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.
