loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la crianza de pollos desde hace 2 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para los pollos y así poder seguir con la crianza que le genera buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has been raising chickens for two years. Ana sells her products in the surrounding areas of her neighborhood. With the profit she earns from her sales, she is able to help her husband with some of the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for her chickens. This will enable her to continue raising these animals so that she can generate good earnings and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are currently in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with six children.  She is 41 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosario has a broom making business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for three years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosario requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Mardie

texts.en:
Mardie is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mardie has a general store business in the Philippines. Mardie requested a PHP 17,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks like snack foods, juice, soft-drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, diapers, etc. to sell.

Mardie has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Mardie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, milk, etc. to sell. Maricel has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 44 years old; she is married, and has four children who are in school.

Teofila is in the agricultural business; she has been farming bananas in the Philippines for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teofila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seedlings and other farm supplies.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 27-year-old single man from Deir El balah city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a simple house. Ayman has some experience in cutting hair. He would like to be independent so he opened his own barber shop two years ago. It is a very good business and he has loyal customers. 

Ayman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Ayman will be able to improve his business and increase productivity. 

Ayman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es: Doña Lesbia trabajo por años como docente, hoy en día es jubilada y también se mantiene gracias a su labor como costurera, viuda madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, ella ha venido mejorando su casa con el apoyo de financiamientos, requiere el crédito para realizar un cuarto para su hija, con el crédito anterior solamente pudo comprar parte de los materiales, esta vez comprara los que le hace falta como laminas de zinc y perlines, de esta manera doña Lesbia desea brindar apoyo a su hija quien está intentando independizarse.
texts.en:
Doña Lesbia worked for years as a teacher. She is now retired, but she still supports herself thanks to her work as a seamstress. Lesbia is a widowed mother of five grown children. She has been able to make improvements to her house with the help of loans.

Lesbia is now requesting a loan in order to build a room for her daughter. Her previously loan only allowed her to buy part of the materials. This time she will buy items that she is lacking, such as zinc sheets and crossbeams. Doña Lesbia wants to support her daughter, who intends to become independent, in this manner.

loans.use: to buy additional construction materials so that she can build a room for her daughter.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia Marleny se sigue dedicando al negocio de mantenimiento de computadoras y oficinas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de mantenimiento de computadoras y oficinas.La socia solicita le credito para uso personal para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marleny continues to dedicate herself to her business of providing maintenance services for computers and offices. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has been working in this business for many years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of providing maintenance services for computers and offices.

She requests this loan for personal use to purchase a television for her home. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her home.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines.  Vilma has been in this business for 17 years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, milk, cereals, sugar, etc.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, milk, cereals, sugar, etc to sell.

 Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, milk, cereals, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a tobacco vending business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 29 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Violeta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers.

Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tobacco to sell to her customers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia has been in this business for 12 years now.

Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 31 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Virginia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani is a very hard worker, married, and a father of four children. He’s been involved in agriculture for a long time, although he had also worked as a janitor for a public company before he lost his job due to the economic crisis. 

With unemployment being high, he was unable to find another job, but has been able to continue working in agriculture at least. For Shani, he considers himself lucky to be able to continue to work planting different vegetables because it still provides his family the income that they need as he is the primary source of income while his wife stays home taking care of the children and house. 

Shani is now in need of a loan so that he can build a greenhouse to grow and keep his vegetables longer; it will allow him to be able to sell his vegetables in the village. 

He hopes to continue to work in agriculture, and be able to improve the living conditions for his family through this means. 

His goal is to give his children a better education; he wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse to grow and keep his vegetables longer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's higher education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, loroco (an edible flower), beverages, oil, cheese, beans, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Kitale area of North Rift, Kenya where she practices farming as a source of income. She has been doing this for 5 years.  Her primary sources of income are crops, transportation services, and a retail business.

She is married, and has two children who are of school-going age. She said that what gives her the most satisfaction in farming, seeing her clients happy, and coming for more of her farm produce.

Her biggest challenges are lack of enough raw materials and the drought season.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo because their products are basically for farming, which will help small-scale farmers.

During the training, she learned that by borrowing money from microfinance institutions, one can accumulate agricultural assets.

She will purchase more poultry through this loan, which will increase her income level, enabling her to cater to her family's needs better.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Mario Guillermo

texts.es: En Grecia, los cuidados de la salud eran practicados por diferentes grupos, todos ellos elaboraron un concepto de enfermedad de forma racional, despreciando las creencias, saberes y poderes sobrenaturales y considerando solamente la intelectualidad. Don Mario, un Señor de 44 años de edad, dedica todo su tiempo y esfuerzos a su trabajo, su familia y a sus hijos especialmente, nos confiesa que desea una reconstrucción de su baño sanitario de su hogar. Comenta que su meta más próxima es invertir en su casa para ir mejorando de poco a poco en su vivienda. Solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un servicio sanitario que presente las mejores condiciones higiénicas que el que posee. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que le brindara excelente condiciones de salud e higienes a su familia e hijos. Teniendo como planes futuros la inversión continua para la remodelación de su casa para un futuro más próspero de sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Greece, good hygiene was practiced by different groups. They created a concept of illness that was based in rational thought, disregarding the beliefs, thoughts, and supernatural powers, and only considering rational thoughts.

Mario, who is 44 years old, dedicates all of his time and efforts to his job, his family, and especially his children. He tells us that he hopes to re-build a bathroom in his home. He comments that his next goal is to invest in his home so that he can improve it little by little.

He requests a loan to build a restroom that has hygienic standards as high as he does. He believes that the loan will be very helpful since it will provide excellent health and hygiene standards for his family and children. 

His future plans include continuing to invest in re-modeling his home so that his children can have a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to build a restroom.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, baked goods, greens, and other food products to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 61 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Hace 6 años ha cultivado café de buena calidad, la producción la vende en la misma zona. El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento a dos manzanas de finca de café. Su plan es mejorar cada día la finca para sacar mejor producción y aumentar los ingresos y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 61 years old. He is married, has three children, and lives in the Santa Barbara municipality. He has always worked in agriculture and has grown basic grains like corn and beans. Six years ago, he began growing high-quality coffee. He sells his products in the same zone.

The loan that he is requesting is for 25,000 lempiras, and he will purchase fertilizers to care for two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of coffee plants. His plan is to improve his farm each day to produce a better product, increase his income, and improve his family's well being.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to maintain two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of coffee plants.

loans.name: Narciso De La Paz

texts.es:
Narciso, vive con su familia integrada por su esposa y una hija, todos dependen económicamente de los ingresos que obtienen del negocio que hace mucho instalo en su casa, en sus inicios fue una pequeña tienda de artículos varios, mediante financiamiento y esmero de su parte ha crecido, actualmente es una librería con una buena cartera da clientes.
Comprará  diversos libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, papelería, borradores, velas, etc., incrementará su inventario, ventas y ganancias, espera también satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
Su sueño seguir trabajando para que su negocio se mantenga ofreciendo mercadería de calidad y así mantener su fuente de ingresos activa, para cancelar el préstamo y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Narciso lives with his family, which includes his wife and daughter. They depend financially on the income that he earns from the business that has been located in their home for many years. Earlier, it was a small general store. Through financing and great care on his part, it has grown and is now a bookstore with a good portfolio of customers. 

He will purchase different books, notebooks, pens, stationery, erasers, candles, etc. to increase his inventory, sales, and income. He also hopes to fulfill his customers' orders.

His dream is to continue working so that his business continues to offer quality merchandise. He also hopes to maintain an active source of income to re-pay the loan and move forward with his family.

loans.use: to purchase various books, notebooks, pens, stationery, erasers, candles, etc.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Celestina is 49 years old and three of her eight children are currently in school.

Celestina has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Celestina requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Celestina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Celestina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Germilita

texts.en:
Germilita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Germilita is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Germilita has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. Germilita requested a loan of  16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her business.

Germilita has been in this business for 13 years.  In the future, Germilita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business. She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Lourdes successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more feed and grass for his livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock and raise them to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies such as lemons, fish, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Ngeisok Lom Group

texts.en:
Vungngaihliani is a talented lady; she is gifted in making accessories, such as traditional necklaces, earrings, bracelets, etc. (The colorful necklaces and earrings are displayed in the above profile picture.) 

She says that it doesn't fetch her much profit because she makes the accessories in exchange for cloth from the customer. Expressing her view, Vungngaihliani says it would be much more profitable and less stressful if she had capital to run the business as an entrepreneur. This is because she has to make the jewelry as per the customer's choice and meet their expectations, too, and get the jewelry ready before the deadline. 

Therefore, she wishes to set up her own jewelry shop, but with the meager income she gets, it is very difficult to manage the family and her children’s expenses. Her husband works on a daily-wages basis as a carpenter; hence, his income is not reliable. She wanted to expand and raise her business standard. Therefore, with the WSDS loan amount, she will invest in buying varieties and better quality beads. From the income she generates, she plans to open her own savings account to start up her own venture. 

The rest of the group members are also into homemade accessories businesses. Vungngaihliani express her sincere gratitude to WSDS for being such a great help.

loans.use: to buy more items like beads, thread, glue and plastic wire to make necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 49 years old and has nine children. Esmeralda is married and two of her nine children are currently in school.

Esmeralda is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Esmeralda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esmeralda has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 46 years old and has seven children. Marlene is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marlene requested a 12, 000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marlene has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair parts and new mobile phones for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual e va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeños siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a  su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de zanahorias para su negocio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women]. 

She continues working at her business, selling vegetables in one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She has been working at this business for quite some time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is a responsible and determined person, as this is the way that she provides for her family.  

The member has requested the loan in order to purchase carrots for her business. She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue in her occupation and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase carrots for her business.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 20-year-old single man from Deir el Balah city. He lives with his family in an old house. His father works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Anas started his own business which is transferring goods in the local market using a rental rickshaw. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Anas took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy his own rickshaw for his work. By taking this loan, Anas will be able to increase his income and productivity. Anas appears in the photo with his rickshaw

loans.use: to buy his own rickshaw for his work

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 40 years old and married with three children, currently in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15, 000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of shampoo, bread, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of shampoo, bread, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, a widow who works hard to support her family, has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 14 years now. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients such as vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc. for her enterprise.

Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada, su esposo tiene 27 años de edad, viven con su hijo de 2 años de edad en casa de su madre, como apoyo para cubrir gastos de su familia desde hace tres años se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de pan, sale a vender todos los días.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra huevos, azúcar, harina, levadura, etc.,  su producción aumentara, continuara cubriendo la demanda de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus clientes, tener mayores ventas y mejorar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para cancelar la deuda adquirida y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Ana, 20 years old, is married to her husband who is 27. They live with their 2-year-old son in her mother's house. In order to help the family cover its expenses, for 3 years now Ana has baked and sold bread. She goes out to sell her bread every day.

The loan will be invested in purchasing eggs, sugar, wheat flour, yeast, etc. Ana's production will increase and she will be able to cover customer demand. Ana hopes to increase her number of customers and to have greater sales and better earnings.

Her dream is to continue working in order to pay off the debts she has acquired and to improve her family's circumstances.

loans.use: buy eggs, sugar, wheat flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the family agricultural land

loans.name: Rica Jane

texts.en:
Rica Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Rica Jane requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dominggus

texts.en:
Dominggus is a 35-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and siblings. To help his parents in fulfilling the family needs, Dominggus works as a farmer. He plants vegetables, corn, and beans to be sold in the market. He cultivates those crops on his own land. He has monthly income of IDR 600,000.  

As a breadwinner for his family, Dominggus is also responsible in covering the educational expenses of one of his sisters. However, he has very limited money to do so, therefore he had applied a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,500,000. That loan has been used to pay the college registration fees of his young sister.

loans.use: to pay the college registration fees of his young sister.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the store instead of paying rent every month.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 35-year-old man who is married to Fransina, a 22-year-old woman. They have been blessed with four children; Jerita, 4; Yeningsih, 2; and the twins: Yuningsih and Ria, 5 months old.

Simon generates income for his family by working as an 'ojek' or motor taxi driver. He works 10 hours a day, starting at 7 am and working to 5 pm. Simon has been engaged in this job for years and he really enjoy it. In order to produce extra income, Simon and his wife plant crops on their farm, i.e. corn and cassava, and sell them at the market. 

Recently, Simon is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 6,000,000 to purchase a second-hand motorbike for his young brother. Simon believes that it can help his young brother to make money for himself and be more responsible in maintaining that motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorbike for his young brother

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 16 years. 

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines and has been in pig fattening for eight years.

Teresita requested a 13,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs. She has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more quinine, paracetamol,  caught syrup, blood tonic, etc., to expand his business.

loans.name: Jamai

texts.en:
Jamai is 49 years old and a married man with four children. His oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest one is 11 years old. He studied in elementary school, but he couldn't complete his study. 

Jamai still suffers from the rent which he pays to the owner of the house for many years. In time, he has been able to accumulate a good amount of money and bought a piece of land. He built the first floor of a house on that land. Due to the economic crisis in the country, Jamai feels unable to renovate this floor and build the second one. For this reason, he applied for a loan from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase cement and materials in order to renovate his house.

Jamai looks forward to building the second floor and renovating it and renting the first floor.

loans.use: To purchase cement and materials in order to renovate his house.

loans.name: Shafeeq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shafeek and consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Latifa is a 33–year-old widow woman with two children. Her oldest child is three years old and the youngest one is five months. She lives with them in a rented house. Latifa already has good experience making Yemeni incense and perfumes and reselling them to cover the expenses of her family. She has been involved in this business for three years and her primary customers are local residents. From this business, she earns a small amount of money which is not enough for her family’s sustenance. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy materials in order to make incense and resell it.

Latifa wishes to keep improving her business to be able to obtain better earnings. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: To buy materials in order to make incense and resell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory for his business, including drinks, soap, and sardines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
Galib is a 38-year-old married man and father of two children, with ages of 6 and 7. He lives with his family in a small house. Three years ago, Galib opened a small grocery shop on the balcony of his house, where he sells regular grocery products that customers often request. He would like to improve his business, to rent a place, and expand it.

The loan he has applied for will help him to buy more products to resell. By taking this loan, Galib will be able to improve his business, earn more money, and realize his plans.

loans.use: To buy more products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Runyararo

texts.en:
Runyararo is a 26-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe with her parents. Determined to support her family, Runyararo started her own business selling clothes and other products to local businesses. 

Runyararo also volunteers as a Cama member, a network of Camfed alumnae who volunteer their time making their communities better places. In addition, she works with local schools teaching children about healthcare. 

Runyararo will purchase more clothes, blankets and shoes with this Kiva loan. She hopes for a successful business in order to pay for her siblings’ education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock (clothes, blankets and shoes).

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney has been in the payroll industry for over five years. After the company where he was working went out of business last year, Rodney saw an opportunity to branch off on his own. Many of Rodney’s existing clients admired his work and asked him personally to continue his payroll and consulting services for them. With their support, Rodney became excited to go into business for himself.

Being an immigrant from Guam, Rodney knows what it means to face challenges head on. This “whatever it takes” mentality, along with his experience in payroll and sales, makes Rodney a natural entrepreneur. He likes the freedom and flexibility that comes with having one’s own business and has also been enjoying learning about all the skills necessary to run a business. 

This start-up’s main challenge has been maintaining consistent cash flow when clients do not pay on time. Unlike other major companies that have a lot of extra capital, Rodney has little margin in his month-to-month revenue, and one bad month could adversely affect his business. 

Rodney will use his $8,500 Kiva loan to strengthen his cash flow, providing an adequate cushion for him when clients do not pay on time. 

Currently, Rodney is running a one-man show and plans to keep it that way for a while, entertaining the idea of a small office in the near future. He is already thinking about expanding his services and currently has his eye on Austin, Texas.

loans.use: to strengthen his cash flow, providing an adequate cushion for him when clients do not pay on time.

loans.name: Rwis Group

texts.en:
Rwis is a group that consists of four women who live in Hodiedah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80, 000 YER from AL-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Fyroz is a hardworking woman. She is a widow woman without any children. After death of her sole breadwinner (her spouse), Fyroz came back to the house of her parents. Now, she doesn't have any breadwinner who can assist her in the expenses of living.  

Previously, she helped her mother in the business of selling children's clothes, perfumes, and incense in the street. Now, she runs this business herself. Thanks to her experience, she deals with her own business with ease. Unfortunately, the income of this business is very low and most of she earns goes to her expenses, and she wants to improve her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothing, perfumes, and incense.

She looks forward to expanding her business and opening a small stall to sell women's clothes, perfumes, and incense.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothing, perfumes, and incense

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 48-year-old, married mother of five children, who has been running her convenience store since 1994. Hiba is Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development's faithful borrower for six consecutive cycles. Her previous cycles helped her a lot in developing her business and covering her beloved family's increasing needs.

Today, Hiba's acquired loan will be invested in paying for her children's increasing university tuition fees. She is very proud of herself and she is working hard to keep on developing her children's talents and knowledge, to see them become important people in their society. Hiba hopes to keep on developing her family's socioeconomic situation in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing university tuition fees.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 43-year-old married mother of two children who has been working in her fish selling shop since 2008. She learned this business from her parents and is developing it properly to keep it as a good income business in order to support her beloved family and cover their needs.

Dalal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to expand her small shop to a wider restaurant where she can expect more customers and provide them with delicious fish plates and specialty sauces.

Dalal sells fresh, fried and grilled fish to please her customers in different ways and attract new ones.

She hopes that in the future, she can expand her working place more or move to a wider place.

loans.use: To expand her small fish shop to a wider restaurant

loans.name: Mukaramjon

texts.en:
Mukaramjon was born in 1980 and is a widow. She is the only provider for 3 children. She needs money to provide her children with all necessary things, and that’s why she began her own business 5 months ago. 

She makes national toys and sells them in a local market. She has her regular customers, and in this way she earns a living. Mukaramjon is going to develop her new business, and so he is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy raw materials for making toys. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making toys

loans.name: Durahshon

texts.en:
Durahshon is a young and successful woman; she is 19 years old. Durahshon is not married, and lives with her parents. She did not have the opportunity to enter any university after graduating from school. 

Now she is going to start her own business deal. She is going to start the business with sewing national women's dresses. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a women's organization. She got a lot of useful information for herself. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for starting her new business. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for starting a new business

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Seen in this photo, Jihad is a 23-year-old single man from Rafah. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His mother is an employee in the public sector where she earns a small salary, the only source of income for the family.

Jihad is a university student where he studies Press and Media. Jihad has taken out a 990 USD loan from FATEN that will help him buy a new laptop for his studies. With this laptop he will be able to write reports and read articles online.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en: This new 16,000 PHP loan is Ma. Rolita's twenty-fifth loan from NWTF.  She plans to use it as rolling capital so that she could buy more groceries to sell in her store. Her general store continues to provide Ma. Rolita's family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring shop in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Felisa is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married mother with a child. She works selling shoes and slippers in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling firewood and soft-drinks. Arlene works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities with her previous 11 loans through NWTF and Kiva.

Arlene is requesting a 55,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of shoes and slippers to offer for sale. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes and slippers to offer for sale.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit lives in Stepanavan with his wife and daughter, Anna. His daughter studies at the university where she specializes in pharmacy. Davit is a builder by profession and a seasonal migrant worker. His wife is a housewife who is unemployed and takes care of the household. Because of difficult financial conditions, Davit is unable to pay for his daughter Anna's university tuition and that's the reason he has requested this loan. Davit will be very grateful to lenders if they support him with the loan and give him an opportunity to pay for Anna's university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Mercedita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 50 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Isabelita works very hard to provide for them.

Isabelita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. 

She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. Isabelita has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell such as candies, shampoo, biscuits, curls, bath soap, detergents, soft drinks, powdered drink, and canned goods. 

Isabelita is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Run Roern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Run, 62, has eight children in total. Run and her husband have been farming rice for 12 years. She is able to earn about 80,000KHR per day to support her family. 
Run has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Chhiet Yim's Group

texts.en:
Choert, 30, is married with two dependent children. His family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district and the main sources of his family’s income are from farming rice. He has been running his business for 15 years, earning about KHR 34,000 per day and he is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day. 

Choert received his first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund a cycle ago and he successfully paid back the past loan. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Kouk Chiv's Group

texts.en:
Kouk, 38, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is widowed with five children. She earn a living through farming rice. She has been in this business for four years. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day.

This is Kouk’s fourth loan with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. Now Kouk is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Zehra

texts.en:
Zehra is married, with two children. She carves meerschaum items for sale with her husband, whose family has worked in the business for five generations. After Zehra married, she learned to work and sell meerschaum. After 15 years of doing this work in the village, they opened a store two years ago. 

With the loan, Zehra will buy materials. She wants to reach many people with her carvings and to make sales. Zehra contributes to her family's income and the national economy. Her goal is to raise her children and bring them into this profession.

Her husband in the photo,standing with Zehra.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Zehra, evli iki çocuk annesi.  Lületaşını işleyip ,üretip satışını yapıyor.  Eşi ile beraber eşi 5 kuşak baba mesleği olan bu işi yapıyor.  Zehra Hanım evlendikten sonra lületaşını işlemesini öğreniyor ve satışlarını yapıyor.  15 yıldır  köyde yaptıkları bu isi , dükkan açarak  2 yıldır yapmaya devam ediyor.  Aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.  İşleyip üreterek çok kişiye ulaşmak ve satış yapmak istiyor.  Zehra Hanım aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Hedefi çocuklarını yetistirip ,aileden gelen bu işi çocuklarına bırakmak istiyor.
Kocası ,Zehra ile resimde yanayana.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Al- Fayha Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fayha. It consists of four ladies living in Aden, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid of 220,000 YER from AMB to boost their business.

The group's representative, Rayda, is 43 years old and married with four children, living with them in their own house. Her oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old. She is the leader of the group.  

Rayda studied until secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies because of many circumstances inside her family. She decided to help her husband in the expenses of their family. 

She has started up as a door-to-door seller for 20 years by selling accessories, makeup, and other women's things. Her income from this small business is good, but not enough to develop it; most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family.

Therefore, she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell. 

Rayda looks forward to expanding her business and provide her family with better living conditions. 

Her dream is renovate her old house.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and makeup to sell.

loans.name: Little Seeds Preparatory (B) Group

texts.en:
Featured profile member Lamneilhing is a resident in a village, which is ½ km from the small town, which is again 30 km from the capital town of Imphal. She is 32 years of age and is blessed with two sons. She and her son are pictured with their raised hands. Ten women members who are also mothers formed the group and called themselves “Little Seeds Preparatory (B) Group”.

Both her children are studying in private school. Her husband is a daily-wage earner, and the income is completely unreliable and irregular. Lamneilhing sells army canteen items and supplies the small shops in the town market. In order to supplement the income of the family, she sells the the items in the neighbouring villages and also door to door. She got a few thousand from her business. 

She wants to give her children a good education, but due to poverty, she could not give them the best education. Sometimes, she could not afford to buy the textbooks and notebooks.

She wants to avail the education loan from Kiva so that she can buy the study materials and other necessary educational expenses for the whole session. She hopes her burden will be diminished immensely and will enlighten her kids' lives in the future. She also thanks Kiva in particular and WSDS in general for providing the education loan.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses like admission fees and other annual expenses.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva runs a small stall which sells snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Eva lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Eva is married and living with three people in the family home. As seen in the picture Eva with her husband.

Eva began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a small operation

loans.name: Tarini Group

texts.en:
Shobha is a married woman, 37 years old, who lives in a remote village called Chandanpali in the Subarnapur district of Odisha, India. The lady sitting in the middle of the front row with her hand raised is Shobha.  Her family consists of five members (her husband, one son age 4 and two daughters age 8 and 12). She is very energetic, hard working and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to getting her family ahead.
 
Shobha has been doing animal trading and goat-rearing businesses with her husband in her village for the last 10 years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business with a low profile and limited investment and purchased a few goats. Gradually, she expanded her business and added some goats every year. In 2014, Shobha and the other 14 members of her village formed a Group and took loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their business. This is the first loan of the group. Now Shobha is earning 5,000 INR per month from her business, which is too low to manage her big family. To add some extra income, her husband is doing some seasonal business. So with this loan, she has purchased some goats to raise and invested some in her animal trading business. Shobha has a long cherished desire to build a pacca house for her family. 

The other 14 members of her group are doing a milk business, goat rearing, animal trading, vegetable vending, running a grocery shop, a hotel, tailoring, etc.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 51 years old lady, married, and has five children. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a professional map maker, which he has been doing for nine years. He is a guardian of his family and responsible to manage the entire household.
Shamim's husband wants to purchase different types of stationary and colors for map making purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy these accessories to fulfill his business needs. Therefore her wife Shamim has applied for kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to buy business relevant items so that he can easily continue his work.
On this financial support Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase some accessories to using in map making

loans.name: Hepziba Lom Group

texts.en:
“When you suddenly find yourself without your life partner, you don’t know what to expect. Your world’s been turned upside down,” says Zamkhongai. She is the featured profile member of Hepziba Lom and is pictured with her hand raised. 

Zamkhongai is a single mother of five children; she has three sons and two daughters. Her husband died when the children were very young, and she raised all of them single-handedly. Whilst the younger kids were still young, she could not go out and earn a living. Therefore, in order to sustain the family, her eldest son helped her in earning money by engaging himself in carpentry work in the nearby locality. 

As all the children have grown up now, with the skills she had, she and her daughters weave to generate more income in the family. They weave colorful wraparound traditional skirts and sell them to the distributors for 2,000 to 4,000 INR per skirt. This traditional wraparound skirt is in great demand during festive seasons like Christmas and marriage occasions. She gets a lot of orders from her clients and distributors. However, due to financial crunches, she could not afford to buy yarns or employ people to weave. 

As this is one of the booming businesses in Manipur, Zamkhongai wishes to expand and continue this business in the future. However, she does not have capital to invest; therefore she wanted to avail a loan from WSDS to get financial assistance. With the loan amount, she will buy yarns and hire more people to weave so that it brings more income and meets the customers’ demands on time. She sincerely appreciates WSDS for the generosity and thoughtfulness towards her and the group. 

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving and second-hand businesses.

loans.use: to buy yarns for weaving wraparound skirts, mufflers and shawls.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 40 years old and married, and she is the mother of two sons. Her husband is an active person and by profession he is a cotton merchant in the local market. He is the only person responsible for meeting the needs of his family and managing the entire household.

Shaheen's husband wants to expand his cotton business and therefore needs to buy cotton in bulk for his business. However, due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy the cotton to meet his business needs. Therefore Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband will be able to buy the relevant merchandise for his business and be able to expand.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance .

loans.use: to buy cotton in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is a 37-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children and her husband is a plumber by profession. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Riaz has also been doing her business of clothes selling for the past six years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Riaz needs to buy different types of clothes for the purpose of reselling but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose, and therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business. For this financial assistance, Riaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes for the purpose of reselling

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hard working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers different types of delicious foods. Shazia cooks some dishes for the restaurant and the people like to eat at her husband's restaurant. He employes one worker at the restaurant. Shazia's husband has been running his restaurant for many years, that is why most of the chairs, utensils, and crockery have broken. Her husband wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery but his major income is spent on household expenses. Shazia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use for her husband to buy plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery. Shazia thanks to kiva and its field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 36 years old, married woman. She is mother of six children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband has been providing services in building ceilings decorating work on demand for many years. Nowadays, the demand for his services has increased but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw material for ceiling work. Therefore, Shahnaz has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva, so that her husband can buy raw material such as aluminum, cardboard, chipboard and wooden planks. Shahnaz seems very glad and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
Note: Shahnaz representing herself by raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as aluminum, cardboard, chipboard and wooden planks for making ceilings.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad y su madre quien depende de ella económicamente. Marta es una mujer trabajadora y comprometida en su trabajo. Hace todo lo que este a su alcance para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Marta trabaja como operaria en una fabrica cercana a su localidad y de esta forma mantiene la economía de su hogar. Sus condiciones de vivienda son muy sencillas por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la cocina dado que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y pagará la mano de obra para la reconstrucción.
texts.en: Marta is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her eleven-year-old son and her mother, who depends on her financially. Marta is a hard-working and dedicated woman. She does everything within her power in order to support her household. Marta works as a machinist in a factory near to her home and, through this work, looks after her household. Marta's living conditions are very simple and so she has taken the decision to apply for this loan from "FUSAI" to fix the roof of her kitchen, which is currently in bad condition. Marta will use this loan to buy galvanised metal sheeting and wood, and to pay labourers to carry out the work.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheeting and wood, and to pay labourers to fix her kitchen roof.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia María Teresa  pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir  apoyando a su familia.
La socia María Teresa solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
María Teresa is part of the "Mujeres Emprededoras" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues working with her business buying and selling clothes. María has had this business for some time now and it is going well thanks to her determination at work every day. María wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

María is applying for this loan in order to buy jumpers for her business.

María is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy jumpers for her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, forma parte de una familia integrada por su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa en un horario de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, con el cual genera los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Para aprovechar la próxima temporada de vacaciones necesita contar con nueva mercadería, comprara chores, calzonetas, camisetas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, toallas, etc., espera atraer nuevos clientes y tener un negocio más rentable.
Anhela seguir trabajando, cambiar las circunstancias familiares y dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and has two children, aged nine and eight years old each. He makes a living selling clothes from 6 a.m. until 4 p.m. This business provides him with an income in order to pay for basic necessities for the family.

In order to take advantage of the holiday season, Francisco needs to buy new merchandise: he will buy shorts, shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts, swimming trunks, towels and more. Francisco hopes to attract new customers and have a more profitable business.

Francisco wants to keep on working, improve his family's life, and give his children the opportunity to study at university.

loans.use: to buy shorts, shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts, swimming trunks, towels and more.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
Don Fernando, un comerciante por 14 años y con grandes deseos de superación reflejados en su leve sonrisa, está rodeado por productos, que hacen de su pulpería una de las mejores en las calles de Granada. 
Los colores llamativos de un arcoíris de productos básicos como los consomé, la salsa inglesa, la mostaza, el pasta de dientes, entre otros, hacen resaltar  las expectativas positivas de Don Fernando, pues sabe que seguirá ofreciendo una variedad de productos, entre ellos recargas de celulares. Por esta razón solicita un crédito para seguir comprando más aceite, arroz, jabón, entre otros productos que sustentan la pulpería, a él y a su familia. Entre sus planes a futuro mantener su negocio aseado, creativo, llamativo y variado, a como sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en:
Fernando has been a businessman for 14 years. He has a great desire to get ahead, as can be seen in his smile. Fernando is surrounded by products which make his business one of the best in Granada

The colourful staple goods - such as soups, Worcestershire Sauce, mustard, toothpaste and more - raise Fernando's expectations as he knows that he will continue to offer a variety of products, including phone top-ups. To continue offering this variety, Fernando is applying for a loan in order to buy more oil, rice, soap and other goods that keep Fernando's grocery and his family going. Included in his plans for the future, Fernando wants to have a clean, creative and varied business, just like his customers expect.

loans.use: to buy more oil, rice, soap and other products.

loans.name: Al-Atsam 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Atsam 2.  It is made up of five women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. Om- Al- Khair is the group's leader.  She is 47 years old, and a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old. One of her goals is to continue to grow her business. She started her business to help her husband cover their family's expenses. In time, she earned a good amount of money, and she decided to continue. Since she has professional experience in this field, she has attracted more customers. She has been selling Sambusa (a traditional food) for three years in the streets.  The income from this business is very low, and she hopes to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She is using her share of the loan to purchase more goods such as floor, sugar, and potatoes, in order to make Sambusa (traditional food) and sell it to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business, so that she can increase her revenue. 

 Om- Al-Khair hopes to earn large profits, so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan, and further expand her business and open a small shop for the Sambusa (traditional food).

loans.use: to buy more goods such as, flour, sugar, and potatoes to make Sambusa (traditional food) to sell.

loans.name: Al- Nisma4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Nisma4. It is made up of four women, from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Najla is the group's leader. She is 36 years old, married and has five children. One of Najla's goals is to continue to grow her business. She started her business seven years ago with a small amount of capital. Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracted many customers, and is successfully running the business profitably. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to expand her business; therefore, she is requesting a loan from AMB. She is using her share of the loan to invest in her business, by buying more clothes and variety goods,  such as perfumes and accessories for resale to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. Najla hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and variety goods, such as perfumes and accessories for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his father's medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 45-year-old widow who lives at Silanga, Tangub City,  Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from the neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon their sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.
 
Through Paglaum PC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy additional bags of feed for her piggery business. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to increasing the income of her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed for her piggery business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is married with four children. Angelita is 34 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City.

Angelita sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to restock her inventory of rice to sell.

Angelita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Angelita hopes to increase their living standard.

loans.use: to restock inventories of rice for sale

loans.name: Mayumi

texts.en:
Mayumi is 56 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is married with three children.

Mayumi is engaged in soft drink retailing and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase cases of soft drinks to sell

Mayumi has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Mayumi hopes to improve her livelihood in order to offer more services to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Aimalefoa

texts.en: Aimalefoa is 44 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Aimalefoa needs a loan to buy more tools to assist with her business such as a wheelbarrow, mistblower, cabbage cans, spade, chemicals, bushknives, and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Aimalefoa will use the profits from her sales to support her family and buy things needed for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a  wheelbarrow, mistblower, cabbage cans, spade, chemicals, bushknives, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Asopaepae

texts.en: Asopaepae is 34 years old and married with three children. She grows and sells tomato, cabbages and cucumber in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and is very experienced with this type of business. Asopaepae needs a loan to buy more tools for her farming such as wheelbarrows, chemicals, rakes, mistblower, and bush knives. She plans to use her profits for her children's education. Asopaepae has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, chemicals, rakes, mistblower, and bush knives

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en: Fofoga is a 42-year old married woman with five children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She is also producing printed lava lavas (men's clothing) to be sold to the public. She has been doing this for four years. Fofoga needs a loan to pay for her children's education and to assist with her plantation and elei (fabric printing) business. She needs things such as chemicals, fertilizers, fabric, fabric paint, and brushes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Fofoga will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, fabric, fabric paint, and brushes and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
El señor Maximino tiene 45 años, es casado, vive con su señora y sus 2 hijos en la ciudad de Ybycuí, uno de sus hijos tiene 18 años, quien está empezando sus estudios universitarios y otro con 12 años, aún en edad escolar.
Muy joven había ido a la Argentina para trabajar y de esa manera pudo comprarse primeramente un terreno, donde edificó para su casa y posterior a eso empezó a juntar dinero para volver a su país y montar una pequeña despensa, que actualmente ya tiene, y se ha ido formando una buena clientela, a quienes ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, verduras, artículos de limpieza, entre otras cosas varias.
El préstamo que pide el Sr. Maximino es para la compra de productos varios, como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar, yerba mate, verduras, artículos de limpieza y varios.
texts.en:
Sr. Maximino is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in the city of Ybycuí. One child is 18 years old and will be starting at the university. The other child is 12 years old and is still in school.

As a young man, Maximino went to Argentina for work. This allowed him to buy a plot of land where he could build a house. Upon achieving that goal, he began saving enough money so that he could return to his homeland and open a small food pantry that he is managing at the moment. Maximino has been able to establish a good clientele and is able to offer them basic necessity goods, vegetables, cleaning supplies, and other items.

The loan that Sr. Maximino is requesting will be used to purchase various products such as rice, noodles, sugar, herbal beverages, vegetables, cleaning supplies, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, herbal beverages, vegetables, cleaning supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Pialo

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 28ans et mère de 02 enfants âgés de 06 et 04ans tous scolarisés. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses derniers, elle revend des biscuits, omo, des détergents et autres produits de façon ambulante depuis 2005. Son second crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère réinvestir dans son activité en ouvrant une boutique et aider ses enfants à s'épanouir.
texts.en: Pialo is a young 28-year-old woman and mother of two children, aged 6 and 4 years old, both in school. To support the needs of these two, she has resold biscuits, Omo and other detergents, and other products on foot since 2005. Her second loan will allow her to buy more merchandise to better respond to the needs of her clients. She hopes to reinvest in her business by opening a boutique, and to help her children fulfill their potential.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, Omo and other detergents, and other items

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a rope-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear (clothing). Elsie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado de educación. Esta acompañada desde hace 3 años no tiene hijos aun, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería y también a  la agricultura en casa del cliente solo viven 2 personas.  Ella y el esposo de ella.


María se dedica al negocio informal de venta de ropa de casa en casa. En la comunidad donde vive. Se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 5 años, también, tiene como ingreso adicional el trabajo de doméstica en casa de personas que le buscan para realizar trabajos. Po los cuales le pagan. El recorrido que realiza para la venta de sus productos son de 7 kilómetros a pie y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar ropa de niño, de hombre y mujer. El préstamo le ayudara a surtir su negocio y podrá tener un mejor ingreso,  lo que permitirá cubrir algunas necesidades  puntuales que tiene.

Ella  sueña con abrir un negocio en su casa,  ya que actualmente le toca salir a vender fuera de su casa y cuando las condiciones del  clima son complicadas se le dificulta mucho. Actualmente el cliente no tiene hijos con su pareja, pero sueña con tener una  familia y poder ofréceles una vida digna. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar  sus ingresos y la ayudara a tener un mejor negocio. La cliente pretende ampliar su negocio poniendo otros productos a la venta.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old, and she has attended school up to the fifth grade.  She has been with her partner for three years, and she does not yet have children.  Her partner works in construction and also in agriculture. Only she and her husband live in her house. 

María has an informal business, selling clothing door to door in the community where she lives. She has been engaged in her business for five years.  She earns extra income doing housework for clients who seek her out and pay her to clean their houses.  

She sells her products on foot, following a route of 7 kilometers for 5 hours daily.  The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is for the purchase of clothing for children, women, and men.  The loan will help her to stock her business and she will be able to have a better income, which will allow her to meet some of her needs. 

She dreams of opening a business in her home, as currently she must leave the house to make her sales, which is difficult when the weather is bad.  Currently the client and her partner do not have any children, but she dreams of having a family and being able to offer them a decent life. The loan will help her to improve her income and have a better business. The client hopes to expand her business, offering other products for sale.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for children, women, and men.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas  de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado debido a la situación económica de su familia , esta acompañado, su esposa trabaja en una pequeña tienda, tienen tres hijos, todos asisten a la escuela.

Tomas se ha dedicado a la caficultura toda su vida, desde la edad de 10 años trabaja junto a su padre, ahora cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de café, las cuales cuida durante todo el año para que la producción sea estable.


El préstamo sera utilizado para la preparación del almacigo para café donde producirá alrededor de 300 plantas de café.


El sueño de Tomas es producir mas café, así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien, se preparen y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Tomas is 34 years old. He went to school up to the ninth grade because of his family's financial situation. He is married and his wife works in a little store. They have three children and all of them are in school.

Tomas has worked in coffee culture all of his life. Since he was 10 years old he worked with his father, Now he grows 14,000 square meters of coffee. He takes care of them all year round so his production will be stable. 

The loan will be used to prepare seedling trays for coffee. He will produce around 300 coffee plants. 

Tomas' dream is to produce more coffee. This way, he will improve his family's quality of life and help his children become educated and get ahead.

loans.use: to prepare seedling trays of coffee and produce around 300 coffee plants.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a maried woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Anita has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to pay for internet and electric bills.

Anita has been in this business for 15 years. Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for internet and electric bills

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María de 71 años de edad, solo estudio hasta hasta 4° grado por la sutiación económica que vivia su familia, esta soltera y tiene 3 hijos quienes ya están acompañados 

Maria,  toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por ello es una mujer con deseos de superarse, trabaja en una tortillera de donde logra obtener ingresos para seguir adelante.


El crédito sera utilizado para reparar la vivienda, ya que se encuentra con partes averiadas, lo que pone en riesgo sus vidas.

Lo que mas desea es tener salud para tener las fuerzas para trabajar.
texts.en:
María is 71 years old. She only went to school through the 4th grade due to the financial situation that her family had. she is single and has 3 children who are married.   

For her whole life, Maria has worked very hard to get her children ahead. Because of that, she is a woman who wants to get ahead. She works in a tortilla shop to earn income to get ahead.  

The loan will be used to repair her house. It is in disrepair and is putting their lives at risk.
