What she wants the most is to be healthy to be strong enough to work.

loans.use: to repair her house, which is in disrepair and puts their lives at risk.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Belinda is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Belinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Belinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Belinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, meat, spices and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y comidas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan,
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her restaurant business. She has been in this line of work for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business. She prepares breakfasts, lunches, and snacks for all of her customers who place orders with her.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, rice, and other items. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and other supplies.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está en unión libre, vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de herramientas y equipo que requiere para que le ayuden y le puedan facilitar el trabajo en las obras de construcción principalmente de casas de habitación y aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones  y al estar trabajando con personas con mayor experiencia  y años de estar en la actividad y mucho tiempo de práctica y poder tener  mejores ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra para la misma actividad y además de lograr algunas metas personales, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a las construcciones, además de aumentar la cantidad y calidad de los trabajos realizados. Con esta compra pretende hacer más casas y con diseños más variados y así cumplir con los pedidos por los clientes. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and lives with his wife and children who are his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy tools and equipment, which will help to facilitate his work in the construction sector. He builds primarily houses, a skill that allows him to take advantage of the knowledge he acquired through his training. Luis Alberto has been in this line of work for years and has worked with people who have much more experience. Over time, he has been able to practice his craft and is now able to generate better earnings. As a result, Luis Alberto is able to continue investing in his business activity. He also wants to accomplish some personal goals, as well as be able to build homes that have better finishes. Luis Alberto can also increase the quantity and quality of his work.

With the purchase of this equipment, he intends to build more houses in various designs so that he can fulfill the requests of his customers. This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Luis Alberto has not received any other loans from the state banks, so FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for his construction work.

loans.name: Edgar Leonel

texts.es:
Edgar estudio hasta 9° grado, esta acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 4 años el cual asiste al kinder. 

Toda su vida ha trabajado en panaderias, empezo limpiando latas y embolsando pan, ahora elabora toda clase de pan y sale a vender en su motocicleta, se levanta a las  5:00 am para comenzar con sus labores diarias.


El crédito sera utilizado para comprar, latas, mesas para moldear el pan, harina, huevos, azucar, levadura, bolsas, para instalar su negocio de panadería, ya que cuenta con todos los conocimientos para ello.

Su sueño es tener una panadería grande, que su negocio cresca mucho, para así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar has a ninth grade education.  His wife is a homemaker and they have a four-year-old son who attends kindergarten.

All his life he has worked in bakeries and began by cleaning trays and packaging the bread.  He gets up at 5:00 a.m. to start his workday.

The loan will be used to buy baking trays, tables to make the bread, flour, eggs, sugar, yeast and bags for his bakery business, since he has all the expertise for the job.

His goal is to have a large bakery one day and for business to increase so he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy baking trays, tables to make bread, flour, eggs, sugar, yeast and bags to set up a bakery.

loans.name: Elarmin

texts.es: Elarmin, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de San José de Colinas, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hace 3 años ha obtenido otros ingresos vendiendo helados como paletas, conos, cremas de varios sabores de leche y frutas. El préstamo es el sexto ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va poder comprar mas productos helados como paletas, conos, cremas para surtir y aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es llegar a tener un local solo para vender helados y tener empleados que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Elarmin, 44, is married and has four children.  He lives in a village in the municipality of San José de Colinas, Santa Bárbara and used to work in agriculture growing corn and beans.  But three years ago he began earning a living selling frozen products such as popsicles, cones and ice cream in different dairy and fruit flavors.

This loan is his sixth, and in the amount of 15,000 HNL.  He will use it to buy popsicles, cones and ice cream to stock his business and increase sales.  His goal is to have his own ice cream shop one day and have employees to help him.

loans.use: To buy frozen products such as cones, popsicles, ice creams, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand and gravel, and to hire workers to build a room.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yobana ella es conviviente, tiene 30 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como leche, azucar, arroz, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cajas de leche para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tejidos de chompas, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de restaurante, venta de mates, venta de verduras.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Las Palmeras" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Yobana, 30, who is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells basic staples such as milk, sugar and rice.  She is a responsible, dedicated person when selling to her customers; and this is how she earns a living to provide for her family. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy boxes of milk for her business.

The other members work in crafts, knitting of sweaters, taxi service, restaurant business, tea sales, and vegetable sales.

The members in the individual photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work commitments.  The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank.

Yobana is grateful to everyone taking part in her dream through this loan and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy buy boxes of milk for her business.

loans.name: Kevin Edemir

texts.es:
Kevin de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, esta acompañado, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años su esposa es comerciante.

Kevin trabaja desde la edad de 15 años, la actividad que conoce y realiza es de panificador, de donde obtiene los ingresos para mantener a su familia.


El crédito sera invertido para colocar una tienda en su casa, de esta forma obtendrá otra fuente de ingreso y cubrir los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de kevin es tener una tienda, y gracias al crédito lo esta cumpliendo, ahora solo necesita poner solo el esfuerzo en la tienda para que esta ayude con los ingresos de su casa, de esta forma podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Kevin, 27, has a sixth grade education.  He is married and has two children, ages three and six.  His wife is a merchant.  

Kevin has worked since the age of 15 and his expertise is in bread making, which is how he earns an income to support his family.

He will use the loan to set up a store at home so he can earn extra income to cover household expenses.  Kevin's dream is to open a store and thanks to the loan he is meeting his goal.  Now he only needs to direct his efforts at the store so it can earn more income for the household and improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To set up a store in his house.

loans.name: Mentari Group

texts.en: The first loan for the group Mentari is complete. It went well and good. The members of the group completed the loan smoothly and without a hitch. Loans from Kiva really mean a lot to the development of their businesses. The loan is very helpful for the business and increases the family income. Therefore, the group plans to take a second loan from Kiva for each member's retail store. Heriyani, the leader of this group, is remarkable because she provides encouragement to the members so that they can make their payments well. She has a business selling snacks to stalls or to the schools. She also opened a refreshment stall for ice juice. The benefits of this loan from Kiva mean very much to her life with her husband and their three children. This loan will be used to enable Heriyani to open a shop and buy cookware. She, on behalf of the group Mentari, says thank you very much to lenders who have helped in the development efforts of the members of the group.

loans.use: to open a shop and to buy cookware

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is thirty-eight years old, married and a resident of Silanga, Tangub City, Mizamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a contractor. They have five children, of which two are in school. Starting with 6,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits that the co-op gives her. She became a member in January 2014. 

Now she is applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, oil and sugar. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart. She will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: restock her store with basic commodities like rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Egleseria

texts.en:
Egleseria is fifty-nine years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is married with one child. 

Egleseria works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for fifteen years. She has requested a loan to buy "banyeras" (big basins) of fish to sell. 

Egleseria  has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, she hopes to increase her family's livelihood to sustain its needs.

loans.use: to buy "banyeras" (big basins) of fish to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is fifty-nine years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is married with five children.
 
Conchita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fish nets.
Conchita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Conchita hopes to increase her family's livelihood to sustain its needs.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is fifty-three years old and married with seven children. Three of them are currently in school.

Caridad is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Caridad has been in pig fattening for twenty-nine years now. She has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Caridad would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business. Catalina has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Cloudimit

texts.en:
Cloudimit is 53 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are currently in school.

Cloudimit is in the pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Cloudimit has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Cloudimit has been in this business for 10 years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cloudimit would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Clydie

texts.en:
Clydie works hard to support her family. Clydie is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Clydie has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

Clydie has been in this business for four years now.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Clydie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Maria camila  nació en un hospital con los esfuerzos de la madre y recibida en el hogar de los abuelos maternos con mucho amor.
Después de seis meses dichosos con los abuelos se mudo a el nuevo hogar donde vivía junto con la mama y el nuevo  compañero sentimental de la mama, quien con el paso de los años se convirtió en un padre para Camila, ya que se dedico a cuidar de ella incondicionalmente.
Después de dos largos y felices años al hogar llego una nueva hija con quien Camila compartió buenos momentos.
Cuando Camila llego a cierta edad  tuvo que empezar a estudiar en un colegio donde juiciosamente se fue formando, un año después cuando Camila se encontraba cursando segundo de primaria llego otro hermanito al hogar, a quien Camila acogió con mucho amor, otro año después la mama de Camila decidió que debería empezar a trabajar ya que se había dedicado mucho tiempo al hogar, este hecho le enseño a Camila a formarse muy independiente, lo cual llevo a que antes de que terminara el  bachillerato empezara a estudiar un técnico en auxiliar de enfermería, el cual se encuentra estudiando actualmente.
Ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes, ella desea tener el convenio de kiva para a si poder terminar este técnico el cual le ha gustado bastante y seria una ayuda muy grande en el futuro, ya que puede ayudar a los papas económicamente.
texts.en:
Maria Camila was born in hospital with her mother's efforts and received with much love in her mother's parents' home. After six happy months with her grandparents she moved to a new home where she lived together with her mother and her mother's new partner, who with the years became like a father to Camila, as he cared for her unconditionally. After two long and happy years in this home a new daughter arrived, with whom Camila shared many good times.

When Camila reached a certain age she had to start studying at school, where she sensibly went on learning. One year later, when Camila was in her second year of elementary school, another little brother arrived in the home, who Camila embraced with much love. Another year later Camila's mother decided that she should start working, as she had dedicated a lot of time to the home. This act taught Camila to become very independent, which lead her to start studying a vocational nursing assistant course before finishing high school. She is currently studying this course.

As she doesn't have sufficient economic resources, she hopes to have an agreement with Kiva to be able to finish this course, which she has really enjoyed and which would be a great help in the future, seeing as she would be able to help her parents economically.

loans.use: to pay one semester's registration.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman who is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsa is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elsa has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Elsa has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, seasonings, etc. for her food-production business.

Elsa has been in this business for two years. Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, noodles, cereal, soft-drinks, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for one year. 

Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, noodles, cereal, soft drinks, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS,el socio tiene 47 años de edad,el socio se dedica al negocio de agencia de viajes, él socio vende diferentes tipos de paquetes turísticos a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicos como personales, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
EL socio solicito el crédito para la compra de boletos, ingresos entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ruben belongs to the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" communal bank. He is 47 years old and has a travel agency. Ruben sell tourist packages. He is responsible and determined. He has had the business for some time and is satisfied both personally and financially in his work as it allows him to get ahead with his family.

Ruben is applying for this loan in order to buy tickets and other items.

Ruben is grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tickets and other items.

loans.name: 36 Chiến Thắng Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Luyến is 44 years old and she is married with three children. Luyến is the group leader of the 36 Chiến Thắng Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives in Hau Loc, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp. Luyến has been involved in this business for nine years. The main hardship that Luyến faces in her business is a lack of capital. 

Luyến is applying for a loan to purchase shrimp to resell. This is Luyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Luyến hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp for resale.

loans.name: 10 Minh Thắng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Phương is 32 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 10 Minh Thắng Minh Lộc solidarity group. 

Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp. Phương has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase shrimp to resell. This is Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to take a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp to resell.

loans.name: 06.08.03 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thắng is 56 years old and is married with three children. Thắng is the group leader of the 06.08.03 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thắng operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thắng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks to resell.

In 2013, Thắng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thắng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase drinks to resell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. The fellowship group is also a place she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
La socia Yessenia pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia tiene 39 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa ,la socia vende a sus amistades ,familiares,clientes entre otros ,la socia trabaja a pedido,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez trabaja en una agencia de viajes, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yessenia is a member of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 39 years old, married and has two children. As well as doing the household chores, Yessenia has a business selling clothes. She sells on order to friends, relatives and other customers. Yessenia has had the business for some time now and it is going well thanks to her determination. Yessenia also works in a travel agency, which helps her to prosper with her family.

Yessenia is applying for this loan in order to buy jumpers for her business.

Yessenia is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy jumpers for her business.

loans.name: 04-09-06-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Tuấn has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to resell.

Tuấn is 54 years old and single with 2 children.  Tuấn is the group leader of the 04-09-06-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tuấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuấn has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Tuấn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuấn hopes to buy a motorbike.  She also hopes that her family is healthy and happy, and that her business does well.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell.

loans.name: Kathia Danelia

texts.es: La señora Kathia, casada madre de dos niñas, las dos estan pequeñas, su esposo es conductor de una Mototaxi que es propia la cual le genera ganancias, ella por su parte se dedica a la actividad comercial, vende frutas y verdura en el mercado, su familia cosecha y ella aporvecha los frutos para obtener ganancias, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Matriales como, bloques, cemento, Arena, hierro, ya que su casa es de mini falta y desea cerrarla toda de bloques, agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le esta brindando.
texts.en: Kathia is married and a mother to two young daughters. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi, which he owns and which generates an income. Kathia herself makes a living selling fruits and vegetables and the market. Her family grows the products and she uses them to make a profit. Kathia will use this loan to buy materials such as bricks, cement, sand and iron as her house needs to by closed off with bricks. Kathia is grateful for the support provided by Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es: Celia, siendo madre soltera saco adelante a sus hijos quienes hoy en día son independientes y mayores de edad, el sustento de ella es su actividad comercial que realiza como costurera, solicita el crédito para realizar parte del muro exterior de su vivienda y mejorar el techo del porche, gracias al financiamiento podrá comprar los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, laminas de zinc, de esta manera Celia va mejorando por partes su hogar.
texts.en: As a single mother, Celia helped her now adult and independent children to get ahead. Celia supports herself as a dressmaker. She is applying for this loan in order to build an external wall at her house and to improve the porch roof. Thanks to this loan Celia will be able to buy materials, such as cement, sand, iron and laminate zinc sheeting. With these goods, Celia can improve her house bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and laminate zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her business' income is helping to cover her family's everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profits. Her business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and cover her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Loida dreams that her business will last much longer and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 47 years old and married with six children.

Edwina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 12 years. She also earns an income from vegetable vending and e-loading (mobile prepaid loads). 

Edwina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Edwina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Edwina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Foliga

texts.en:
Foliga is 34 years old with 3 children. She owns and operates a small store where she sells grocery items. She has been doing this for 4 years. Foliga needs a loan to buy cement and iron roofing to renovate her shop.  She also needs to purchase mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, tin fish, corned beef, snacks, biscuits, and soaps to restock her shop. 
She hopes to use her profits to support her children's education and save some to reinvest back into her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, tin fish, corned beef, snacks, biscuits, soaps, etc to restock shop.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира как и многие жители Республики Таджикистана решила начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства, который принесет ее семье источник дохода и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Назира на скотном дворе будет выращивать скотин. Ей будет помогать ее дочери и брат. У Назира намерена на заемные деньги купить корм для скотин и скотов, а коровник и сарай у нее имеется. Назира обещает выплачивать кредит в срок. Для нее сейчас очень важна финансовая поддержка.
texts.en: Like many people who live in Tajikistan, Nazira has decided to start a new livestock business to earn money and improve her family's financial situation. She will raise cattle in a barn with the help of her brother and her daughter. Nazira already has a barn and shed and plans to use the loan to buy cattle and feed. She promises to pay the loan on time. Financial support is very important to her right now.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a livestock business

loans.name: Perenise

texts.en:
Perenise is a 38-year-old married woman with five children. 

She operates a taxi business and has been running this for three years. 

Perenise needs a loan to purchase new tyres, windscreen wipers, headlights, oil, petrol and vehicle service maintenance for her taxi and chemicals, knives, and a blade sharpener for her plantation as well. 

She will use her profits to help assist in her family's immediate needs and save the rest for necessities. Perenise joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase new tyres, windscreen wipers, headlights, oil, petrol, vehicle service maintenance, chemicals, knives, and blade sharpener.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 45 years old and blessed with four children who are attending school. 

She helps her husband in gaining income to sustain their daily necessities and support the education of her children. As a way of generating income, they help each other in grinding coconuts for sale. 

They aim to continue and improve this business but they have limited capital. For this reason, Mary Ann is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more coconuts to grind and sell in the local community. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help for them to strengthen their business.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to grind and sell.

loans.name: 3.20.1013.5.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hậu operates a rice mill business. She is requesting a loan to purchase a rice mill to use for work.

Hậu is 37 years old and married with 2 children.  Hậu is the group leader of the 3.20.1013.5.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2009, Hậu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hậu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hậu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a rice mill to use for work.

loans.name: 04-11-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to resell.

Liên is 34 years old and married with 2 children. Liên is the group leader of the 04-11-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liên's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Liên hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Maria Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing and raising pigs. Maria Lourdes is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries like snack food, sardines, noodles, sugar and other miscellaneous items for her general store business.

Maria Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries like snack food, sardines, noodles, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married. She has two children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: Don cesar, es un señor que se dedica a trabajar como albañil, solicita el crédito porque necesita construir el muro perimetral del lado sur de su vivienda ya que habita en un barrio de Managua altamente peligroso, con esta obra el pretende brindarle seguridad a su esposa e hijos, así como también ir acondicionando su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en: Cesar is a construction worker. He is asking for a loan to build a perimeter wall on the south side of his house, as he lives in a neighborhood in Managua that is highly dangerous. He wants to provide his wife and children with better security, and to little by little improve the structure of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, wire cord.

loans.name: Ma. Regine

texts.en:
Ma. Regine previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. Her earnings were important for her children’s education and their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She is applying for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Regine dreams to have an additional source of income and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week.  She draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: En la Grecia antigua, el médico era un sacerdote al culto de Dios y su actividad profesional se limitaba a vigilar que en los santuarios se recogieran las ofrendas y donativos de los pacientes, se cumplieran con los rituales religiosos prescritos y quizás ayudar a algún enfermo incapacitado a sumergirse en el baño correcto. Doña Norma, una Señora de 45 años de edad, dedica sus esfuerzos a su pequeño negocios de venta de gaseosas, dulces y confites, nos confianza que desea realizar la construcción  de un baño sanitario en su hogar. Nos remarca que su meta más próxima remodelar su casa y posterior su negocio. Solicitando un crédito para la construcción de un servicio sanitario que presente excelentes condiciones higiénicas que el que posee hoy en día. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que mejorara sus condiciones de vida. Teniendo como planes futuros una pequeña  inversión en su local de negocio para ponerle un piso de barro y de igual forma la construcción de un nuevo servicio sanitario en local para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: In ancient Greece, doctors were priests serving the gods and their professional work was limited to watching over the sanctuaries and receiving the offerings and donations of patients.  They performed prescribed religious rituals and perhaps helped disabled patients to submerge themselves in the right bath.  Norma is a 45 year old women who dedicates herself to selling soft drinks, sweets and candies.  She tells us that she wants to build a health bath in her home.  She remarks that her next goal is to remodel her house and then her business.  She is asking for a loan in order to build a health service that will offer high quality hygienic conditions, better than what she can currently offer.  She estimates that the credit will be of great help because it will improve her living conditions.  Her future plans are to make a small investment in her business in order to get a better floor, and also to guild a new health service in order to bring better care to her customers.

loans.use: To build a health service space in her home.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, una mujer pujante y luchadora de 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con empeño, dedicación y mucho esfuerzo.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente, pues quiso aprovechar el espacio que tenía disponible en su casa y comenzó a arrendar dos habitaciones, inicialmente sus clientes eran transportadores que llegaban a cargar o descargar mercancía en la plaza de mercado de la zona, luego comenzó a prestar el servicio de arreglo de ropa y alimentación para los huéspedes, así fue generando ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y además logró adecuar otras habitaciones para tener mayor capacidad.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en unas adecuaciones del espacio (arreglar la cocina, los baños y las puertas de las habitaciones), esto le permitirá tener un espacio más confortable y agradable para sus clientes, lo que se percibirá en el incremento de sus ingresos.
Sandra manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es adquirir un local o una casa más grande para ampliar su capacidad instalada y tener más habitaciones para prestar sus servicios de hospedaje, así tendrá la posibilidad de estabilizar las finanzas familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
39-year-old Sandra is a determined, strong woman. She is married with 2 children, who have succeeded in life thanks to her dedication and hard work. She has been working independently for 15 years, since she wanted to take advantage of some available space in her home. She began renting two rooms. Initially, her customers were carriers who came to load or unload merchandise in the market square area, and then she began providing other services, such as garment repair and food, generating income to support her husband and lessen the financial burden of the household. She later on, managed to fix other rooms to increase her capacity.
She will invest this loan in room repairs (fixing the kitchen, bathrooms and bedroom doors). This will let her have a more comfortable and enjoyable space for her customers, which will allow her to increase her revenue.
Sandra said that her greatest desire is to acquire a store or larger space to expand her steady capacity and have more rooms to provide hosting services and have the ability to stabilize her family finances and improve the quality of life of her whole family.

loans.use: to make room repairs (fixing the kitchen, bathrooms and bedroom doors)

loans.name: Hugo Javier

texts.es: En la edad media durante su primer periodo el Derecho se regía por costumbre. En los años 466 al 511 el rey franco Clodoveo escribió un documento que prohibía el trono a las hembras (mujeres). En la actualidad el Señor Hugo cambiara totalmente la mentalidad que se regía en la edad media. Él es un Señor que la mayoría de su tiempo se dedica a su trabajo pero que no ha dejado a un lado el deseo de superación por lo que hoy en día cursa su quinto año de su carrera profesional para su superación personal. Solicita un crédito para el pago de su curso de titulación. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le ayudara alcanzar unas de sus principales sueños y metas. Sus planes futuros son lograr ejercer su carrera profesionalmente trabajando para un bufete jurídico.
texts.en: In the first half of the middle ages, law was a matter of customs and traditions.  Between the years 466 and 511 the King Franco Clodoveo wrote a document that prohibited women from serving on the throne.  Currently Hugo is working to change this type of mentality that operated in the middle ages.  He is a man who spends most of his time working but who has not given up on his desire to pursue a professional career in Law.  He is asking for a loan in order to pay for his course work.  He believes that the loan will help him reach his dreams and goals.  His future plans are to work in a law firm and to be a professional lawyer.

loans.use: To pay for law school course work.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia is 41 years old and married with 8 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as freezer goods and groceries. She has been doing this for 4 years. Sesilia needs a loan to buy a cooler for drinks, a freezer, cigarettes, sugar, flour, milk and chicken leg quarters for her store. She hopes to use her profits to assist in providing for her children's education needs and to reinvest some profit into her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for drinks, a freezer, cigarettes, sugar, flour, milk and chicken leg quarters.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 48 years old and married with 11 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Nora needs a loan to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, a knife sharpener and spades. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial support. Nora will use the profits from her sales to help support her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, a knife sharpener and spades.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga is a 56-year-old widow with 8 children. She wants to start a small business of making and selling popcorn and cooked noddles in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy corn seeds, noodles, plastic cups, plastic bags and flour. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and sell more goods. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, noodles, plastic cups, plastic bags and flour.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy cigarettes, candies, balut, quail eggs, crispy fried pork rind and other products. Her earnings were a big help in personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 34,000 PHP loan to buy cigarettes, candies, balut, quail eggs, crispy fried pork rind and other products. The more items displayed the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes to continuously expand her business and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cigarettes, candies, balut, quail eggs, crispy fried pork rind and other products.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school and office supplies and products to sell in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy school and office supplies and products to sell in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anita hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school and office supplies and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Diapale Sa Borom Keur Group

texts.fr: Diappalé sa Borom Keur  est le nom d’un groupe de crédit qui rassemble dix femmes habitant dans un petit village situé à environ 17 km de la ville principale. Ces femmes ont pour activité le maraîchage. Elles se réunissent et organisent des tontines  à chaque fin de mois. Leur présidente, la dame Khardiatta  est mariée et responsable puisse qu’elle participe à  la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Agée de 45 ans, elle évolue dans l’agriculture et fait du maraîchage. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des semences, du gaz oïl et des intrants pour la pratique du maraîchage. Elle a une expérience de 20 ans dans cette activité et démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 16h .Dans l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter ses surfaces cultivables et diversifier ses intrants et elle aimerait aussi  avoir sa propre autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Diappalé Sa Borom Keur Group is made up of ten women who live in a small village located approximately 17 km from the main city. These women are garden farmers. They get together and setup tontines at the end of each month.

Their president, Mrs. Khardiatta, is married and in charge, since she takes part in covering the daily expenses of her household. She's 45 year old and a garden farmer.

She's seeking this loan to buy seeds, diesel fuel, and fertilizers for her farming activities. She has 20 years of experience in this business, and starts her day at 8 a.m. to finish it at 4 p.m. 

In the future, she wishes to increase her cultivable area and use other fertilizers, and she would also like to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy seeds, diesel fuel, and fertilizers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Due to financial hardships, Catherine aims to improve her small retail store to increase her income. She is 39 and has two school age children. She and her husband wanted to become financially stable in order to educate their children and give them a better life. Having inadequate capital, Catherine wants to take out a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase more stock of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. Having patience and strong determination, they believe that they will achieve their goals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lisper

texts.en:
Lisper is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a person with entrepreneurial skills. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, rice and other items. Her business is located in an area that is good for the business and her primary customers are individuals. 

Lisper describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a well stocked shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of cooking fat, rice and other items

loans.name: Nemwel

texts.en:
Nemwel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a business where he repairs shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are individuals. 

Nemwel describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances to buy materials. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stock of materials for repairing shoes and to pay fees for his children. He hopes that in the future, he will have a shoe shop. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of materials for repairing shoes and to pay fees for his children

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a 36-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined and hopeful. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are small-scale ones. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of permanent place for doing business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 58, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Narciso, a welder, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Josefina is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers, sell them per container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

She hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a better life. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy the products needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. The income from her business is assisting with her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of dressed chickens needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rodita hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of a peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of dressed chickens needed in her business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers and other materials needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and the children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miguela dreams to be able to buy another lot to expand her farm. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda previously accessed a 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she utilized to buy more fruits needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlinda dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Lyne works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials. In the future, Lyne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Nida has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family. Merlina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sugar, cooking oil, bananas, etc. to sell.

Merlina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, bananas, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bemelyn

texts.en:
Bemelyn is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. 

Bemelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bemelyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bemelyn has been raising pigs for 17 years now and has borrowed twenty-two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Bemelyn would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 45 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Divina has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for five years and also earns income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 61 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Tessie has a business making and selling sack bags in the Philippines. Tessie requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business.

Tessie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Tessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business of making and selling sack bags.

loans.name: Jacquilyn

texts.en:
Jacquilyn works hard to support her family. Jacquilyn is married and has a buying and selling of used clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Jacquilyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jacquilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 44 years old, a married mother of one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Chona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Chona has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Primrose

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Primrose works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Primrose is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Primrose has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices etc

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is 48 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Herminigilda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Herminigilda has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Herminigilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tania Lisseth

texts.es:
Tania de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como ayudante de mecánico, no tienen hijos, actualmente viven con la mamá.


Ella tiene posee una tienda en la que vende de todo tipo de ropa para niños, damas caballeros etc. Cuando el negocio está mal para la venta, se dedica a vender cocteles de frutas, los que ella prepara, ya tiene cinco años de realizar esta actividad, la necesidad la llevo a iniciar una fuente de ingreso independiente; por lo que decidió poner el negocio, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedica, antes de independizarse le ayudaba a su madre con su negocio. La distancia que recorre es aproximadamente un kilómetro, se desplaza a su puesto en el mercado en una moto taxi, su esposo cuando no está trabajando se involucra en la actividad, la venta la realiza de 6 am a 12 md.

El préstamo será invertido en terminar de construir su casa, ya que no cuenta con techo, puertas y un piso digno, el mejoramiento será que tendrán su propio espacio como pareja.

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que se da a conocer cada vez más, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad de terminar de construir su casa,  la ganancia de la tienda será invertido en el pago de la cuota, y en el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Tania is 20 years old and has a ninth-grade education. Her partner works as a mechanic's assistant, and they have no children. They currently live with her mother.  Tania runs a store in which she sells all kinds of clothing for men, women, and children. When business is slow, she makes and sells fruit cocktails. She has five years of experience running these businesses, which she started out of a need to have an independent income. She's not involved in any other lines of work. Before she started doing this, she helped her mother with her business. She travels about a kilometer to her work by motortaxi. When her husband isn't working, he helps her at her work, which she runs from 6:00am until 12:00 midnight.

This loan will be used to finish building their house, which doesn't yet have a roof, doors, or a sturdy floor. These improvements will mean that they have their own space as a couple.

She dreams of being able to expand her sales and improve her income, little by little. The loan will help her meet her immediate need to finish building her house. Her earnings from her store will be invested in paying back the loan and in sustaining her family.

loans.use: install a roof, doors, and flooring in her house

loans.name: Patricia Gerardina

texts.es:
Patricia, tiene una hija, vive con sus padres, posee una tienda en su casa en la que abastece de productos de primera necesidad a los residentes de la zona, el oficio lo aprendió junto a su mamá y es con dicho negocio que tiene a su disposición los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos y colabora con sus padres en los gastos familiares.
Comprará papel higiénico, detergentes, jabón, arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, boquitas, gaseosas, jugos, dulces, etc., todo lo necesario para tener a sus clientes satisfechos, incrementar las ventas, mejorar sus ganancias con las que cancelara sus cuotas y contribuirá en los gastos de su familia.
Su visión es reforzar las bases de su negocio para continuar trabajando y ahorrar para ofrecer a su hija un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her parents and her daughter. She runs a store out of her house in which she stocks household necessities for the residents of the area. She learned the work alongside her mother. With this business she earns the money to cover her expenses and, along with her parents, meet the household's needs.

She will purchase toilet paper, detergent, soap, rice, beans, sugar, salt, snacks, sodas, juices, candy, and more - everything she needs to keep her customers happy, increase sales, and improve her earnings. She will use the money she earns to repay the loan and contribute to the family's expenses. Her vision is to reinforce her business, continue to work, and save money to offer her daughter a better future.

loans.use: stock her general store with merchandise.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado, su pareja es la que le apoya en la actividad productiva que él realiza, tienen un hijo de cuatro años, y uno que viene en camino, ya que la esposa está embarazada. Nadie más vive con ellos.

Víctor se dedica al comercio de atol y poleada, ya tiene cuatro años de realizar la actividad, la necesidad de ingresos económicos  al núcleo familiar, lo llevo a tomar acciones y a iniciar una actividad productiva. También  se dedicaba a la agricultura, la distancia que recorre diario es de unos 20 metros, ya que donde realiza el comercio le queda a pocos metros de su casa, la forma de venta lo hace en los buses que recorren por la zona, su esposa es la que le ayuda a preparar la venta, el horario que tiene es de 5 am a 9 am.

Lo que comprara será materia prima para elaborar su producto, harina, leche, arroz, azúcar, etc., el mejoramiento será el que tendrá un ahorro en los gastos, ya que compraría por mayoreo, la necesidad satisfecha será el ya no andar comprando por pocos.

Sueña ir poco a poco creciendo las ventas y la clientela, irse preparando desde ya, económicamente para cuando  su primer hijo empiece la escuela, y nazca el otro, tener una estabilidad para él y los suyos. Las ganancias serán dirigidas  un porcentaje al pago de la cuota y lo demás a la  inversión  a la casa y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Victor is 28 years old. He studied through the sixth grade, he is married, and his partner supports him in his work. They have a four-year-old son and a baby on the way. No one else lives with them.

Victor is in the business of selling atol and poleada, two drinks made from rice flour. He has four years of experience doing this; economic necessity and the need to provide for his family drove him to take action and start a business. He is also involved in farming. He sets up his business about 20 meters from his house and does is work selling on the buses that pass through the area. His wife helps him prepare for his sales, and he works from 5:00am until 9:00am.

He will use the loan to purchase the ingredients he needs to make his product: flour, milk, rice, sugar, and more. The benefit will be that he can save on his expenses since he will purchase at wholesale. The demand he meets is such that he doesn't need to go buying a little at a time.

He dreams of growing his sales and his customer base a little at a time. He's preparing now for when his oldest child starts school and the little one is born, hoping to have economic stability for them. His earnings will be used to repay the loan and the rest will go into investing in his house and savings.

Sueña ir poco a poco creciendo las ventas y la clientela, irse preparando desde ya, económicamente para cuando  su primer hijo empiece la escuela, y nazca el otro, tener una estabilidad para él y los suyos. Las ganancias serán dirigidas  un porcentaje al pago de la cuota y lo demás a la  inversión  a la casa y el ahorro.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make rice-flour drinks for sale

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ailene works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Ailene is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

Ailene has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 54 years old and married with six children. For the past 26 years, she has run a food-production business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jelita is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Msanide

texts.en:
Msanide lives in a rented house with his wife and 9-year-old son. He is 32 years old and currently works very hard to support his family through his Zoona mobile money transfer business.

Msanide feels fortunate to be connected to Kiva lenders. He started his business of mobile money transfers back in 2012 after receiving his first small loan from Kiva. The Kiva funding enabled him to rent his shop, buy two phones to use for transactions, and provided start-up working capital. After successfully repaying his loan, Msanide received a second loan that enabled him to increase his customer base by adding more liquidity to his business, which in turn increased his revenue.  

By gaining access to micro-loans through Kiva, Msamide says the quality of his life has significantly improved. His son is in third grade with all his school fees paid on time and Msamide was able to move his family into a better house. 

Now, Msanide is requesting a third Kiva loan to purchase a small trading booth, which he will use to serve customers at his new money transfers location. Msanide is excited to be expanding his business operations by opening a new outlet.

loans.use: to purchase a small trading booth to use to serve customers at his new money transfers location

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel  de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos a quienes con mucho amor cuida todos los días para sacarlos adelante 

Raquel es una persona trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora, apesar que tiene una enfermedad, nunca ha perdio la esperanza de salir adelante. Posee  una pequeña tienda y a la vez venta de tortillas.


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar mas mercadería, como arroz, frijoles, azucar, detergentes, sopas, pan, etc.  y surtir aun mas la tienda,  con lo cual garantiza tener mas fuerte la tienda y que sus ingresos mejoren.

El deseo de Raquel es tener salud, ya que de esta manera, podrá seguir  apoyando a sus hijos, ademas se esforzara para que  estudien y se preparen para enfrentar las adversidades de la vida.
texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old, and she has studied up to the 9th grade. She is a single mother, and she has two children whom she cares for with much love every day, in order to raise them. Raquel is a person who is hardworking, and above all, enterprising. Although she has an illness, she has never lost the hope of moving forward. 

She has a small store and she also sells tortillas. The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, detergents, soup, bread, etc., and to stock her store even more. This will guarantee that it will be much stronger, and that her income will improve.

Raquel’s desire is to be healthy, as in this way she will be able to continue supporting her children, in addition to striving so that they study and be prepared to face adversities in life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as rice, beans, sugar, detergents, soup, bread, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana de 24 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado debido a la situación económica de su familia, tiene una hija de cuatro años, pero es madre soltera, así que ella cubre con todos los gastos del hogar.
Desde que dejo los estudios ha  trabajado como ama de casa, de esta forma logra tener ingresos para cubrir con sus necesidades de su hija, su horario de trabajo es de 7: am a 4: pm de lunes a sábado

El préstamo sera utilizado para la reparación del techo de su vivienda. 

Su sueño es sacar adelante a su hija, trabajar mucho para que tenga lo necesario y sobre todo que su hija se prepare academicamente para que no afrente las dificultades que ella ha tenido que enfrentarse.
texts.en:
Roxana is 24 years old. She has studied up to the 9th grade, owing to her family’s economic situation. She has a four-year-old daughter, but she is a single mother, so she covers all of the household expenses. 

Since she gave up her studies, she has worked as a housekeeper, and in this way she manages to have an income to pay for her daughter’s needs. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday to Saturday.  The loan will be used for repairing the roof of her home.

Her dream is to raise her daughter and to work very much so that she will have what she needs; and above all, so that her daughter will be prepared academically so that she will not have to face the difficulties that she has had to face.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Deisy Yovana

texts.es:
