Ella es Deisy Yovana, decidió estudiar la carrera de auxiliar de enfermería porque es algo que desde muy niña ha despertado en ella sentimientos de energía y entusiasmo  y que a los  padres desde el momento de generar la opción les ha parecido una buena oportunidad para hacer en un futuro, por tal motivo ella decidió salir de la vida cotidiana y llegar a la ciudad a buscar futuro como muchos llegan en el momento con el apoyo de padres, hermanos y demás familia. ella ha decidido estudiar esta carrera, para así mas adelante poder ayudar a la familia económicamente y también para después de ella haber terminado esta carrera poder ayudarse para continuar los estudios, ya que el propósito es estudiar medicina y poder ser una gran profesional, poder pagar con el acto profesional ayudando a más personas que en el momento lo necesiten, desde un principio ha pensado que el ayudar a una persona es más que recetar un medicamento o un ungüento para un dolor, ella afirma que la enfermería es una carrera que acopla conocimiento y sentimientos el tener un contacto con los sentimientos del paciente el entender que el siente como cualquier ser humano y tratar de comprender dolor como algo que no solo se calma con un medicamento, quizá muchas veces será con entendimiento, compresión y atención. 
Ella pretende llegar a ser una profesional reconocida ayudando a la familia y a quien lo requiera, poder emprender una carrera estable y exitosa con la certeza de que el esfuerzo, emprendimiento y dedicación la llevaran a cumplir todas las metas y propósitos que tenga. 
Finalizando ella pretende que los principios la ayuden a ser esa profesional que desea, pretende que al momento de presentar un cartón no sea manejada como una mas si no como una gran persona la cual muchos pelean por conocer y tener en los hospitales para poder mantener o superar una acreditación.
Ella le interesa el convenio de kiva ya que los recursos económicos son limitados y no cuenta con la cantidad completa para poder realizar el pago de las cuotas mensuales, ella no quiere dejar de estudiar y con el convenio de kiva ella podría terminar eta carrera y cumplir todos los sueños que ella tiene, los planes que quiere cumplir con la familia y con ella misma
texts.en:
This is Deisy Yovana, who decided to study to become a nurse's aid. Ever since she was a little girl, the idea has energized and enthused her. To her parents as well, it also seemed like a good opportunity and way for her to make her future. With this motivation, she left her ordinary life to come to the city, as so many others have, with the support of her parents, her brothers and sisters, and all the rest of her family.  She decided to enter this career so that later on, she can help her family economically and also so that after she's finished, she can continue studying medicine and become a true professional, helping people at the time when they need it most. Right from the start, she thought that helping someone was more than prescribing a pill or salve for the pain. Being a nurse, she says, is a career that joins both knowledge and the feeling of being truly in contact with a patient, of understanding that he is a person who feels like any other. It is a career that understands that pain is not only treated with medicine, but rather many times just as well with understanding, compassion, and attention.

She is working towards becoming a recognized professional who helps her family and anyone else who needs it, towards having a successful, stable career, understanding that with hard work and dedication, she can reach all of her goals. With these principles in mind, she can become the professional she wants to be. When they give her her diploma, she won't be just one in the crowd, but one that hospitals compete to know and to have toward their accreditation. 

She is turning to Kiva as her own economic resources are limited and she doesn't have all the money she needs to make her monthly tuition payments. She doesn't want to leave school, and Kiva's support will help her to finish her studies and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 54-year-old married woman, living with her six children in the area of Lahore. Her son owns a wheat and grain-selling store; he buys the wheat from harvesters at a low price and sells in Lahore city to retailers. He has been doing this same practice for many years and has many customers who like to buy grains and wheat from him in large quantity. In this tenure he has built up a positive relationship among the customers. 

With the increment in new customers and higher demand, he wants to buy more stock on a daily basis, so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income and savings and could cherish his own family's well-being.
   
Hameedan praises honorable supporters; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy grains and wheat for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her business. The income from her business is assisting her everyday needs. She works hard to provide for her everyday needs and be able to help her parents and siblings.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business, like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennelyn hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her siblings will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business, like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en: Leilani is a 33-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She operates an Elei printing business, selling items to the public and around her community. (Elei printing is done on cloth with stencils and fabric paint.) She has 3 years of experience with this business. Leilani has requested a loan to buy fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes and stencils for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials, fabric paints, brushes and stencils.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be good with clients. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is a 46-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 to 20. For the past two years, Lenah has operated a bookstore. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small-scale. Lenah describes herself as determined. Her biggest business challenge is low returns. This will be Lenah’s first loan with SMEP DTM.

Lenah is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of books to sell. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. Lenah will use the anticipated profit from her loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy books to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy all the planting materials needed on her farm. The income from her business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm. The profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gertrudes dreams to have a vehicle that will be used in her business and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita runs a nursery. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials such as wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. Lolita’s earnings have been a big help for her family’s personal, household, and business expenditures.

Lolita is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan to buy gardening materials such as wire, baskets, seeds, and fertilizer for her business. The profits from her loan will definitely help her sustain her family’s daily needs and she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, Lolita dreams of buying other kinds of plants to expand her business. As a CCT community partner, Lolita attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she also draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for wire, baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines  and also earns additional income from a buy and sell charcoal business.  Clarita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 63 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, rice, canned goods and other groceries. In the future Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle used in her motorcycle transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Cresencia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing and raising pigs. Cresencia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past fourteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marygn

texts.en:
Marygn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Marygn has been in this business for 4 years. Marygn earns additional income from a buy and sell rice business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 5 children. Her husband has been working at a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Nasreen is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g , needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and also will help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Madelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Madelyn requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food production business.

Madelyn has sustained her business activities through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 42 years old and is married with five children, all of whom are in school. For the past four years, she has been raising pigs. Rosalina has borrowed two previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Rosalina is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 28 years old and a married women. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his taxi because its current condition is not good and requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make the repairs. Therefore, Saima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Saima's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Saima also plans to start saving with the profit earned by her husband's business to meet her family's needs in the future.

Saima is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 35 years old and is a responsible house wife living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband runs a general store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. He meets his household expenses with earnings from his own store.  His relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a calm tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and personality, he has good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town this helps the business to run well. 

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Sadia requests a loan for her husband so that he can buy wheat, rice, flour, soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits. Sadia thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Sadia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way. This amount will help him to meet the demand.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits for the general store.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband. He owns a spare parts shop in which he sells motorbike spare parts such as silencers, fuel tanks, foot rests, wheels, tires, tubes etc. Her husband supplies the spare parts to other shopkeepers also. The spare parts shop is their single source of income. Her husband estimated his future expenses and came to know that he needed to grow his business so that he can easily cope with future expenses. Therefore, Abida has requested a Kiva loan to help her husband. She hopes that he will be succeeding in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Crizelda

texts.en:
Crizelda is a responsible mother who owns and manages a small retail store within her community. She is 41 years old and has three children who attend school. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she wants to generate a higher income from her store.  She does not have sufficient capital and asks for 13,000 PHP to buy bread, canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. She believes that she will be able to improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy  bread, canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has been an ex-abroad for ten years.  She is 49-years-old and a single parent with one child.  Anita has operated a rental eatery and mini-grocery for 11 years.  With her sacrifices and strong determination in life, she was able to support her child's education who is now a fifth year college student studying dentistry. Aside from her eatery and mini-grocery, she also manages five hectares of a corn farm for an additional source of income. She aims to let her child finish her dentistry course, improve her sales and successfully pay for the lot she acquired.  Anita is requesting additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items, raw meat, vegetables and cases of soft drinks to sell. She hopes that lenders will grant her the requested loan amount to be able to have a better way of living and make her business a stable source of family income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, raw meat, vegetables and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ma. Lanie

texts.en:
Ma. Lanie is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future Ma. Lanie would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 31 years old and  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a shoe shop to sell a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturers and sells them from his shop. He has been selling men's shoes but now wants to offer ladies' shoes as well. He wants to meet customers' demands but has insufficient funds.

Therefore, Azra requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy ladies' shoes. 

Azra is very happy and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 5 children. Her husband has worked in the public sector  for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shaheen provides sewing services to earn income to help her husband meet the household expenses. 

She needs needles, threads, fabric, and machine oil for business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her to purchase these items and help  her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo has been working in farming since he was a young boy. He learned the trade from his father and grandfather, who instilled good principles and values in him. This work has led Nilo to becoming very well-known and respected in the community. He has spent 15 years working in farming and it has become his main source of income since he sells almost 50% of his harvests, while he keeps the rest for his family. Nilo's workplace is far from his house and one of his sons also helps him from 7am to 1pm.

This loan will be used to start to prepare Nilo's land. With the farming season soon to start, Nilo needs to buy fertilizer and rice seed since he is going to begin growing rice. By doing this, he can diversify his work, giving him a greater income from selling the harvests. He can then use this income to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed since he is going to begin growing rice.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a 42-year-old married woman from Deir el Balah city. She has five sons and three daughters. Her husband is a construction worker with a low and unstable income. Yousra helps her husband to pay the family's  expenses. 

She sells children's clothing and cosmetics door-to-door and is a very hard worker. 

Yousra requests a loan from FATEN to buy more clothing and cosmetics for her business. The loan will help increase her sales and improve her income. 

Yousra would like to open a store to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics for her business to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 37-year-old single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be enterprising. 

Esther operates a retail business where she sells clothes and bags. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low season. Esther will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes and bags. Her business goal is to have more shops within 5 years. Esther hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her tenth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 200,000 KES were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other shops.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes and bags

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 27-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, bread, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of items she sells.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar and other items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thankful for previous financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy necesssary beauty and hair products for her salon. Her loan helped her business and also to educate her children. Her business income helps to meet the family's daily household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy beauty and hair products. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes to expand her business and  improve the quality of their living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and  draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself as confident. 

He operates a retail business to sell wheat flour, drinking water and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a conducive environment. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as low income. He will use 20,000 KES to buy wheat flour, drinking water and other items. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. 

This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, drinking water and other items.
